monsters.name: Abominable Yeti
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.desc: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.desc: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 (6d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The yeti exhales a 30-foot cone of frigid air. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Aarakocra
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Dive Attack
traits.desc: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage to the target.

actions.name: Talon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Summon Air Elemental
actions.desc: Five aarakocra within 30 feet of each other can magically summon an air elemental. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain {@status concentration} while doing so (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within 5 feet of it can return with it.

traits.name: Dive Attack
traits.desc: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage to the target.

traits.name: Simulacra
traits.desc: When a simulacrum drops to 0 hit points or is subjected to a successful dispel magic spell (17), it reverts to ice and snow and is destroyed.

actions.name: Talon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Summon Air Elemental
actions.desc: Five aarakocra within 30 feet of each other can magically summon an air elemental. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain {@status concentration} while doing so (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within 5 feet of it can return with it.

monsters.name: Aarakocra Spelljammer

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The aarakocra is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The aarakocra has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield

monsters.name: Aartuk Elder

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The aartuk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aartuk makes two Branch attacks, two Radiant Pellet attacks, or one of each.

actions.name: Branch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Radiant Pellet
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (4d4) radiant damage.

bonus_actions.name: Tongue (Recharge 6)
bonus_actions.desc: The aartuk tries to use its gooey tongue to snare one Large or smaller creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is grappled by the tongue (escape 14) and pulled up to 25 feet toward the aartuk. The tongue can grapple one creature at a time.

spells: The aartuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Aartuk Starhorror

traits.name: Spider Climb

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (2d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Radiant Pellet
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +2 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 7 (3d4) radiant damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rally the Troops (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The aartuk magically ends the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of itself.

bonus_actions.name: Tongue (Recharge 6)
bonus_actions.desc: The aartuk tries to use its gooey tongue to snare one Medium or smaller creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is grappled by the tongue (escape 11) and pulled up to 25 feet toward the aartuk. The tongue can grapple one creature at a time.

monsters.name: Aberrant Spirit
monsters.ac: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)
monsters.languages: Deep Speech, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Regeneration (Slaad Only)
traits.desc: The aberration regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Whispering Aura (Star Spawn Only)
traits.desc: At the start of each of the aberration's turns, each creature within 5 feet of the aberration must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take 2d6 psychic damage, provided that the aberration isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aberration makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Eye Ray (Beholderkin Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 150 ft., one creature. 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel psychic damage.

actions.name: Claws (Slaad Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the aberration's next turn.

actions.name: Psychic Slam (Star Spawn Only)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel psychic damage.

monsters.name: Aberrant Zealot
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., truesight 10 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Aberrant Form
traits.desc: The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the zealot must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Weirdly Pliable
traits.desc: The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zealot makes one Psychic Rend attack and two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Psychic Rend
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the stunned condition until the start of the zealot's next turn.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Void Warp (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The zealot teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself, leaving a churning void in the space it left. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 30 feet of the void other than the zealot must make a 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) force damage and is pulled to the unoccupied space closest to the void. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. The void then disappears.

spells: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

actions.desc: The zealot magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the stunned condition on itself on a success.

On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) force damage and is pulled to the unoccupied space closest to the void. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. The void then disappears.

spells: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

monsters.name: Abhorrent Overlord

traits.name: Insatiable Greed
traits.desc: The abhorrent overlord can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abhorrent overlord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abhorrent overlord makes two attacks with its claws.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The abhorrent overlord regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt if the target is a creature.

actions.name: Storm of Crows (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
The abhorrent overlord conjures a swarm of spectral crows and harpies in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the overlord can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere remains for 1 minute or until the overlord loses {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell), and its area is lightly obscured and difficult terrain.
Any creature that moves into the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 16 (3d10) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The abhorrent overlord's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Abjurer Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Force Blast
actions.desc: Each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from the abjurer must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the abjurer. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

reactions.name: Arcane Ward (Recharge 4-6)
reactions.desc: When the abjurer or a creature it can see within 30 feet of it takes damage, the abjurer magically creates a protective barrier around itself or the other creature. The barrier reduces the damage to the protected creature by 26 (4d10 + 4), to a minimum of 0, and then vanishes.

spells: The abjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation

spells.2/day each: dispel magic, lightning bolt, mage armor

spells.1/day each: arcane lock, banishment, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, wall of force

monsters.name: Abyssal Chicken
monsters.speed: 30 ft., fly 30 ft. (see bad flier below)
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 9

traits.name: Bad Flier
traits.desc: The abyssal chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abyssal chicken makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Adult Amethyst Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 45 (10d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Explosive Crystal (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon spits an amethyst that that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (3d8) force damage and be knocked prone.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.1/day each: blink, control water, dispel magic, protection from evil and good, sending

traits.name: Magic Resistance

actions.name: Tail

actions.name: Frightful Presence

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dracolich's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dracolich exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.desc: The dracolich makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dracolich makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dracolich beats its tattered wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dracolich must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. After beating its wings this way, the dracolich can fly up to half its flying speed.

monsters.name: Adult Oblex
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this distance), passive Perception 14

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oblex makes two pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Eat Memories
actions.desc:
The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.
While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from its ability checks and attack rolls. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends.
The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

bonus_actions.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
bonus_actions.desc: The oblex extrudes a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 1d4 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. The simulacrum is an extension of the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

spells: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.3/day each: charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern

monsters.name: Advanced Detention Drone
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
monsters.languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.desc: The drone is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The drone regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.desc: A spellcaster who wears the drone's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Detention Orb
actions.desc: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

reactions.name: Shield
reactions.desc: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

traits.desc: The allip can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The allip doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Maddening Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

actions.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of the allip that can hear it must make a 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage, and it is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

actions.name: Whispers of Compulsion
actions.desc: The allip chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the allip's choice that the allip can see. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the allosaurus moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the allosaurus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.desc: The almiraj has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

traits.name: Familiar
traits.desc: With the DM's permission, the find familiar spell can summon an almiraj.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Alseid

traits.name: Hide in Plain Sight
traits.desc: The alseid has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while it is in grassland.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The alseid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The alseid makes two radiant touch attacks.

actions.name: Radiant Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) radiant damage.

spells: The alseid's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.1/day each: calm emotions, lesser restoration, plant growth

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The altisaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The altisaur makes one Stomp attack and one Tail attack. The altisaur can't make both attacks against the same target.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 33 (7d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 22 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 45 (8d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 20 feet horizontally from the altisaur.

monsters.name: Amber Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Ambitious Assassin
monsters.languages: Common, thieves' cant, plus any one language

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the assassin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The assassin makes two Poison Blade attacks.

actions.name: Poison Blade
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: When an attacker the assassin can see hits the assassin with an attack, the assassin halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary_actions.name: Cunning
legendary_actions.desc: The assassin escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled condition on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The assassin makes one Poison Blade attack.

legendary_actions.name: Vanishing Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The assassin creates a sudden distraction, such as a cloud of disorienting smoke or flash of dazzling light, filling a 10-foot cube within 5 feet of the assassin. Each creature of the assassin's choice in that area takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage, and the assassin has the invisible condition. This invisibility lasts until the end of the assassin's next turn.

monsters.name: Ambush Drake
monsters.languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The drake has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the drake's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the drake surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Amethyst Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) force damage.

actions.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (5d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.1/day each: protection from evil and good, Tenser's floating disk, unseen servant

monsters.name: Amethyst Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft. (hover), swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 26, +18 to hit with spell attack):

spells.1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

monsters.name: Amnizu
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the amnizu's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The amnizu uses Blinding Rot or Forgetfulness, if available. It also makes two Taskmaster Whip attacks.

actions.name: Taskmaster Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Blinding Rot
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one or two creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and be blinded until the start of the amnizu's next turn.

actions.name: Forgetfulness (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The amnizu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 26 (4d12) psychic damage and become stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is stunned for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm
reactions.desc: When a creature within 60 feet of the amnizu makes an attack roll against it, and another creature is within the attack's range, the attacker must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including the amnizu or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw is successful, the attacker is immune to the amnizu's Instinctive Charm for 24 hours.

spells: The amnizu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 19):

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The amphisbaena makes two attacks, only one of which can be a constrict attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the anarch can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The anarch deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Spiked Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands.

monsters.name: Anchorite of Talos

traits.desc: The anchorite can use its action to polymorph into a boar or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Clawed Gauntlet (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tusk (Boar Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The anchorite's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.1/day each: augury, bless, lightning bolt (8d6 damage), revivify

monsters.name: Ancient Deep Crow
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ancient deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the ancient deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Mandibles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ancient deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Caw
actions.desc: The ancient deep crow releases an ear-splitting caw. Each creature within 60 feet of the crow and able to hear it must make a 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The deep crow makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Shadow Caw (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The ancient deep crow uses Shadow Caw.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The ancient deep crow beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the deep crow must succeed on a 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The ancient deep crow can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monsters.name: Ancient Deep Dragon
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 300 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Change Shape

actions.name: Nightmare Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (9d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Commanding Spores
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, or the target can't take a reaction, it takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Spore Salvo (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases poisonous spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 28 (8d6) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Blessing of the Sea (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the dragon turtle would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 350 hit points, and it recharges its Steam Breath. Additionally, the dragon turtle can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 62,000 XP (124,000 XP total) for defeating the dragon turtle after its Blessing of the Sea activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon turtle doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon turtle makes one Bite or Tail attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (1d12 + 9) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) lightning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail

actions.desc: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 24 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon turtle makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon turtle moves up to its speed. If the dragon turtle is swimming, this movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Until the start of the dragon turtle's next turn, whenever a creature starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon turtle, that creature must succeed on a 24 Constitution saving throw or take 40 (9d8) fire damage. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

spells.1/day each: detect thoughts, dispel magic, etherealness, major image, mislead

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Claw

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a blast of frost in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonus_actions.name: Phase (3/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains {@status concentration} on the effect (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the dragon has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Treacherous Ice
legendary_actions.desc: Magical ice covers the ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point the dragon can see within 120 feet of itself. The ice, which is difficult terrain for all creatures except lunar dragons, lasts for 10 minutes or until the dragon uses this legendary action again.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 12 (1d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)

actions.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Dream Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

actions.name: Moonlight Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a beam of moonlight in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Tunneler

actions.name: Debilitating Breath (Recharge 5-6)

On a failed save, the creature takes 55 (10d10) thunder damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

legendary_actions.desc: The dragon chooses one Medium or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried that it can see within 60 feet of it, and it magically hurls the object at a creature it can see within 60 feet of the object. The target must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 42 (12d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.1/day each: dissonant whispers, hold monster, meld into stone, telekinesis, teleport

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 13 (1d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the sea serpent and knocked prone.

actions.name: Rime Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The sea serpent exhales a 60-foot cone of cold. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 49 (9d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Each creature in the sphere must make a 23 Constitution saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Blinding Brilliance (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon emits magical light in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in this area must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Ancient Time Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 30

traits.name: Cycle of Rebirth
traits.desc: If the dragon dies, its soul coalesces into a steely egg and teleports to a random plane of existence. The egg is immune to all damage and hatches into a time dragon wyrmling after 1d100 years. The dragon retains all memories and knowledge it gained in its previous life.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 90-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, it has the poisoned condition, and other creatures have resistance to all damage it deals. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

actions.name: Time Gate (1/Day)
actions.desc: The dragon conjures a 20-foot-diameter, circular portal in the space between its horns or in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The portal links to a precise location on any plane of existence at a point in time up to 8,000 years from the present, whether past or future. The portal lasts for 24 hours or until the dragon's {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is transported to the destination, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by the dragon from opening in the rulers' presence or anywhere within their domains.

reactions.name: Reactive Rend
reactions.desc: After using Legendary Resistance or in response to being hit by an attack roll, the dragon makes one Rend attack.

reactions.name: Slow Time
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature the dragon can see ends its turn, the dragon targets a creature it can see within 90 feet of itself that is weakened by its Time Breath. Until the weakened effect ends on the target, its speed becomes 0, and its speed can't increase.

reactions.name: Time Slip
reactions.desc: The dragon halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker. The dragon can then immediately teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

legendary_actions.desc: The dragon targets a creature or an object not being worn or carried that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 40 (9d8) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it crumbles to dust.

spells.1/day each: antilife shell, bane, control water, create or destroy water

monsters.name: Angry Sorrowsworn
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: The sorrowsworn has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Rising Anger
traits.desc:
If another creature deals damage to the sorrowsworn, the sorrowsworn's attack rolls have advantage until the end of its next turn, and the first time it hits with a Hook attack on its next turn, the attack's target takes an extra 19 (3d12) psychic damage.
On its turn, the sorrowsworn has disadvantage on attack rolls if no other creature has dealt damage to it since the end of its last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sorrowsworn makes two Hook attacks.

actions.name: Hook
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The anhkolox doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The anhkolox makes two Claw attacks and one Entrapping Rend attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet in a horizontal direction of the anhkolox's choice.

actions.name: Entrapping Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 23 (5d6 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, the target must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be trapped in the anhkolox's rib cage and grappled (escape 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the anhkolox can't use Entrapping Rend on another target.

monsters.name: Animated Armor Detention Drone
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The drone is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the drone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the drone remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of drone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drone makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Detention Orb
actions.desc: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

monsters.damage_resistances: damage of the type matching the animated breath's form (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison)
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Chromatic Form
traits.desc: When created, the animated breath takes one of five forms, matching its creator's breath weapon: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. This form determines the creature's AC, damage resistance, traits, and attacks.

traits.name: Fire Aura (Fire Form Only)
traits.desc: At the start of each of the animated breath's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Putrid Aura (Acid and Poison Forms Only)
traits.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the animated breath must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The animated breath makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) damage of a type determined by the animated breath's form: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

bonus_actions.name: Lightning Burst (Lightning Form Only)
bonus_actions.desc: The animated breath magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of the animated breath after it teleports takes 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The broom doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The broom makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Broomstick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Animated
traits.desc:
If the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the object is securely attached to a surface or larger object, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0.
When the animated object drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.
The DM might rule that a specific objects slam attack inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

monsters.name: Animated Staff
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Wielder Domination
traits.desc:
A creature can grab the staff out of the air with a successful grapple check against the staff, and grappling the staff does not reduce the creature's speed. Any creature that successfully grapples the staff must succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed by the staff until the staff is no longer in its grasp. While the creature is charmed, the staff can issue commands to it, which the creature does its best to obey. The creature can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that successfully resists the staff's control can't be charmed by it for 24 hours.
A creature holding the staff that isn't charmed by it can use an action to attempt to break the staff over a knee or against a solid surface, doing so with a successful 17 Strength (Athletics) check. Breaking the staff in this manner destroys it.

actions.name: Staff of Frost
actions.desc: The staff has 10 charges. It can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells (save 12): cone of cold (5 charges), fog cloud (1 charge), ice storm (4 charges), or wall of ice (4 charges). It regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If the staff expends its last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff turns to water and is destroyed.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage plus 1 cold damage.

source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The table is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the table must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the table remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal table.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the table moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.desc: If destroyed, the tile creature regains all its hit points and becomes active again in 24 hours unless at least half its tiles are collected and kept separate from the rest of the creature's tiles.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Narrow Dodge
reactions.desc: When targeted by a melee attack, the tile creature can take a reaction to turn its narrowest aspect toward the attacker. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Animated Wand
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

traits.name: Animated
traits.desc:
If the wand lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the wand is securely attached to a surface or larger wand, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0.
When the animated wand drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original wand form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original wand form.
The DM might rule that a specific wands slam attack inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

actions.name: Wand of Wonder
actions.desc: The animated wand can expend 1 of its charges and target a random creature with one of its wand of wonder. Any such effect that would target the wand's user targets the wand instead. If reduced to 0 hit points, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

If the target is prone, the animatronic allosaurus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target 18 (4d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Recorded Mimicry
traits.desc: The raptor can mimic any sound, including voices, it has heard in the last 24 hours. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If Aphemia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Aphemia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Aphemia makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Bite

actions.name: Claws

actions.name: Discordant Song
actions.desc: Aphemia shrieks a cacophony of magical sounds. Each humanoid within 120 feet of her must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her until the song ends. A frightened creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the start of its turn while Aphemia is singing. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Aphemia's Discordant Song for the next 24 hours. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

actions.name: Grave Calling Song
actions.desc: Aphemia intones a low, growling magical melody. Every undead within 300 feet of her must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall under her control until the song ends. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing, and she can mentally command the undead under her control as part of the same bonus action. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

traits.name: Keen Smell

actions.name: Multiattack

monsters.name: Arasta
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

traits.name: Armor of Spiders (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If Arasta is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she regains 200 hit points. In addition, Arasta's children immediately swarm over her body to protect her, granting her 100 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Arasta fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Arasta has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Arasta can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: Arasta ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Arasta makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage, and the target must make a 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 32 (5d12) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Web of Hair (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Arasta unleashes her hair in the form of webbing that fills a 30-foot cube next to her. The web is difficult terrain, its area is lightly obscured, and it lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that moves into the web or that starts its turn there must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained while in the web. A creature can use an action to make a 21 Strength check. On a success, it can free itself or a creature within 5 feet of it that is restrained by the web. This webbing is immune to all damage except magical fire. A 5-foot cube of the web is destroyed if it takes at least 20 fire damage from a spell or other magical source on a single turn.

legendary_actions.name: Claws
legendary_actions.desc: Arasta makes one attack with her claws.

legendary_actions.name: Swarm (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Arasta causes two swarm of spiders to appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of her.

legendary_actions.name: Toxic Web (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature restrained by Arasta's Web of Hair takes 18 (4d8) poison damage.

mythic_actions.desc: If Arasta's mythic trait is active, she can use the options below as legendary actions, as long as she has temporary hit points from her Armor of Spiders.

mythic_actions.name: Swipe
mythic_actions.desc: Arasta makes two attacks with her claws.

mythic_actions.name: Web of Hair (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: Arasta recharges Web of Hair and uses it.

mythic_actions.name: Nyx Weave (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: Each creature restrained by Arasta's Web of Hair must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw, or the creature takes 26 (4d12) force damage and any spell of 6th level or lower on it ends.
