actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: The goblin found a magic item (a necklace of fireballs, a circlet of blasting, or the like) and learned how to use it.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Borborygmos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.desc: Borborygmos has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: Borborygmos deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Borborygmos can use his Frightful Presence. He also makes two attacks: one with his maul and one with his stomp.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 28 (6d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +13 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of Borborygmos's choice that is within 60 feet of him and can see or hear him must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Borborygmos's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Borborygmos makes a weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Bellow (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Borborygmos yells menacingly at one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. That creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. If the creature is already frightened, it becomes stunned instead. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Borborygmos's Bellow for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Wide Berth (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Borborygmos moves up to half his speed and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time Borborygmos enters a creature's space during this move, the creature must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from Borborygmos. If the saving throw fails, that creature is knocked prone, and Borborygmos can make a stomp attack against it.

monsters.name: Bore Worm
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The worm regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The worm makes two attacks: one with its grinding jaws and one with its stinger.

actions.name: Grinding Jaws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must make a 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Boss Augustus
monsters.speed: 40 ft. in wolf or hybrid form
monsters.languages: Common, Thieves' cant (can't speak in wolf form)

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Augustus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Augustus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Augustus wields a +2 Longsword.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Augustus makes any combination of two Bite, Claw, or Magic Longsword attacks.

actions.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the werewolf stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

actions.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Magic Longsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: Augustus polymorphs into a wolf-humanoid hybrid, a wolf, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

bonus_actions.name: Cunning Action
bonus_actions.desc: Augustus takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monsters.name: Boss Delour
monsters.speed: 30 ft. in rat or hybrid form
monsters.languages: Common, Thieves' cant (can't speak in rat form)

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If Delour is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Nimbleness
traits.desc: Delour can move through the space of a Medium or larger creature.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Delour regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Delour dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Delour makes any combination of three Bite, Shortsword, or Hand Crossbow attacks.

actions.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the wererat stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

actions.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: Delour polymorphs into a rat-humanoid hybrid, a Medium giant rat, or his humanoid form. His statistics, other than his size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his humanoid form if he dies.

bonus_actions.name: Cunning Action
bonus_actions.desc: Delour takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

monsters.name: Bozak Draconian

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away, and then its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Trident melee attacks or two Lightning Discharge attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Lightning Discharge
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

spells: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

traits.name: Fungal Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the trudge to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the trudge drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Tusk
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Brain Breaker
monsters.languages: telepathy 1 mile; understands Common, Deep Speech, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The brain breaker is aware of creatures within 1 mile of itself that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The brain breaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Telepathic Hub
traits.desc: The brain breaker can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The brain breaker can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The brain breaker makes two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 14) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The brain breaker can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Creatures of the brain breaker's choice within 60 feet of itself must succeed on a 17 Intelligence saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Link
bonus_actions.desc: The brain breaker targets one creature with the incapacitated condition that the brain breaker senses with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. Until the link ends, the brain breaker can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it no longer has the incapacitated condition, and the brain breaker can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful 17 Charisma check. If the target breaks the link this way, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. The link also ends if the target and the brain breaker are more than 1 mile apart. The brain breaker can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

spells: The brain breaker casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

monsters.name: Brain in a Jar
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius); see also "detect sentience" below, passive Perception 10
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Detect Sentience
traits.desc: The brain can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The brain doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 13 (3d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the brain's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against the brain until the end of the brain's next turn.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The brain magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 14 Intelligence saving throw or take 17 (3d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), detect thoughts, mage hand, zone of truth

spells.1/day each: compulsion, hold monster, sleep (3rd-level version), Tasha's hideous laughter

monsters.name: Brass Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Elemental Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 (13d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sapping Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Metallic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) thunder damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Braxat

traits.name: Intellect Fortress
traits.desc: The braxat's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The braxat makes two Greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The braxat exhales a 15-foot cone of acid. Each creature in the cone must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 26 (4d12) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Psionic Shield (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the braxat would be hit by an attack roll or a magic missile spell that originates from a source the braxat can see, the braxat can create an invisible barrier of magical force around itself that lasts until the start of its next turn. This barrier gives the braxat a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and prevents magic missile spells from damaging it.

spells: The braxat casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Breath Drinker
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The breath drinker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Radiant Absorption
traits.desc: When the breath drinker is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The breath drinker makes two Enervating Claw attacks. It can also use Drink Breath.

actions.name: Enervating Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape 18). The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Drink Breath
actions.desc: The breath drinker targets a creature that has the incapacitated condition or that the breath drinker is grappling and that isn't a Construct or an Undead. The target must make a 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage, and its Charisma score is reduced by 1d6. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If this reduces the target's Charisma to 0, the target dies. Until the breath drinker dies, the dead target can't be returned to life by any means short of divine intervention. On a successful save, the target takes half as much necrotic damage only. On a successful or failed save, the breath drinker regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The breath drinker has the invisible condition. This invisibility ends immediately after the breath drinker hits or misses with an attack roll or uses Drink Breath.

traits.name: Fungus Stride
traits.desc: Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within 5 feet and emerge from another within 60 feet of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

actions.name: Hallucination Spores
actions.desc: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
actions.desc: The bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a 10 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

monsters.name: Brigganock

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The brigganock has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

traits.name: Soul Light
traits.desc: The brigganock is accompanied by an insubstantial, invulnerable ball of light that contains its soul. The brigganock can't turn off the light or control its brightness. The soul light sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If the brigganock dies, its soul light fades away.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: Using a pickaxe or similar tool, a brigganock can burrow through solid rock at a speed of 5 feet, leaving a 6-inch-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Pickaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Time Lapse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The brigganock accelerates the passage of time around itself, enabling it to accomplish up to 1 hour of work in a matter of seconds. This work can't affect any creature other than the brigganock, or any object being worn or carried by another creature, and the activity must take place within a 10-foot cube. For example, the brigganock could use this action to rapidly carve a pumpkin, cook and eat dinner, move a pile of stones, or tie a dozen knots in a length of rope.

bonus_actions.name: Move Soul Light
bonus_actions.desc: The brigganock moves its soul light up to 30 feet in any direction to an unoccupied space it can see. At the end of the current turn, the light returns to the brigganock.

spells: The brigganock casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

spells.1/day each: animal friendship, faerie fire, meld into stone, silence

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If Antigonos moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.desc: Antigonos can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

traits.name: Decrepit State
traits.desc: Antigonos has disadvantage on his attack rolls.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Amphora
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If there is not already a creature inside the amphora, the target is restrained inside. As an action, the restrained creature can make a 14 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, escaping from the amphora on a success. The effect also ends if the amphora is destroyed. The amphora has AC 8, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

monsters.name: Bronze Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Elemental Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 (13d12) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sapping Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Metallic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) thunder damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Bronze Sable
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the sable remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The sable has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sable's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the sable surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sable makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Broom of Animated Attack
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: Constructed Nature
traits.desc:
An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The broom is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the broom must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the broom remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal broom.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The broom makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Broomstick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Animated Attack
reactions.desc: If the broom is motionless and a creature grabs hold of it, the broom makes a Dexterity check contested by the creature's Strength check. If the broom wins the contest, it flies out of the creature's grasp and makes a melee attack against it with advantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The scavver doesn't require air.

actions.name: Swallowing Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the scavver. The scavver can have one creature swallowed at a time.
A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the scavver, and takes 13 (3d8) poison damage at the start of each of the scavver's turns from the poisonous gas in the scavver's gullet.
If the scavver takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the scavver must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the scavver. If the scavver dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Brusipha

traits.name: Demonic Ritual
traits.desc: Brusipha can spend 3 hours performing a ritual that summons 1d3 + 1 barlguras or 1 hezrou. She must sacrifice a Medium or larger living creature to Baphomet during this ritual, and the ritual can be performed only at night. The demons vanish at dawn.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.desc: Brusipha can perfectly recall any path she has traveled.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Brusipha makes two Eldritch Blast attacks.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If Brusipha moved at least 10 feet straight toward the target immediately before she hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet from Brusipha and have the prone condition.

actions.name: Incite the Hunters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Brusipha allows each ally within 30 feet of herself that has the Unerring Tracker trait to make one weapon attack as a reaction against the target of that ally's Unerring Tracker.

bonus_actions.name: Unerring Tracker
bonus_actions.desc: Brusipha magically creates a psychic link with one creature she can see. For the next hour, Brusipha knows the current distance and direction to the target if it is on the same plane of existence. The link ends if Brusipha has the incapacitated condition or uses this ability on a different target.

reactions.name: Baphomet's Blessing
reactions.desc: When Brusipha reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, she gains 8 temporary hit points.

spells: Brusipha casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.1/day each: Bestow Curse, Command, Crown of Madness

monsters.name: Bugbear Chief
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

traits.name: Heart of Hruggek
traits.desc: The bugbear has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or put to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bugbear makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage at range.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.desc: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with both hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

traits.name: Rotting Presence
traits.desc: When any creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of the bulezau, that creature must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The bulezau's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The bulezau has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Barbed Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease ends. While poisoned in this way, the target sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin, and the target must repeat the saving throw after every 24 hours that elapse. On a successful save, the disease ends. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 4 (1d8). The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monsters.name: Bullywug
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.desc: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.desc: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its spear.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The croaker can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.desc: The croaker can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The croaker's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.desc: The croaker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Glaaar-pat (3/Day)
actions.desc: The croaker sings a song of marshy doom. Each chosen creature within 30 feet of the croaker that can hear the song must make a 12 Wisdom saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw also has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Rooooo-glog (1/Day)
actions.desc: The croaker sings an ode to an elder froghemoth. Each bullywug within 30 feet of the croaker that can hear the song gains 10 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The knight can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.desc: The knight can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The knight's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The knight makes two Glaive attacks.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Croak of Charming (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The knight makes a loud croak while targeting one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The royal can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the royal hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Frog Rider
traits.desc: The royal has advantage on melee attacks made while riding a frog mount.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.desc: The royal can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The royal's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.desc: The royal has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The royal makes two attacks: one with its royal spear and one with its bite.

actions.name: Royal Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Croaked Decree (1/Day)
actions.desc: The royal makes a loud pronouncement. Each bullywug within 60 feet of the royal that can hear the pronouncement has advantage on its next attack roll.

monsters.name: Burnished Hart
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the hart moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the hart or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The hart has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hart makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

actions.name: Antlers
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

traits.name: Bond of the Black Earth
traits.desc: The burrowshark is magically bound to a bulette trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on its bulette, the burrowshark shares the bulette's senses and can ride the bulette while it burrows. The bonded bulette obeys the burrowshark's commands. If its mount dies, the burrowshark can train a new bulette to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The burrowshark makes three melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

reactions.name: Unyielding
reactions.desc: When the burrowshark is subjected to an effect that would move it, knock it prone, or both, it can use its reaction to be neither moved nor knocked prone.

monsters.name: Cackler
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Last Laugh
traits.desc: When the cackler dies, it releases a dying laugh that scars the minds of other nearby creatures. Each creature within 10 feet of the cackler must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The cackler can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 11 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spiked Chain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The cackler's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The cackler can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Cadaver Collector
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The collector makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Specters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; 1d4 specter (without Sunlight Sensitivity) arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. The specters act right after the collector on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the collector is destroyed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cairnwight makes two Slam attacks or two Rock attacks, and it uses its Petrifying Touch if available.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Petrifying Touch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The cairnwight touches one creature it can see within 10 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or take 26 (4d12) force damage and have the restrained condition as it begins to turn to stone. The affected target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target has the petrified condition instead of the restrained condition.

monsters.name: Cambion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Fiendish Blessing
traits.desc: The AC of the cambion includes its Charisma bonus.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cambion makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fiendish Charm
actions.desc: One humanoid the cambion can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the cambion's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from the cambion or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the cambion, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cambion's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

spells: The cambion's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The cambion can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Campestri
monsters.languages: understands Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The campestri can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

actions.name: Head Butt
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spores (1/Day)
actions.desc: A 5-foot radius of spores extends from the campestri. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Canoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Dimensional Lock
traits.desc: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within 60 feet of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Uncanny Senses
traits.desc: The canoloth can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} unless it's incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The canoloth makes one Bite or Tongue attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

monsters.name: Canopic Golem
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Limited Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The golem automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 7th level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 27 (4d10 + 5) force damage.

actions.name: Crystal Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage.

reactions.name: Spell Deflection
reactions.desc: In response to a spell attack missing the golem, it causes that spell to hit another creature within 120 feet of it that it can see.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: The plant can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plant makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13) and restrained until the grapple ends. The plant has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.desc: The plant slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the plant's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

monsters.name: Carrion Crawler
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The carrion crawler makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Carrion Ogre
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Tied Down
traits.desc: While lashed to the floor, the creature is prone and restrained. It also suffers from two levels of exhaustion.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The creature makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The carrion stalker makes three Tentacle attacks. If it is attached to a creature, it can replace one Tentacle attack with Larval Burst, if available.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the carrion stalker attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the carrion stalker moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.
A creature can use its action to try to detach the carrion stalker and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful 11 Strength check. On its turn, the carrion stalker can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the carrion stalker detaches from any creature it is attached to.

actions.name: Larval Burst (1/Day)
actions.desc:
The carrion stalker releases a burst of larvae in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. A creature poisoned in this way takes 7 (2d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as larvae infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the poisoned condition instantly kills the larvae in the creature, ending the effect on it.
If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by the infestation, it dies. The larvae remain in the corpse, and one survives to become a fully grown carrion stalker in 1d4 weeks. Any effect that cures diseases or removes the poisoned condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the larvae.

monsters.name: Carrionette
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: False Object
traits.desc: If the carrionette is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the carrionette move or act, that creature must succeed on a 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the carrionette is animate.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The carrionette doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Silver Needle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or become cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it must roll a 1d4 and subtract the number rolled from each ability check or attack roll it makes.

actions.name: Soul Swap
actions.desc:
The carrionette targets a creature it can see within 15 feet of it that is cursed by its Silver Needle. Unless the target is protected by a protection from evil and good spell, it must succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or have its consciousness swapped with the carrionette. The carrionette gains control of the target's body, and the target is unconscious for 1 hour, after which it gains control of the carrionette's body. While controlling the target's body, the carrionette retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It otherwise uses the controlled body's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
If the carrionette's body is destroyed, both the carrionette and the target die. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the controlled body drives the carrionette out and returns the consciousness of both creatures to their original bodies. The swap is also undone if the controlled body takes damage from the carrionette's Silver Needle.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The krasis can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The krasis makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The krasis can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The krasis makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The krasis can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The krasis makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 33 (6d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

actions.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

monsters.name: Cave Badger
monsters.senses: darkvision 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 11

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: When the badger burrows, it leaves tunnels behind.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The badger makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Cave Bear
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.desc: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Retract Filament
actions.desc: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

bonus_actions.name: Adhesive Filament
bonus_actions.desc: The cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. The filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

monsters.name: Celestial Spirit
monsters.ac: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor) + 2 (Defender only)
monsters.languages: Celestial, understands the languages you speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The celestial makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Radiant Bow (Avenger Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 2d6 + 2 + summonSpellLevel radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Mace (Defender Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d10 + 3 + summonSpellLevel radiant damage, and the celestial can choose itself or another creature it can see within 10 feet of the target. The chosen creature gains 1d10 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
actions.desc: The celestial touches another creature. The target magically regains hit points equal to 2d8 + summonSpellLevel.

monsters.name: Centaur Mummy
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the centaur mummy moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The centaur mummy makes two melee attacks, one with its pike and one with its hooves, or it attacks with its pike and uses Dreadful Glare.

actions.name: Pike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.desc: The centaur mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, the target must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ceratops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ceratops makes one Gore attack and one Stomp attack.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) piercing damage. If the ceratops moved at least 20 feet in a straight line toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) piercing damage; if the target is a creature, it also must succeed on a 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet from the ceratops and have the prone condition.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Mushroom Portal
traits.desc: The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

traits.name: Poison Spores
traits.desc: Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within 5 feet of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chamberlain makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
actions.desc: The chamberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

traits.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
traits.desc: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

bonus_actions.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The champion regains 20 hit points.

monsters.name: Changeling
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.languages: Common, Dwarvish, Elvish, Halfling, Thieves' cant

traits.name: Change Appearance
traits.desc: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The changeling makes two attacks with its dagger.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of the changeling must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Chaos Quadrapod
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The chaos quadrapod has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chaos quadrapod makes up to two tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The chaos quadrapod can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

actions.name: Chaos Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The chaos quadrapod shoots forth a knot of roiling ethereal light that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a 14 Charisma saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Chardalyn Berserker
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Chardalyn Madness
traits.desc: The berserker must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the berserker does nothing on its turn except speak to a nonexistent, evil master whom it has pledged to serve.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The berserker attacks three times with a melee weapon.

actions.name: Chardalyn Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Chardalyn Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Chardalyn Dragon
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: the languages known by its creator

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon uses its Malevolent Presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail. If the dragon isn't flying, it can also make one attack with its wings.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Wings
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d4 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Malevolent Presence
actions.desc: Any creature with an Intelligence of 4 or more that is within 30 feet of the dragon must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Malevolent Presence for the next 24 hours. A creature charmed in this way fixates on another creature or object that the dragon mentally chooses and must, on each of its turns, move as close as it can to that target and use its action to make a melee attack against it. If the dragon doesn't choose a target, the charmed creature can act normally on its turn.

actions.name: Radiant Breath (Recharge 5-6)
