actions.desc: The dragon exhales a ray of radiant energy in a 120-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Chasme
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Drone
traits.desc: The chasme produces a horrid droning sound to which demons are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn with in 30 feet of the chasme must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. A creature that can't hear the drone automatically succeeds on the save. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to splash it with holy water. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the drone for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The chasme has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The chasme can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Proboscis
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (4d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. If this effect reduces a creature's hit point maximum to 0, the creature dies. This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until the creature finishes a long rest or until it is affected by a spell like  greater restoration.

monsters.name: Chimeric Baboon
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The baboon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage, plus an extra 3 (1d6) poison damage.

monsters.name: Chimeric Cat
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 13

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 slashing damage.

monsters.name: Chimeric Fox
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Chimeric Creation
traits.desc: The fox has fur that changes color to match its surroundings, giving it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Chimeric Hare
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Escape
traits.desc: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

monsters.name: Chimeric Rat
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Chimeric Creation
traits.desc: The rat has gills, iridescent scales, and the ability to breathe air and water.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Chimeric Weasel
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Chimeric Creation
traits.desc: The weasel has glowing eyes that emit bright light out in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The chitine has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the chitine to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The chitine ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chitine makes three Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

traits.name: Boneless
traits.desc: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The choker makes two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monsters.name: Choldrith

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

bonus_actions.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc:
The choldrith conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The choldrith can make a melee spell attack (+4 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 6 (1d8 + 2) force damage.
The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the choldrith can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.

spells: The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Chuul Spore Servant
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spore servant makes two pincer attacks.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (Escape 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the spore servant doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

monsters.name: Chwinga

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

actions.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
actions.desc: The chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within 5 feet of it. The target gains a {@filter supernatural charm|rewards|type=charm} of the DM's choice. See {@book chapter 7|DMG|7|Other Rewards} of the Dungeon Masters Guide for more information on supernatural charms.

actions.name: Natural Shelter
actions.desc: The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

spells: The chwinga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

spells.At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

monsters.name: Chwinga Astronaut

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a tiny pile of moondust, a cloud of glittering spores, a statuette resembling its former self, a chunk of ice, or a sponge shaped like a dodecahedron (DM's choice).

actions.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
actions.desc: The chwinga targets a Humanoid it can see within 5 feet of itself. The target gains a {@filter supernatural charm|rewards|type=charm} of the DM's choice. See {@book chapter 7|DMG|7|Other Rewards} for more information on supernatural charms.

actions.name: Natural Shelter
actions.desc: The chwinga takes shelter inside a rock, a bush, a tree, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while it is magically protected in this way, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

spells: The chwinga casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

spells.At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the cinder hulk dies, it leaves behind a cloud of cinders and smoke that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Any creature that moves into the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until it is dispersed by strong wind.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cinder hulk makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Wave of Cinders (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The cinder hulk emits a wave of smoldering ash from its face, hands, or chest in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 31 (7d8) fire damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

monsters.name: Clawfoot
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The clawfoot has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the clawfoot's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the clawfoot moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The clawfoot makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Climbing
traits.desc: The gladiator can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Steadfast
traits.desc: The gladiator can't be disarmed, and cannot make ranged attacks.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gladiator makes three melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the mutate is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the mutate has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mutate makes one Corpse Swipe attack and two Tail attacks, or it makes four Tail attacks.

actions.name: Corpse Swipe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a creature can't regain hit points.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Phantasmal Duplicates
bonus_actions.desc: The mutate magically projects up to four illusory copies of itself. These duplicates make it difficult to ascertain the mutate's true location and last until the end of the mutate's next turn. While the copies exist, attack rolls against the mutate are made with disadvantage.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Moan (Recharge 6)
bonus_actions.desc: The mutate lets out a moan charged with psychic energy. Each creature within 60 feet of the mutate that isn't an Aberration must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or take 17 (5d6) psychic damage and have the frightened condition until the end of the mutate's next turn.

monsters.name: Clockwork Behir
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Clockwork Bronze Scout
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Earth Armor
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it burrows.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Flare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Each creature in contact with the ground within 15 feet of the clockwork must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Clockwork Defender
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The defender doesn't need air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Electrified Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be grappled (escape 13). A creature grappled by the defender takes the damage again at the start of each of the defender's turns. The defender can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time, and the defender can't make Electrified Bite attacks while grappling.

bonus_actions.name: Light Beam
bonus_actions.desc: The defender emits bright light from its eyes in a 60-foot cone, or it shuts off this light.

monsters.name: Clockwork Dragon
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the clockwork dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a metal statue.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The clockwork dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Clockwork Iron Cobra
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or suffer one random effect (roll a d6):

actions.name: 12: Confusion
actions.desc: On its next turn, the target must use its action to make one weapon attack against a random creature it can see within 30 feet of it, using whatever weapon it has in hand and moving beforehand if necessary to get in range. If it's holding no weapon, it makes an unarmed strike. If no creature is visible within 30 feet, it takes the {@action Dash} action, moving toward the nearest creature.

actions.name: 34: Paralysis
actions.desc: The target is paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: 56: Poison
actions.desc: The target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage.

monsters.name: Clockwork Mule
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Maintainable
traits.desc: Repairing 1 hit point of damage to the clockwork mule takes 1 hour and requires replacement parts, which can be bought in a large city for 20 gp. If the mule drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and unrepairable.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Clockwork Oaken Bolter
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The clockwork makes two Lancing Bolt attacks or one Lancing Bolt attack and one Harpoon attack.

actions.name: Lancing Bolt
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 100/400 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Harpoon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 12). While grappled in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the clockwork. A creature takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The clockwork can grapple only one creature at a time with its harpoon.

actions.name: Explosive Bolt (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The clockwork launches an explosive charge at a point within 120 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Reel In
bonus_actions.desc: The clockwork pulls the creature grappled by its Harpoon up to 20 feet closer.

monsters.name: Clockwork Observer
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The observer doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: While the observer is within 1 mile of its creator, it can magically convey what it sees to its creator, and the two can communicate telepathically.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The observer doesn't need air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Shriek
actions.desc: The observer emits a mechanical shriek until the start of its next turn or until it drops to 0 hit points. This shriek can be heard within a range of 300 feet.

monsters.name: Clockwork Stone Defender
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

reactions.name: Intercept Attack
reactions.desc: In response to another creature within 5 feet of it being hit by an attack roll, the clockwork gives that creature a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack, potentially causing a miss. To use this ability, the clockwork must be able to see the creature and the attacker.

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Destiny Gambler
monsters.senses: truesight 30 ft. (requires cloud rune), passive Perception 19

traits.name: Cloud Rune
traits.desc:
The giant has a cloud rune inscribed on a mask in its possession. While holding or wearing the mask bearing the rune, the giant has truesight within a range of 30 feet and can use its Thunderous Clap action and Negate Spell reaction.
The mask bearing the cloud rune has AC 15; 45 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The mask regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a cloud rune on a mask in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes three Flying Staff attacks.

actions.name: Flying Staff
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30/90 ft., one target. 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) thunder damage. Hit or Miss: The staff magically returns to the giant's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.name: Thunderous Clap (Requires Cloud Rune)
actions.desc:
The giant magically summons a thundercloud that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the giant can see within 60 feet of itself. The cloud spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Constitution saving throw as the cloud emits a thunderous boom. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) thunder damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The thunderclap is audible within 300 feet of the cloud's center point.
The cloud's area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers until the start of the giant's next turn or until a strong wind disperses it.

reactions.name: Negate Spell (Requires Cloud Rune)
reactions.desc: When the giant sees a creature within 60 feet of itself casting a spell, the giant tries to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the creature is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, it must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw, or the spell fails and has no effect.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion

spells.1/day each: dream (as an action), gaseous form, major image

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Ghost
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: The ghost can see 120 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The ghost regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghost takes radiant damage or damage from a magic weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghost's next turn. The ghost dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spectral Weapon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.desc: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Wind Howl (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The ghost emits a dreadful howl that summons a cold, biting wind. This wind engulfs up to three creatures of the ghost's choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target is pulled up to 20 feet toward the ghost and must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The ghost casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability and requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Noble

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis

monsters.name: Cloud Giant of Evil Air

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The giant doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Scimitar attacks and one Storm Boomerang attack.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d6 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Storm Boomerang
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 15 (3d4 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn. Hit or Miss: The boomerang magically returns to the giant's hand immediately after the attack.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Smiling One

traits.name: Control Weather (8th-level Spell)
traits.desc: The giant can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Slam attacks or two Telekinetic Strike attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Strike
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 240 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The giant magically transforms to look and feel like a Beast or a Humanoid it has seen or to return to its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, don't change. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Cloud Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion

monsters.name: Cogwork Archivist

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The archivist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The archivist makes two Grasping Limb attacks.

actions.name: Grasping Limb
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14). The archivist can have no more than two targets grappled at a time.

spells: The archivist casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Coldlight Walker
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Blinding Light
traits.desc: The walker sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. As a bonus action, the walker can target one creature in its bright light that it can see and force it to succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of the walker's next turn.

traits.name: Icy Doom
traits.desc: Any creature killed by the walker freezes for 9 days, during which time it can't be thawed, harmed by fire, animated, or raised from the dead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The walker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The walker makes two attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Cold Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +3 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) cold damage.

monsters.name: Colossus of Akros
monsters.damage_immunities: fire, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands Common and Celestial but can't speak

traits.name: Crumbling Destruction
traits.desc: When the colossus drops to 0 hit points, it crumbles and is destroyed. Any creature on the ground within 30 feet of the crumbling statue must make a 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage and 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the colossus is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The colossus's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The colossus of Akros makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., or range 200/600 ft., one target. 23 (4d6 + 9) piercing damage, or 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the colossus makes a ranged attack with this spear, the spear magically returns to its hand after the attack.

actions.name: Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 36 (6d8 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Flames of Akros (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Magical flames issue from the colossus toward up to three creatures the colossus can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must make a 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also magically catches fire for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the burning target repeats the saving throw. It takes 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

monsters.name: Conclave Dryad

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.desc: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they and the dryad shared a language.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dryad makes three attacks, using its vine staff, its longbow, or both.

actions.name: Vine Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained by twisting vines for 1 minute. A target restrained in this way can use an action to make a 17 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Summon Mount (1/Day)
actions.desc: The dryad magically summons a mount, which appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the dryad. The mount remains for 8 hours, until it or the dryad dies, or until the dryad dismisses it as an action. The mount uses the stat block of an elk (see the Monster Manual) with these changes: it is a plant instead of a beast, it has an Intelligence of 6, and it understands Sylvan but can't speak. While within 1 mile of the mount, the dryad can communicate with it telepathically.

actions.name: Suppress Magic (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dryad targets one magic item it can see within 120 feet of it. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, until the dryad is incapacitated or dies, or until the dryad uses a bonus action to end the effect.

spells: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.3/day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth, spike growth

spells.1/day each: moonbeam, grasping vine, wall of thorns

monsters.name: Conjurer Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The conjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

bonus_actions.name: Benign Transportation (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The conjurer teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Elemental (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The conjurer magically summons an air elemental, an earth elemental, a fire elemental, or a water elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the conjurer, whom it obeys. It takes its turn immediately after the conjurer. It lasts for 1 hour, until it or the conjurer dies, or until the conjurer dismisses it as a bonus action.

spells: The conjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Construct Spirit
monsters.ac: 13 + the level of the spell (natural armor)
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Heated Body (Metal Only)
traits.desc: A creature that touches the construct or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1d10 fire damage.

traits.name: Stony Lethargy (Stone Only)
traits.desc: When a creature the construct can see starts its turn within 10 feet of the construct, the construct can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target can't use reactions and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The construct makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Berserk Lashing (Clay Only)
reactions.desc: When the construct takes damage, it makes a slam attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the construct moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The commoner doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. When it drops to 0 hit points, it becomes a lifeless object.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Copper Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Elemental Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 (13d12) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sapping Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Metallic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) thunder damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Corpse Flower
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Corpses
traits.desc: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Stench of Death
traits.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corpse flower makes three Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Harvest the Dead
actions.desc: The corpse flower swallows one unsecured Humanoid corpse within 10 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

bonus_actions.name: Digest
bonus_actions.desc: The corpse flower digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested corpse remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

bonus_actions.name: Reanimate
bonus_actions.desc: The corpse flower animates one corpse in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see Stench of Death).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The avatar makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a wolf under the avatar's control. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The target's game statistics are replaced by the wolf's statistics, but it retains its hit points. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its wolf form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form, and it can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the horror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The horror doesn't require air.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The horror makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (4d6 + 8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 18 (3d6 + 8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 18). Until this grapple ends, the horror can't use this tentacle against other targets. The horror has 1d8 + 1 tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Psychic Whispers (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The horror emits dreadful whispers in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in the sphere that isn't an Aberration must make a 21 Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Crushing Tentacle
legendary_actions.desc: The horror crushes one creature it is grappling. The grappled creature must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (3d6 + 8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Poison Jet (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Foul gas squirts from the horror in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The horror teleports, along with any creatures it is grappling, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

monsters.name: Cosmotronic Blastseeker

traits.name: Empowered Spell (3/Day)
traits.desc: When the blastseeker rolls damage for a spell, it can reroll up to four dice of damage. It must use the new dice.

traits.name: Tides of Chaos (1/Day)
traits.desc: The blastseeker makes one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:

monsters.name: Counterflux Blastseeker

traits.name: Counterflux Overcast (Recharge 5-6)
traits.desc: The blastseeker can create an additional effect immediately after casting a spell. Roll a d6 to determine the effect:

The blastseeker creates a 15-foot-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The blastseeker creates a 15-foot-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

spells: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:

spells.3/day each: enlarge/reduce, mage armor (self only), scorching ray

spells.1/day each: counterspell, dispel magic, protection from energy

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the cow moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Cloud Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Memnor. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body dissipates into cloud wisps. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The cradle doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes three Slam or Wind Javelin attacks in any combination.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage.

actions.name: Wind Javelin
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +17 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 27 (4d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a 25 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Vortex (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The cradle conjures a vortex of wind at a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The wind vortex is a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than the cradle in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 71 (11d12) bludgeoning damage and has the restrained condition within the vortex. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of the cradle's next turn. A creature with the restrained condition falls prone when the vortex ends.
A creature with the restrained condition can use its action to try to escape the vortex. The creature makes a 19 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. On a successful check, the creature escapes and moves 3d6  10 feet away from the vortex in a random direction.

reactions.name: Thunderclap
reactions.desc: Immediately after taking damage, the cradle unleashes a thunderclap in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. All other creatures in that area must succeed on a 25 Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) thunder damage and have the deafened condition for 1 minute.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Fire Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Surtur. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body hardens and crumbles to ash. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes three Slam or Hurl Lava attacks in any combination.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hurl Lava
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +17 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 27 (4d8 + 9) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 10 (3d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Erupting Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The cradle exhales flames and volcanic gases in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 (10d10) fire damage and has the poisoned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.
A creature poisoned in this way can make a 24 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Lava Geyser
bonus_actions.desc: The cradle causes lava to erupt from a point on the ground it can see within 120 feet of itself. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 50-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) fire damage.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Frost Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Thrym. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body shatters into shards of ice. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes two Slam or Hurl Icicle attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) cold damage.

actions.name: Hurl Icicle
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 26 (4d8 + 8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a 23 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The cradle exhales a blast of frost in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the petrified condition, turning into a frozen statue.
If the statue takes bludgeoning damage, it shatters, killing the frozen creature. If the statue would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and thaws, ending the petrification.

bonus_actions.name: Chilling Mist
bonus_actions.desc: The cradle magically conjures a cloud of chilling mist that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The mist spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 28 (8d6) cold damage and be unable to use reactions until the start of its next turn. The mist vanishes at the end of the cradle's turn.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Hill Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Grolantor. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body crumbles to dirt and moss. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes three Slam or Spit Rock attacks in any combination and one Grasping Root attack.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 33 (4d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +14 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 22 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Grasping Root
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature not grappled by the cradle. the target has the grappled condition (escape 17). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 19 and can be severed by dealing 15 or more slashing damage to it on one attack. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the cradle but ends the grapple.

actions.name: Rolling Hills (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
The cradle magically creates a wave of dirt that extends from a point on the ground within 120 feet of itself. The wave is up to 30 feet long, up to 30 feet tall, and up to 30 feet wide. Each creature in the wave must make a 22 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 58 (9d12) bludgeoning damage, has the prone condition, and is buried under dirt. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.
A buried creature has the restrained condition, has total cover, and can't breathe. As an action, a creature buried in this way, or another creature within 5 feet of it that isn't buried, can make a 17 Strength (Athletics) check. On a successful check, the buried creature no longer has the prone or restrained conditions.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Stone Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Skoraeus. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body crumbles to dust. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes two Slam or Spit Rock attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 23 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Shattering Roar (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The cradle lets out a painfully load roar. Each creature within 60 feet of the cradle must make a 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) thunder damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Crystal Flare
bonus_actions.desc: The cradle causes the crystals on its body to flare with light. Each creature within 30 feet of the cradle must succeed on a 22 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) radiant damage and have the blinded condition until the end of the cradle's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Stone Spikes
bonus_actions.desc: The cradle causes the ground in a 20-foot square within 90 feet of itself to sprout crystal spikes until the start of its next turn. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. A creature takes 10 (3d6) piercing damage for each 5 feet it moves on this terrain.

monsters.name: Cradle of the Storm Scion
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.desc: The cradle is a container for the scion of Stronmaus. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body bursts into light. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cradle makes three Slam or Spit Hailstone attacks in any combination.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 36 (4d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) lightning damage.

actions.name: Spit Hailstone
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +18 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 32 (4d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Lightning Barrage (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The cradle hurls multiple magical lightning bolts at up to two creatures it can see within 500 feet of itself. Each target must make a 22 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 71 (11d12) lightning damage and has the stunned condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

reactions.name: Booming Step
reactions.desc: Immediately after taking damage, the cradle cracks with thunder and then magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the space the cradle left must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Crag Cat
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Nondetection
traits.desc: The cat cannot be targeted or detected by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the cat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the cat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Spell Turning
traits.desc: The cat has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the cat (not an area). If the cat's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the cat and instead targets the caster.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Illumination
bonus_actions.desc: The cranium rat sheds dim light from its exposed brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguishes the light.

traits.name: Shared Telepathy
traits.desc: Any creature touching the cranium rat can use the rat's telepathy if the rat allows it. If the creature knows any language, the creature can use the telepathy to communicate words and emotions.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Illumination
bonus_actions.desc: The cranium rat sheds dim light from its exposed brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguishes the light.

monsters.name: Cranium Rat Squeaker Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Psychic Messenger
traits.desc: The swarm can use its sending spell to target someone familiar to a creature in telepathic contact with the swarm.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Illumination
bonus_actions.desc: The swarm sheds dim light from its brains in a 5-foot radius, increases the illumination to bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius, or extinguishes the light.

spells: The swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):
monsters.spellsNotes: *To cast this spell, the swarm must have more than half its hit points remaining.

monsters.name: Crawling Claw
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The claw is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning or slashing damage (claw's choice).

monsters.name: Crimson Helmed Horror
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The helmed horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The helmed horror is immune to burning hands, fireball, and scorching ray.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The helmed horror makes two longsword attacks.

actions.name: Flaming Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) fire damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage if used with two hands.

bonus_actions.name: Conjure Sword
bonus_actions.desc: As a bonus action on its first turn in combat, the helmed horror conjures a longsword-sized blade of fire, which appears in its free hand. This sword disappears in a cloud of smoke when the helmed horror drops to 0 hit points.

monsters.name: Crow
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The crow can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Crushing Wave Priest

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, ice knife

actions.name: Sharktoothed Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands. Against a target is wearing no armor, the reaver deals an extra die of damage with this sword.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Crystal Battleaxe
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The battleaxe is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the battleaxe must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the battleaxe remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal battleaxe.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Crystal Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 60 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 5 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Crystal Golem
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The golem magically sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This light goes out when the golem is destroyed.

traits.name: Light Intensity
traits.desc:
Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the illuminated golem and can see the golem must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until the start of the creature's next turn.
A creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the golem until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the golem in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Crystal Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft. (hover), swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
