actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the greatwyrm is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 26, +18 to hit with spell attack):

spells.1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

monsters.name: Cuprilach Rilmani

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cuprilach makes three Burnished Blade or Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Burnished Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

actions.name: Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Assassin's Agility
bonus_actions.desc: The cuprilach takes the Dash or Disengage action, or it makes one Burnished Blade attack.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The cuprilach halves the damage it takes from an attack that hits it, provided it can see the attacker.

spells: The cuprilach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.desc: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cyclops makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Dabus
monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak; communicates via Symbol Speech

traits.name: Physical Restraint
traits.desc: The dabus doesn't make melee attacks or opportunity attacks, even in self-defense.

traits.name: Symbol Speech
traits.desc: A dabus communicates by creating illusory symbols and pictures that float in the air in front of itself and disappear a few seconds later. A creature that can see such a message can decipher it with a successful 10 Intelligence (Investigation) check (no action required).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dabus makes two Flying Brick attacks.

actions.name: Flying Brick
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Grasping Ground (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dabus causes a 20-foot-square area of ground it can see within 60 feet of itself to sprout clutching appendages made of stone. Each creature of the dabus's choice in that area must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and have the grappled condition (escape 13). While grappled in this way, the creature has the restrained condition. The appendages vanish after 1 minute or if the dabus's {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

traits.name: Pact of Pain
traits.desc:
Using a 10-minute ritual, the daemogoth can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the daemogoth dies, or the pact is broken by any effect that can remove a curse.
The daemogoth chooses one spell from the {@filter necromancy or enchantment school that is 3rd level or lower|spells|level=0;1;2;3|school=N;E}. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's {@status concentration} on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The daemogoth makes three Agonizing Burst attacks. It can use Terrify, if available, in place of one of the attacks.

actions.name: Agonizing Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 11 (2d10) force damage. If the target is a creature, the daemogoth regains 5 hit points.

actions.name: Terrify (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The daemogoth targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the daemogoth until the end of the daemogoth's next turn, and the daemogoth regains 5 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened, and the daemogoth doesn't heal.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Pact of Suffering
traits.desc:
Using a 10-minute long ritual, the titan can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the titan dies, or the pact is broken by a wish spell.
The titan chooses one spell from the {@filter necromancy or enchantment school that is 8th level or lower|spells|level=0;1;2;3;4;5;6;7;8|school=N;E}. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 21 (6d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's {@status concentration} on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The titan makes two Agonizing Burst attacks.

actions.name: Agonizing Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +12 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 17 (3d6 + 7) force damage. If the target is a creature, the titan regains 5 hit points.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The titan teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The titan makes one Agonizing Burst attack.

legendary_actions.name: Stalking Nightmare (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The titan uses Teleport, after which it can target one creature within 20 feet of itself that it can see. The target must make a 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage, and the titan regains 10 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the titan doesn't heal.

legendary_actions.name: Terrorize (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The titan targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 38 (7d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the titan until the end of the target's next turn, and the titan regains 15 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened, and the titan doesn't heal.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Irrepressible Dance
traits.desc: When any creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the item, the item can increase or decrease (your choice) the walking speed of that creature by 10 feet until the end of the turn, provided the item isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Force-Empowered Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. 1d10 + PB force damage.

monsters.name: Dao
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Earth Glide
traits.desc: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the dao dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the dao was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The dao has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Dao makes two fist attacks or two maul attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (4d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength check or be knocked prone.

spells: The dao's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, stone shape

spells.1/day each: conjure elemental (earth elemental only), gaseous form, invisibility, phantasmal killer, plane shift, wall of stone

traits.name: Bonded Mount
traits.desc: The knight is magically bound to a beast with an innate swimming speed trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on this beast, the knight gains the beast's senses and ability to breathe underwater. The bonded mount obeys the knight's commands. If its mount dies, the knight can train a new beast to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

traits.name: Sneak Attack
traits.desc: The knight deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the knight that isn't incapacitated and the knight doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The knight makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: When an attacker the knight can see hits it with an attack, the knight can halve the damage against it.

monsters.name: Darkling
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Death Flash
traits.desc: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Darkling Elder
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Death Burn
traits.desc: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The darkling elder makes two Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The darkling elder casts darkness, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Shadowy Form
traits.desc: While the darkweaver is in dim light or darkness, attack rolls against it are made with disadvantage unless the darkweaver has the incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The darkweaver can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The darkweaver takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The darkweaver makes two Shadow Web attacks and one Bite attack. It can use Reel after any of these attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Shadow Web
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 120 ft., one creature. 16 (3d10) necrotic damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape 15). The shadow web can be attacked and destroyed (AC 16; 20 hit points; vulnerability to radiant damage; immunity to bludgeoning, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage). The darkweaver can grapple up to six creatures at a time using its shadow web.

actions.name: Reel
actions.desc: The darkweaver pulls each creature it has grappled up to 60 feet toward itself.

monsters.name: Deadstone Cleft Stone Giant
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 30 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Olach Morrah
traits.desc: The giant meditates for 1 hour, during which time it can do nothing else. At the end of the hour, provided the giant's meditation has been uninterrupted, it becomes petrified for 8 hours. At the end of this time, the giant is no longer petrified and gains tremorsense out to a range of 30 feet, as well as a measure of innate spellcasting ability for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Rock Catching
reactions.desc: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

spells: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Scythe or Soul Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Scythe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Soul Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 26 (4d10 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target has the frightened condition, the giant gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

bonus_actions.name: Frightening Teleport (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the location the giant left must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of that creature's next turn.

monsters.name: Death Giant Shrouded One

traits.name: Death Rune
traits.desc:
The giant has a death rune inscribed on a giant's skull in its possession. While holding or wearing the skull bearing the rune, the giant can use its Reaping Scythe action and Shroud of Souls bonus action.
The skull bearing the death rune has AC 18; 35 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The skull regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a death rune on another skull in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes three Soul Burst attacks. Alternatively, if the giant has its death rune, it can make three Reaping Scythe attacks.

actions.name: Soul Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +11 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) necrotic damage. If the target has the frightened condition, the giant gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

actions.name: Reaping Scythe (Requires Death Rune)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 38 (7d10) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn. The target dies if it is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack.

bonus_actions.name: Frightening Teleport (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the location the giant left must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of that creature's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Shroud of Souls (Requires Death Rune)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant shrouds itself in a torrent of souls. While the giant is shrouded, each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on saving throws until the end of that creature's next turn. The shroud disappears after 1 minute, when the giant dies, when the giant uses this bonus action again, or when the giant's death rune is destroyed.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

spells.3/day each: speak with dead, Tenser's floating disk

traits.name: Lightning Blood
traits.desc: A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death kiss makes three Tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drainone replacement per tentacle grappling a creature.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

monsters.name: Death Knight

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Marshal Undead
traits.desc: Unless the death knight is incapacitated, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death knight makes three longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
actions.desc: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The death knight is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells.1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, searing smite

monsters.name: Death Slaad
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 18

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or greatsword.

actions.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, invisibility (self only), mage hand, major image

monsters.name: Death Tyrant
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Negative Energy Cone
traits.desc:
The death tyrant's central eye emits an invisible, magical 150-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, the tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.
Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a zombie under the tyrant's command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The death tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1. Charm Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the death tyrant for 1 hour, or until the death tyrant harms the creature.

actions.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3. Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 4. Slowing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5. Enervation Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or the death tyrant moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant is incapacitated.
If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

actions.name: 7. Sleep Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

actions.name: 8. Petrification Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.
If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

actions.name: 10. Death Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The death tyrant uses one random eye ray.

traits.name: Beheaded Form
traits.desc: When created, a death's head takes one of three forms: Aberrant Head, Gnashing Head, or Petrifying Head. This form determines the creature's attack.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The death's head doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Gnashing Bite (Gnashing Head Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Mind-Bending Bite (Aberrant Head Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Intelligence saving throw or it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, the target must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three.

actions.name: Petrifying Bite (Petrifying Head Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the target is petrified for 10 minutes.

traits.name: Aura of Murder
traits.desc: As long as the death's head is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within 5 feet of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The death's head has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death's head uses Stunning Gaze and makes two dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stunning Gaze
actions.desc: The death's head targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Unstoppable (3/Day)
reactions.desc: The death's head reduces the damage it takes from an attack to 0.

monsters.name: Deathlock
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand

spells.1/day each: dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb

monsters.name: Deathlock Mastermind
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the deathlock's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3 necrotic damage).

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion

spells.1/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility

monsters.name: Deathlock Wight
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the deathlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Life Drain or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d8 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the deathlock's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The deathlock can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor

monsters.name: Deathpact Angel
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Exploitation of the Debtors
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the angel targets a creature charmed by it that it can see within 30 feet of it. The angel deals 11 (2d10) necrotic damage to the target, and the angel gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The angel doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The angel makes two attacks with its scythe. It can substitute Chains of Obligation for one of these attacks.

actions.name: Scythe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Chains of Obligation
actions.desc: The angel targets one creature charmed by it that it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Charisma saving throw or become paralyzed for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

spells: The angel's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: command (as a 2nd-level spell), detect evil and good

spells.3/day each: charm person (as a 5th-level spell), darkness, suggestion

monsters.name: Decaton Modron

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The decaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.desc: The decaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the decaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The decaton makes three Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the decaton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The decaton has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Lightning Rays (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The decaton unleashes a barrage of lightning bolts from its eyes. Each creature within 30 feet of the decaton must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

spells: The decaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)

spells.1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

monsters.name: Deck Defender
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (can't see beyond this radius), passive Perception 10
monsters.languages: understands one of your languages but can't speak

traits.name: Allied Knight
traits.desc: Some of the deck defender's statistics are based on the character who drew the Knight card. Where the deck defender stat block refers to "you," it refers to that character.

traits.name: Folded Versatility
traits.desc: After finishing a long rest, you can refold the deck defender's shape, changing it to acrobat form, berserker form, or guardian form.

traits.name: Fragile
traits.desc: If the deck defender is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses into a haphazard pile of nonmagical playing cards and can't be resurrected or reconstructed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deck defender makes a number of attacks equal to half its proficiency bonus (rounded down).

actions.name: Paper Cut
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack PB + +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Reckless Strike (Berserker Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack PB + +3 to hit (with advantage), reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage, and attacks made against the deck defender until the start of its next turn have advantage.

bonus_actions.name: Swift Step (Acrobat Form Only)
bonus_actions.desc: The deck defender takes the Dash or Disengage action.

reactions.name: Protection (Guardian Form Only)
reactions.desc: When a creature the deck defender can see attacks a target other than the deck defender and is within 5 feet of the deck defender, the deck defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Deep Crow
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the deep crow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

actions.name: Mandibles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Deep Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 90 ft., passive Perception 13

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Deep Roth

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The roth is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the roth moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

spells: The roth casts dancing lights, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

monsters.name: Deep Scion
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (20 ft. and swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)

traits.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deep scion makes two Battleaxe attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The deep scion transforms into a hybrid form (humanoid-piscine) or back into its true form, which is humanlike. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Demilich
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from magic weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the demilich is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The demilich is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Howl (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The demilich emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the demilich that can hear the howl must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: The demilich targets up to three creatures that it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, and the demilich regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

legendary_actions.name: Flight
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Cloud of Dust
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich magically swirls its dusty remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the demilich, including around a corner, must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the demilich's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the demilich's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature with in 30 feet of the demilich must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 (3d6). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the  greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary_actions.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

monsters.name: Demogorgon
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Demogorgon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Demogorgon makes two Tentacle attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Gaze.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 23 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Gaze
actions.desc: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 12: Beguiling Gaze
actions.desc: The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight.

actions.name: 34: Confusing Gaze
actions.desc: The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.

actions.name: 56: Hypnotic Gaze
actions.desc: The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its action, reaction, and movement.

legendary_actions.name: Gaze
legendary_actions.desc: Demogorgon uses Gaze and must use either Beguiling Gaze or Confusing Gaze.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Demogorgon uses Spellcasting.

spells: Demogorgon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

monsters.name: Demos Magen
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fiery End
traits.desc: If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The magen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The magen makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Hooked Spear
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the derro can choose to deal no damage and knock it prone.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Derro Savant

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Beam
actions.desc: The derro launches a brilliant beam of magical energy in a 5-foot-wide line that is 60 feet long. Each creature in the line must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The derro casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Detached Shadow
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target falls unconscious if this reduces its Strength to 0. The creature regains consciousness and the reduction to its Strength score disappears after it finishes a short or long rest.

monsters.name: Devkarin Lich
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The lich regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the lich takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the lich's next turn. The lich dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the lich to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the lich drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Noxious Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: The lich casts one of its cantrips.

legendary_actions.name: Noxious Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The lich uses Noxious Touch.

legendary_actions.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of the lich must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The lich is a 14th-level Golgari spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): acid splash, chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, magic missile, ray of sickness

spells.2nd level (3 slots): Melf's acid arrow, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb, web

spells.3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, bestow curse, fear, vampiric touch

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Imprison Soul
actions.desc: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Dhergoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dhergoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dhergoloth makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Flailing Claws (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dhergoloth moves up to its speed in a straight line and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The dhergoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The dhergoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 10):

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mimic can make three attacks; two with its pseudopods and one with its bite

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the skeleton moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the skeleton can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Dire Troll
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind of Claws (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 10 feet of the troll must make a 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Disciple

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip)
actions.desc: You target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a 11 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

spells: You cast one the following cleric spells (spell save 11), using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Displacer Beast
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 bludgeoning damage plus 2 piercing damage.

traits.name: Snake-Swollen
traits.desc: When a corpse is reduced to 0 hit points, it splits open, disgorging a swarm of poisonous snakes. The snakes are hungry and fight until slain.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The diva has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The diva makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Broken Bottle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Diviner Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The diviner makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 20 (3d10 + 4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Overwhelming Revelation (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The diviner magically creates a burst of illumination in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of the diviner's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

reactions.name: Portent (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the diviner or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the diviner rolls a d20 and chooses whether to use that roll in place of the d20 rolled for the attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

spells: The diviner casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: arcane eye, detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, lightning bolt, locate object, mage armor, Rary's telepathic bond

monsters.name: Dohwar
monsters.languages: Common, Dohwar, telepathy 30 ft. (see also Merging below)

traits.name: Merging
traits.desc: Two dohwars can have a telepathic conversation with each other and a third willing creature of their choice, provided all three are within 30 feet of one another.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

spells: The dohwar casts the following spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

monsters.name: Dolgaunt
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the dolgaunt is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dolgaunt instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the dolgaunt is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Tentacle

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Vitality Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the dolgaunt must make a 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the dolgaunt regains a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

monsters.name: Dolgrim
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Dual Consciousness
traits.desc: The dolgrim has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
