actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the dolphin moved at least 30 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dolphin makes two Dazzling Slam attacks.

actions.name: Dazzling Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the dolphin's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Delightful Light (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The dolphin magically emanates light in a 10-foot radius for a moment. The dolphin and each creature of its choice in that light gain 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

bonus_actions.name: Fey Leap
bonus_actions.desc: The dolphin teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Immediately before teleporting, the dolphin can choose one creature within 5 feet of it. That creature can teleport with the dolphin, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the dolphin's destination space.

traits.name: Aura of Doom
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the doom lord must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the doom lord doesn't have the incapacitated condition, it can suppress or resume this aura at the start of its turn (no action required).

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The doom lord deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The doom lord makes two Entropic Greatsword or Entropic Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Entropic Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

actions.name: Entropic Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rot blade makes two Entropic Blade or Entropic Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Entropic Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash. Hit or Miss: The rot blade can cause the blade to emit a burst of entropic magic in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the weapon. Each creature in that area other than the rot blade must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or take 6 (1d12) necrotic damage. The blade can emit entropic magic in this way only once per turn.

actions.name: Entropic Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

traits.name: Aura of Erebos
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Noxious Gust (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The giant exhales a mighty gust that creates a blast of deadly mist in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.desc:
The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the dracohydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the dracohydra dies.
At the end of its turn, the dracohydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn. The dracohydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.desc: For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dracohydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

actions.name: Prismatic Breath (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The dracohydra's heads exhale a single breath of multicolored energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Serrated Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Shape Theft
reactions.desc: After the draconian kills a Medium or smaller Humanoid, the draconian can magically transform itself to look and feel like that creature while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation lasts until the draconian dies or uses an action to end it.

traits.name: Controlled Fall
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its body turns to stone and releases a petrifying gas. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends; otherwise the creature is petrified for 1 minute. After 1 minute, the body of the draconian crumbles to dust.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

monsters.name: Draconian Mage

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away and its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes two Trident or Necrotic Ray attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Necrotic Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Draconian Mastermind

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within 30 feet of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within 15 feet of the first. Each creature must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Energy Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Noxious Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The draconian exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Magic Shield (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the draconian is hit by an attack roll, it can create an invisible barrier of magical force around itself, granting it a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack and potentially causing the attack to miss.

spells: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Draconic Shard
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 26

traits.name: Deflection
traits.desc: The shard's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The shard can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the shard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When it drops to 0 hit points, the shard disappears and leaves a Tiny cracked gemstone in its space. The gemstone matches the kind of gem dragon it was in life and has AC 20, 15 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. Unless the gemstone is destroyed, after 1d20 days, the gemstone dissipates and the shard re-forms, regaining all its hit points and appearing in the place the gemstone once occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The shard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shard makes two Telekinetic Rend attacks.

actions.name: Telekinetic Rend
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage.

actions.name: Inhabit Object
actions.desc:
The shard disappears as it pours its psychic essence into a Medium or smaller nonsentient object it can see within 30 feet of it, magically possessing it. The object uses the shard's AC, and any damage dealt to the object applies to the shard's hit points. The shard inhabits the object until it uses an action to leave; until it is turned; until it is reduced to 0 hit points; or until an effect that ends possession, such as a dispel evil and good spell, is used on it. When it leaves the object, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.
While inhabited, the object becomes a magic item if it wasn't already, and a Tiny cracked gemstone matching the kind of gem dragon the shard was in life appears somewhere on the object. The shard can cause the object to fly using the shard's own flying speed, use its senses, speak verbally or telepathically, cast spells, and use its legendary actions.
If a creature wears or carries the inhabited object, the shard can grant the creature the following benefits:
Each of the creature's attacks deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.
The creature gains resistance to psychic damage.

actions.name: Psychic Crush (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The shard unleashes a pulse of psychic power. Each creature of the shard's choice in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on it must make a 20 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 55 (10d10) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

legendary_actions.name: Rend
legendary_actions.desc: The shard makes one Telekinetic Rend attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The shard uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Commanding Thought (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The shard targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn. While charmed in this way, the target becomes the shard's puppet, acting and moving in accordance with its telepathic commands. While under the shard's control, the target can take only the Attack (shard chooses the target) or Dash action on its turn.

spells: The shard casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

monsters.name: Draconic Spirit
monsters.ac: 14 + the level of the spell (natural armor)
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison (Chromatic and Metallic Only), force, necrotic, psychic, radiant, thunder (Gem Only)
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12
monsters.languages: Draconic, understands the languages you speak

traits.name: Shared Resistances
traits.desc: When you summon the dragon, choose one of its damage resistances. You have resistance to the chosen damage type until the spell ends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes a number of Rend attacks equal to half the spell's level (rounded down), and it uses Breath Weapon.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 1d6 + 4 + summonSpellLevel piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapon
actions.desc: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes 2d6 damage of a type this dragon has resistance to (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the subject is reduced to 0 hit points, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the subject must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: When the subject falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a diseasea minuscule slaad egg.
A Humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before the tadpole is born, the host feels unwell; its speed is halved; and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the tadpole disintegrates.

monsters.name: Draegloth

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The draegloth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The draegloth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

spells: The draegloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The dragonnel doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragonnel makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Draconic Devotion
traits.desc: While the officer can see a Dragon that isn't hostile to it, the officer has advantage on attack rolls.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Assault Orders (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The officer shouts orders and targets up to two other creatures within 60 feet of itself. If a target has the Draconic Devotion trait and can hear the officer, the target can use its reaction to make one melee attack.

traits.name: Draconic Devotion
traits.desc: While the soldier can see a Dragon that isn't hostile to it, the soldier has advantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The soldier makes two Longsword or Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

monsters.name: Dragon Blessed
monsters.languages: Common, Draconic, and any two languages

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blessed makes two Mace or Radiant Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 22 (5d8) radiant damage, and the blessed regains 5 (1d10) hit points.

spells: The blessed casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.1/day each: enhance ability, flame strike, mass cure wounds, revivify, tongues

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chosen makes one Handaxe attack and two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Handaxe
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage. Hit or Miss: The handaxe magically returns to the chosen's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Biting Rebuke
reactions.desc: Immediately after the chosen takes damage from a creature within 5 feet of it, it can make a Shortsword attack with advantage against that creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon hunter makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.languages: Common, Draconic, and any two languages

actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 13 (3d8) thunder damage, and the target is pushed horizontally up to 10 feet away from the speaker.

reactions.name: Disarming Words (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When a creature the speaker can see within 60 feet of it makes a damage roll, the speaker can roll a d6 and subtract the number rolled from that damage roll.

spells: The speaker casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.1/day each: calm emotions, charm person, command, comprehend languages

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon turtle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.desc: The dragon tortoise exhales abrasive sand in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

monsters.name: Dragonblood Ooze
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, prone, restrained
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands Draconic and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ooze makes two Pseudopod attacks. The ooze can replace one Pseudopod attack with its Slime Breath, if available.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Slime Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The ooze expels a spray of its gelatinous mass in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) acid damage and is pulled up to 30 feet straight toward the ooze. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

monsters.name: Dragonbone Golem
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands Draconic and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.desc: Each creature of the golem's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the golem must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw unless the golem is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this golem's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes one Pinion attack and two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Pinion
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pinned beneath the bony pinion and restrained. The golem has two pinions, each of which can restrain one target. If a creature is restrained by one of the pinions, the golem can't attack with it. Any creature restrained by a pinion can free itself at the start of its turn with a successful 17 Strength (Athletics) check.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem emits a 60-foot cone of petrifying gas from its mouth. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) poison damage and be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target is petrified.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage. The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of the dragonborn's next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

actions.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
actions.desc: The dragonborn touches another creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains 40 hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

actions.name: Radiant Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the cone. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain 22 (4d10) hit points each.

monsters.name: Dragonborn of Sardior

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Mental Defense
traits.desc: While the dragonborn is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragonborn makes three Mind Blade attacks.

actions.name: Mind Blade
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Heat Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dragonborn exhales a wave of intense heat in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Metal objects in that area glow red-hot until the end of the dragonborn's next turn. Any creature in physical contact with a heated object at the start of its turn must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) fire damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

spells: The dragonborn casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragonborn makes two Greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dragonborn exhales shadowy fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is frightened of the dragonborn for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Dragon Fanatic
traits.desc: The dragonclaw has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. While the dragonclaw can see a dragon or higher-ranking Cult of the Dragon cultist friendly to it, the dragonclaw ignores the effects of being charmed or frightened.

traits.name: Fanatic Advantage
traits.desc: Once per turn, if the dragonclaw makes a weapon attack with advantage on the attack roll and hits, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The dragonclaw has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dragonclaw's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragonclaw attacks twice with its scimitar.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Dragon Fanatic
traits.desc: The dragonfang has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. While the dragonfang can see a dragon or higher-ranking Cult of the Dragon cultist friendly to it, the dragonfang ignores the effects of being charmed or frightened.

traits.name: Fanatic Advantage
traits.desc: Once per turn, if the dragonfang makes a weapon attack with advantage on the attack roll and hits, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

traits.name: Limited Flight
traits.desc: The dragonfang can use a bonus action to gain a flying speed of 30 feet until the end of its turn.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The dragonfang has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dragonfang's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Dragonfang attacks twice with its shortsword.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) damage of the type to which the dragonfang has resistance.

actions.name: Orb of Dragon's Breath (2/Day)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 50 ft., one target. 22 (5d8) damage of the type to which the dragonfang has damage resistance.

monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Cloying Miasma
traits.desc: The abomination is surrounded by a noxious stench. At the start of the abomination's turn, any creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the abomination's next turn.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The abomination regains 10 hit points at the start of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abomination makes three attacks using Claw, Acidic Spit, or a combination of them. It can replace one of the attacks with a Tail attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Acidic Spit
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Acid Belch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The abomination belches forth a cloud of acidic gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Acid Retch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The grafter retches forth a spray of acidic bile in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude

The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The drow magically transforms into a Large spider, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying in Humanoid form melds into the spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to its Humanoid form if it dies.

The drow conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The drow can make a melee spell attack (+10 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 9 (1d8 + 5) force damage.
The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the drow can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

The target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the drow for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tentacle Rod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is hit three times by the tentacle rod Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects for 1 minute: the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Each creature in the column must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. monsters.name: Drow Noble

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow noble has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow noble to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow noble has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The noble adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The drow noble's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The drow noble can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drow Priestess of Lolth
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes two scourge attacks.

actions.name: Scourge
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drow attempts to magically summon a yochlol with a {@chance 30|30 percent|30% summoning chance} chance of success. If the attempt fails, the drow takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The drow's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
The drow is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The drow has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, poison spray, resistance, spare the dying, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds, detect poison and disease, ray of sickness

spells.2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, protection from poison, web

spells.3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals (2 giant spider), dispel magic

monsters.name: Drow Scout

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow scout has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow scout to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow scout has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The drow scout's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 10). The drow scout can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drow Shadowblade

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the drow's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drow makes three Shadow Sword attacks. One of the attacks can be replaced by a Hand Crossbow attack. The drow can also use Spellcasting to cast darkness.

actions.name: Shadow Sword
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. 27 (7d6 + 5) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target regains consciousness if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Step
bonus_actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the drow teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

spells: The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monsters.name: Drow Spore Servant
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Drow Spy

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The drow spy has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow spy to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the drow spy has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The drow spy's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). The drow spy can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Drowned Ascetic
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Bottom Treader
traits.desc: The drowned ascetic cannot swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. It is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

traits.name: Bound Together
traits.desc: The drowned ascetic shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the drowned ascetic to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned ascetic drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drowned ascetic makes three unarmed strikes.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease bluerot|GoS} (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

reactions.name: Dexterous Target
reactions.desc: The drowned ascetic adds 3 to its AC against one ranged attack that would hit it. To do so, the drowned ascetic must see the attacker.

monsters.name: Drowned Assassin
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Bottom Treader
traits.desc: The drowned assassin cannot swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. It is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

traits.name: Bound Together
traits.desc: The drowned assassin shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the drowned assassin to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned assassin drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drowned assassin makes two hand crossbow attacks or two dagger attacks. It can then take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease bluerot|GoS} (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease bluerot|GoS} (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

actions.name: Reveal (1/Day)
actions.desc: The drowned assassin removes its mask, revealing its rotting face. Each creature of the assassin's choice within 30 feet of it that can see the assassin must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Drowned Blade
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Bottom Treader
traits.desc: The drowned blade cannot swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. It is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

traits.name: Bound Together
traits.desc: The drowned blade shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the drowned blade to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned blade drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drowned blade makes two rusted longsword attacks.

actions.name: Rusted Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease bluerot|GoS} (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

monsters.name: Drowned Master
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Bound Together
traits.desc: The drowned master shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

traits.name: Cold Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the drowned master's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) cold damage. A creature that touches the drowned master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the drowned master to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned master drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drowned master makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its Life-Draining Tentacle.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease bluerot|GoS} (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

actions.name: Life-Draining Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. On a failed save, the target also contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

actions.name: Necrotic Ink (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The drowned master discharges foul ink in front of itself in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the ink must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is blinded until the end of its next turn and contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

monsters.name: Druid of the Old Ways

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The druid deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.desc: The druid can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The druid is a 12th-level Gruul spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, resistance, thorn whip

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, faerie fire, thunderwave

spells.2nd level (3 slots): beast sense, flame blade, pass without trace

spells.3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, dispel magic, plant growth

spells.4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, freedom of movement, wall of fire

spells.5th level (2 slots): commune with nature, conjure elemental, scrying

spells.6th level (1 slots): transport via plants, wall of thorns

monsters.name: Dryad Spirit
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Detect Life
traits.desc: The dryad can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The dryad can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

actions.name: Corrupting Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage
actions.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the dryad that can see her must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the dryad is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the dryad's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Wail (1/Day)
actions.desc: The dryad releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Acid Vial
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 20 ft., one target. 7 (2d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Alchemist's Fire
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 20 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a successful 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

spells: The darkhaft's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 10) it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

monsters.name: Duergar Despot

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Psychic Engine
traits.desc: When the duergar suffers a critical hit or is reduced to 0 hit points, psychic energy erupts from its frame to deal 14 (4d6) psychic damage to each creature within 5 feet of it.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes two Iron Fist attacks and two Stomping Foot attacks. After one of the attacks, the duergar can move up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Flame Jet.

actions.name: Iron Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 23 (4d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away in a straight line and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomping Foot
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, or 21 (3d10 + 5) to a prone target.

actions.name: Flame Jet
actions.desc: The duergar spews flames in a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The duergar casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

actions.name: Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Engine of Pain
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of the hammerer hits it with an attack roll, the hammerer makes a Hammer attack against that creature.

traits.name: Cavalry Training
traits.desc: When the duergar hits a target with a melee attack while mounted, the mount can use its reaction to make one melee attack against the same target.

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shared Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it. While the invisible duergar is mounted, the mount is invisible as well. The invisibility ends early on the mount immediately after it attacks.

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame

spells.1st level (4 slots): bane, inflict wounds, shield of faith

monsters.name: Duergar Mind Master
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 12

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes two Mind-Poison Dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Mind Mastery.

actions.name: Mind-Poison Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, or 1 piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage while under the effect of Reduce.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

actions.name: Mind Mastery
actions.desc: The duergar targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Intelligence saving throw, or the duergar causes it to use its reaction, if available, either to make one weapon attack against another creature the duergar can see or to move up to 10 feet in a direction of the duergar's choice. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

bonus_actions.name: Reduce (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically decreases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While reduced, the duergar is Tiny, reduces its weapon damage to 1, and makes attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws with disadvantage if they use Strength. It gains a +5 bonus to all Dexterity (Stealth) checks and a +5 bonus to its AC. It can also take a bonus action on each of its turns to take the {@action Hide} action.

monsters.name: Duergar Screamer
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The screamer makes one Drill attack, and it uses Sonic Scream.

actions.name: Drill
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sonic Scream
actions.desc: The screamer emits destructive energy in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 11 Strength saving throw or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Engine of Pain
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of the screamer hits it with an attack roll, the screamer makes a Drill attack against that creature.

bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

monsters.name: Duergar Spore Servant
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

actions.name: War Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The spy has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

traits.name: Sneak Attack
traits.desc: Once per turn, the spy can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the spy has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the spy magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the spy is Large, doubles her damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the spy lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage while enlarged.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The spy magically turns invisible until it attacks, deals damage, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its {@status concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the spy wears or carries is invisible with it.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Phalanx Formation
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of an ally wielding a shield.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes two Shortsword or Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes three Psychic-Attuned Hammer or Javelin attacks and uses Call to Attack.

actions.name: Psychic-Attuned Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

actions.name: Call to Attack
actions.desc: Up to three allies within 120 feet of this duergar that can hear it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

reactions.name: Scouring Instruction
reactions.desc: When an ally that the duergar can see makes a d20 roll, the duergar can roll a d6, and the ally can add the number rolled to the d20 by taking 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Fire Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage, or 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Spray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: From its fire lance, the duergar shoots a 15-foot cone of fire or a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

monsters.name: Dullahan
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the dullahan is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 hit points. In addition, it summons three death's head, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the dullahan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dullahan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dullahan makes two attacks.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the dullahan scores a critical hit against a creature, the target must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or the dullahan cuts off the target's head. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature that doesn't have or need a head, or has legendary actions, instead takes an extra 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fiery Skull
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dullahan makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Frightful Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dullahan until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Head Hunt (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dullahan moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one Battleaxe attack with advantage. If the attack hits, but is not a critical hit, the attack deals an extra 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

mythic_actions.desc: If the dullahan's Headless Summoning trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Coordinated Assault
mythic_actions.desc: The dullahan makes a Battleaxe attack, and then one death's head the dullahan can see within 30 feet of it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

mythic_actions.name: Headless Wail (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: An echoing shriek issues from the dullahan's headless stump. Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 10 feet of it must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If one or more creatures fail the saving throw, the dullahan gains 10 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The duodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the duodrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duodrone makes two fist attacks or two javelin attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Dusk Hag
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hag makes two Nightmare Touch attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 18 (4d6 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is unconscious, it takes an extra 10 (3d6) psychic damage and is cursed until the hag dies or the curse is removed. The cursed creature's hit point maximum decreases by 5 (1d10) whenever it finishes a long rest.

reactions.name: Dream Eater
reactions.desc: When an unconscious creature the hag can see within 30 feet of her regains consciousness, the hag can force the creature to make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage, and the hag regains hit points equal to the amount of damage taken.

spells: The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Dust Hulk
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained

traits.name: Air Form
traits.desc: The dust hulk can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the dust hulk dies, it explodes in a burst of dust that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or have the blinded condition for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dust hulk makes three Slam attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Stinging Dust.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Stinging Dust
actions.desc: One creature of the dust hulk's choice inside its space must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The skeleton has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that make it have the prone condition.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

monsters.name: Dybbuk
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The dybbuk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dybbuk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacle
