actions.desc: Graz'zt teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: Graz'zt transforms into a form that resembles a Medium Humanoid or back into his true form. Aside from his size, his statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

reactions.name: Negate Spell (Recharge 5-6)
reactions.desc: Graz'zt tries to interrupt a spell he sees a creature casting within 60 feet of him. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Graz'zt makes a Charisma check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

legendary_actions.name: Abyssal Magic
legendary_actions.desc: Graz'zt uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Graz'zt makes one Wave of Sorrow attack.

legendary_actions.name: Dance, My Puppet!
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by Graz'zt that Graz'zt can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as Graz'zt directs.

spells: Graz'zt casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

spells.At will: charm person, detect magic, dispel magic

monsters.name: Greater Death Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the dragon can't bite a different target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Cataclysmic Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a wave of ghostly purple flames in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the breath reduces it to 0 hit points. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by the breath's damage, as well as every corpse of such a creature within the cone, becomes a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the dragon's control. The zombie acts on the dragon's initiative but immediately after the dragon's turn. Absent any other command, the zombie tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cataclysmic Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon moves up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks, carrying with it any creatures it is grappling. During this move, if it enters the space of a Medium or smaller creature, that creature takes 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the emissary fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The emissary doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The emissary makes three attacks.

actions.name: Lashing Maw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage.

actions.name: Psychic Orb
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 27 (3d12 + 8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Unearthly Bile (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The emissary expels bile that splashes all creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the emissary. Each creature in that area must make a 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each creature that fails the saving throw, a gibbering mouther (see its entry in the Monster Manual) appears in an unoccupied space on a surface that can support it within 30 feet of that creature. The gibbering mouthers act right after the emissary on the same initiative count, gaining a +7 bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and fighting until they are destroyed. They disappear when the emissary dies.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Warp Space (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary causes the ground in a 20-foot square that it can see within 90 feet of it to turn into teeth and maws until the start of its next turn. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. Any creature takes 10 (3d6) piercing damage for each 5 feet it moves on this terrain.

legendary_actions.name: Mind Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary unleashes a psychic wave. Each creature within 30 feet of the emissary must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw or take 32 (5d12) psychic damage. In addition, every spell ends on creatures and objects of the emissary's choice in that area.

monsters.name: Greater Zombie
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The zombie has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zombie makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Empowered Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Green Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes two Fiendish Claw attacks, or it makes one Fiendish Claw attack and uses Spellcasting.

actions.name: Fiendish Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 16 (3d10) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The abishai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

monsters.name: Green Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) poison damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Chromatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (5d8) poison damage.

monsters.name: Green Slaad
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or staff. Alternatively, it uses its Hurl Flame twice.

actions.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw (Slaad Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

spells: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, mage hand

monsters.name: Grell
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The grell makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its beak.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is paralyzed, and it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
The target is also grappled (escape 15). If the target is Medium or smaller, it is also restrained until this grapple ends. While grappling the target, the grell has advantage on attack rolls against it and can 't use this attack against other targets. When the grell moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Grell Psychic
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The grell psychic makes one Tentacle attack and one Beak attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (3d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. While the target is poisoned, it also has the paralyzed condition. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target also has the grappled condition (escape 16). While grappling the target, the grell can't make Tentacle attacks against other targets. When the grell moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it.

spells: The grell psychic casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.At will: detect thoughts, mage armor, mage hand (the hand is invisible)

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

reactions.name: Magic Allergy (1/Day)
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature within 30 feet of the gremishka casts a spell, the gremishka can spontaneously react to the magic. Roll a d6 to determine the effect:

monsters.name: Gremorly's Ghost
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: Gremorly can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: Gremorly can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 5 (1d10) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Gremorly fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Gremorly makes three Withering Strike attacks.

actions.name: Withering Strike
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d12) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Fell Necromancy
actions.desc: Gremorly targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of himself. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 61 (7d8 + 30) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, Gremorly regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
One Humanoid Gremorly can see within 5 feet of himself must succeed on a 15 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by him; Gremorly disappears, and the target has the incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. Gremorly can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn Undead, and he retains his alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions. He otherwise uses the target's game statistics, but Gremorly doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
The possession lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, Gremorly ends it as a bonus action, or Gremorly is turned or forced out by an effect like the Dispel Evil and Good spell. When the possession ends, Gremorly reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

bonus_actions.name: Ethereal Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: Gremorly teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

spells: Gremorly casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

monsters.name: Grick Alpha
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The grick makes two attacks: one with its tail and one with its tentacles. If it hits with its tentacles, the grick can make one beak attack against the same target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit (with disadvantage against a target within 5 ft.), reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage while mounted.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Feather Fall
actions.desc: The rider wears a magic ring with which it can cast the feather fall spell on itself once as a reaction to falling. After the spell is cast, the ring becomes nonmagical.

monsters.name: Grim Champion of Bloodshed
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes four Blazing Morningstar attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Blade Storm, if available.

actions.name: Blazing Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Blade Storm (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The champion conjures a churning storm of spectral blades that fills a 20-foot cube centered on a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The storm lasts until the start of the champion's next turn. While the storm is active, the area of the storm is difficult terrain. Whenever a creature enters the storm for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Furious Pursuit
legendary_actions.desc: The champion moves up to its speed or commands its mount to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Induce Violence
legendary_actions.desc: The champion targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or immediately make one melee weapon attack against another creature of the champion's choice that is within the target's reach. If no creature is within the target's reach or if the target has the incapacitated condition, the target instead takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Menace (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The champion chooses any number of creatures it can see within 30 feet of itself. Each target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Grim Champion of Desolation
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes two Leeching Blade attacks and uses Hollow Void.

actions.name: Leeching Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 33 (6d10) cold damage, and the champion regains 10 hit points.

actions.name: Hollow Void
actions.desc: The champion summons a hungering rift around a creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The creature must make a 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (11d8) force damage and has the stunned condition until the start of the champion's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, the creature dies, and its body crumbles to dust.

bonus_actions.name: Step into Nothing (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The champion, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, has the invisible condition and teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The champion remains invisible until the start of its next turn or immediately after it deals damage.

legendary_actions.name: Crush
legendary_actions.desc: The champion unleashes a burst of crushing force on a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a 22 Strength saving throw or take 14 (4d6) force damage and have the prone condition.

legendary_actions.name: Fearsome Pursuit
legendary_actions.desc: The champion moves up to its speed or commands its mount to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Nullify (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The champion emits a magic wave in a 60-foot cone. Every spell of 5th level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the champion's choice in that area.

monsters.name: Grim Champion of Pestilence
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Halo of Pestilence
traits.desc: The champion is surrounded by an aura of deadly magic that takes the form of a host of glowing white insects. Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the champion must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or have the incapacitated condition until the start of its next turn, as the insects ravage its body.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes two Blight Staff attacks, two Plague Bolt attacks, or one of each.

actions.name: Blight Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Plague Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 23 (4d8 + 5) poison damage, and the target has the poisoned condition until the start of the champion's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The champion makes one Blight Staff or Plague Bolt attack.

legendary_actions.name: Furious Pursuit
legendary_actions.desc: The champion moves up to its speed or commands its mount to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The champion uses Spellcasting.

spells: The champion casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The grinning cat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage. If the grinning cat was invisible before it attacked, the target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the cat can make a Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Fade Away
actions.desc: The grinning cat magically becomes invisible for 1 hour or until it attacks, gradually fading away over the course of its turn. It can choose to leave part of its body visible, such as its tail, its head, or its grinning mouth. Any equipment the cat wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Fade Back
bonus_actions.desc: The grinning cat becomes visible or makes part of its body visible. Any equipment the cat wears or carries on a visible part of its body also becomes visible.

bonus_actions.name: Grinning Step
bonus_actions.desc: The grinning cat teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Grippli Warrior
monsters.languages: Grippli plus one other language (usually Common, Draconic, or Primordial)

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The grippli can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The grippli can leap 30 feet horizontally or 20 feet vertically from a standing position.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The grippli makes one attack with its tongue. If this attack hits, the grippli can make a melee attack using its trident against the same target.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. The target is grappled (escape 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the grippli can't grab another creature.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the groff is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the groff move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the groff isn't an ordinary moss-covered bog patch.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The groff can hold its breath for up to 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The groff makes one Bite attack and one Swamp Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Swamp Claw
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or become engulfed by the groff. While engulfed, the target can't breathe, is restrained, and takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. When the groff moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The groff can have only one target engulfed at a time.
An engulfed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns. On a success, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The grung can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Poisonous Skin
traits.desc: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The grung's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Water Dependency
traits.desc: If the grung isn't immersed in water for at least 1 hour during a day, it suffers 1 level of exhaustion at the end of that day. The grung can recover from this exhaustion only through magic or by immersing itself in water for at least 1 hour.

traits.name: Vigilant

actions.name: Multiattack

reactions.name: Protection
reactions.desc: When an attacker the giant can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 10 feet of the giant, the giant can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Guardian Portrait
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: Common, plus up to two other languages

traits.name: Constructed Nature
traits.desc:
An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The portrait is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the portrait must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or become unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the figure in the portrait remains motionless, the portrait is indistinguishable from a normal painting.

spells: The portrait's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12). The portrait can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.3/day each: counterspell, crown of madness, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: If it isn't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, the hadozee can extend its skin membranes to move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends in the air.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hadozee makes two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Musket
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Nimble Escape
bonus_actions.desc: The hadozee takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reactions.name: Safe Descent
reactions.desc: When it would take damage from a fall, the hadozee extends its skin membranes to reduce the fall's damage to 0, provided it isn't wearing heavy armor.

traits.name: Glide
traits.desc: If it isn't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, the hadozee can extend its skin membranes to move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends in the air.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Hag of the Fetid Gaze

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.desc:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

actions.name: Invisible Passage
actions.desc: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

spells: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

spells: While all three members of a hag coven are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, witch bolt

spells.3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow

monsters.spellsNotes: For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

monsters.name: Haint
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The haint doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The haint makes two Sorrowful Touch attacks.

actions.name: Sorrowful Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 21 (4d8 + 3) psychic damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The haint magically assumes the appearance of the Humanoid it was in life, while retaining its game statistics. The assumed appearance ends if the haint is reduced to 0 hit points or uses an action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Shared Sorrow
bonus_actions.desc:
The haint targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself that is missing any hit points, sharing its own torment with this pained soul. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be incapacitated.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the haint's Shared Sorrow for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Halaster Horror
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Halaster horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The Halaster horror is immune to the cone of cold, disintegrate, and fireball spells.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Halaster horror makes two staff attacks.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Half-Blue Dragon Gladiator
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The half-dragon has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the half-dragon hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The half-dragon makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The half-dragon exhales lightning in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The half-dragon adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the half-dragon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Half-Green Dragon Assassin
monsters.alignment: lawful neutral (law/chaos axis) chaotic neutral (good/evil axis) evil
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.languages: Thieves' cant plus any two languages, Draconic

traits.name: Assassinate
traits.desc: During its first turn, the half-dragon has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the half-dragon scores against a {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} creature is a critical hit.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the half-dragon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the half-dragon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The half-dragon deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the half-dragon that isn't incapacitated and the half-dragon doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The half-dragon makes two shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The half-dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Half-Ogre (Ogrillon)

actions.desc: The half-dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The half-dragon adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the half-dragon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The fire starter makes two Havoc Hammer or Havoc Flask attacks.

actions.name: Havoc Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

actions.name: Havoc Flask
actions.desc:
Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. 13 (2d12) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.
After the fire starter throws the flask, roll a d6; on a 3 or lower, the fire starter has no more flasks to throw.

monsters.name: Hare
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Escape
traits.desc: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The harengon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the harengon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit (the target gains no benefit from less than total cover), range 320 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. Hit or Miss: Immediately after making this attack, the harengon can use the Hide action.

traits.name: Aura of Command
traits.desc: Allies within 30 feet of the captain are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions. This aura is suppressed while the captain has the incapacitated condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The captain makes three Harmonium Blade attacks. The captain can also use Dictate if available.

actions.name: Harmonium Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Dictate (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The captain verbally commands up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. This magical command must be to undertake an action or to refrain from taking actions (for example, "Throw down your weapons").
A target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition for 1 minute, during which time it follows the captain's command. The effect ends early if the target takes damage or if it successfully completes the command. A target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if the command is directly harmful to itself, such as commanding it to walk into fire.
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The peacekeeper has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacekeeper's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

actions.name: Electrified Mancatcher
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 13). Until the grappled condition ends, the target has the restrained condition and can't teleport, the peacekeeper can't make Electrified Mancatcher attacks, and the target takes 8 (1d10 + 3) lightning damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Luring Maestro
traits.desc: While within 60 feet of the matriarch, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the matriarch's Luring Song.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The matriarch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The matriarch makes two claws attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fleeting Form
actions.desc: The matriarch can magically disguise itself to resemble a humanoid of roughly similar size and shape for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. This illusion does not hold up to close scrutiny.

actions.name: Luring Song
actions.desc:
The matriarch sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the matriarch that can hear the song must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The matriarch must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the matriarch is incapacitated.
While charmed by the matriarch, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the matriarch, the target must move on its turn toward the matriarch by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the matriarch, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this matriarch's song for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Visage of Desire (1/Day)
actions.desc: The matriarch projects a vision into the minds of creatures within 30 feet of it that aren't constructs or undead, showing each creature achieving whatever it most desires. An affected creature must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Plane Shift (2/Day)
actions.desc: The hawk casts Plane Shift on itself, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Dash
bonus_actions.desc: When the hawk is in dim light or darkness, it teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. The hawk then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

monsters.name: Harrow Hound
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Blink Dog, understands Sylvan but can't speak it

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

traits.name: Supernatural Tracker
traits.desc: The hound knows the distance to and direction of any creature that has come within 30 feet of it, even if that creature is on a different plane of existence. If the creature being tracked by the hound dies, the hound knows.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The hound magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Hashalaq Quori
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quori uses its Mind Thrust twice.

actions.name: Idyllic Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall prone in a fit of laughter.

actions.name: Mind Thrust
actions.desc: The quori targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 16 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reactions.name: Empathic Feedback
reactions.desc: When the quori takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, the quori can force that creature to succeed on a 16 Intelligence saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

spells: The quori's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

monsters.name: Headless Iron Golem
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_immunities: fire, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Headless
traits.desc: The golem is blinded and deafened, giving it disadvantage on all its attack rolls, and it can't use its Poison Breath.

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Sword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Hellfire Engine
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The hellfire engine is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hellfire engine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The hellfire engine doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Flesh-Crushing Stride
actions.desc:
The hellfire engine moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the hellfire engine enters must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the nearest space out of the hellfire engine's path. On a failed save, the creature falls prone and takes 28 (8d6) bludgeoning damage.
If the hellfire engine remains in the prone creature's space, the creature is also restrained until it's no longer in the same space as the hellfire engine. While restrained in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a 18 Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the hellfire engine and is no longer restrained.

actions.name: Hellfire Weapons
actions.desc: The hellfire engine uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 12: Bonemelt Sprayer
actions.desc: The hellfire engine spews acidic flame in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) fire damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the saving throw are drenched in burning acid and take 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage at the end of their turns. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to scrape off the burning fuel.

actions.name: 34: Lightning Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) lightning damage. Up to three other creatures of the hellfire engine's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target must each make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 56: Thunder Cannon
actions.desc:
The hellfire engine targets a point within 120 feet of it that it can see. Each creature within 30 feet of that point must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the chosen option kills a creature, the creature's soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

monsters.name: Hellwasp
monsters.languages: Infernal, telepathy 300 ft. (with other hellwasps only)

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The hellwasp's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hellwasp makes two attacks: one with its sting and one with its sword talons.

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Sword Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monsters.name: Helmed Horror
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The helmed horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The helmed horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include fireball, heat metal, and lightning bolt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The helmed horror makes two longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

monsters.name: Helmed Horror Detention Drone
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The drone has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spell Immunity
traits.desc: The drone is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include fireball, heat metal, and lightning bolt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drone makes two longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Detention Orb
actions.desc: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

monsters.name: Heralds of Dust Remnant

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The remnant makes two Necrotic Surge attacks.

actions.name: Necrotic Surge
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Phase (2/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The remnant becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains {@status concentration} on the effect (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the remnant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

spells: The remnant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monsters.name: Hexton Modron

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The hexton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.desc: The hexton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the hexton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the hexton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hexton makes one Pincer attack and two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the hexton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The hexton has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

reactions.name: Counter Magic
reactions.desc: The hexton attempts to interrupt a creature it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the hexton makes an Intelligence check (10 + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

reactions.name: Lightning Rebuke
reactions.desc: When a creature within 120 feet of the hexton damages it, the hexton magically retaliates with an arc of lightning. The creature must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The hexton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

spells.At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)

spells.1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

monsters.name: Hierophant Medusa
monsters.languages: Common plus any three languages (Abyssal, Celestial, Druidic, or Infernal recommended)

traits.name: Devotion's Call (1/Day)
traits.desc: The medusa can cast the Resurrection spell, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the medusa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The medusa makes one Constrict attack, one Final Blade attack, and one Snake Hair attack. Alternatively, it makes two Wrathful Strike attacks.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 20). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the medusa can't constrict another creature.

actions.name: Final Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) force damage. If the target has at least one head and the medusa rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it fails a 20 Constitution saving throw and can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 28 (8d6) force damage from the hit.

actions.name: Snake Hair
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Wrathful Strike
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 22 (3d10 + 6) radiant damage, and the target has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Petrifying Gaze (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc:
The medusa unleashes petrifying magic from its eyes in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw if it doesn't have the blinded condition. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature has the petrified condition. Otherwise, on a failed save, the creature takes 10 (3d6) force damage, begins to turn to stone, and has the restrained condition. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a failed save, it has the petrified condition, and on a successful save, the effect ends on it. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the Greater Restoration spell or other magic.
A creature can use its reaction, if available, to shut its eyes to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The medusa moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Wrathful Blast (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The medusa makes one Wrathful Strike attack.

legendary_actions.name: Final Slash (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The medusa makes one Final Blade attack with advantage.

spells: The medusa casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

monsters.name: Hierophant of the Comet
monsters.languages: Common plus any two languages, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Comet's Voice (1/Day)
traits.desc: The hierophant can cast Contact Other Plane, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hierophant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Thought Shield
traits.desc: The hierophant's thoughts can't be read by any means unless the hierophant allows it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hierophant makes two Herald's Axe attacks or three Comet Blast attacks.

actions.name: Herald's Axe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Comet Blast
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage.

actions.name: All-Consuming Star (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The hierophant conjures a manifestation of the All-Consuming Star: brilliant light and haunting screams that fill a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the hierophant can see within 60 feet of itself. Each creature within the sphere has the blinded and deafened conditions. Each creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage and has the incapacitated condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The manifestation persists until the hierophant dies, has the incapacitated condition, uses a bonus action to end the effect, or uses this action again.

bonus_actions.name: Star's Hunger
bonus_actions.desc: The hierophant targets one creature within 30 feet of the center of its All-Consuming Star. The target must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward the center of the All-Consuming Star.

spells: The hierophant casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

monsters.name: Hill Giant Avalancher

traits.name: Hill Rune
traits.desc:
The giant has a hill rune inscribed on a rock or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Stone Avalanche action and Hill Rebuff reaction.
The object bearing the rune has AC 15; 20 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a hill rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes one Greatclub attack and uses Stone Bolas.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage.

actions.name: Stone Bolas
actions.desc: The giant conjures three stone balls connected by lines of magical force and throws them at one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the restrained condition until the start of the giant's next turn, and the stones erupt in a burst of thunderous energy that deals 14 (4d6) thunder damage to the target and each creature within 10 feet of the target. On a successful save, the stones vanish without erupting.

actions.name: Stone Avalanche (Requires Hill Rune)
actions.desc:
The giant conjures a hail of rocks in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point on the ground it can see within 120 feet of itself. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 28 (8d6) bludgeoning damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.
The rocks turn the ground in that area into difficult terrain until the start of the giant's next turn, when the rocks vanish.

reactions.name: Hill Rebuff (Requires Hill Rune)
reactions.desc: Immediately after the giant takes damage from a creature it can see within 10 feet of itself, that creature must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) force damage and be pushed horizontally 10 feet away from the giant.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Rock Catching
reactions.desc: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hippocamp can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the hippocamp moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Hoard Form Only)
traits.desc: If the mimic is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mimic move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mimic is animate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mimic makes one Bite attack and two Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the mimic adheres to the target. A creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

actions.name: Caustic Mist (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The mimic sprays a fine mist of acid in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 (6d8) acid damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Shapechanger
actions.desc: The mimic transforms into a hoard or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monsters.name: Hoard Scarab
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the scarab is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the scarab move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the scarab is animate.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Scale Dust (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The scarab releases magical glittering dust from its wings. Each creature within 5 feet of the scarab must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be outlined in blue light for 10 minutes. While outlined in this way, a creature sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from being invisible. In addition, every Dragon within 1 mile of the creature becomes aware of it and can unerringly track the creature. Casting dispel magic on the creature ends the effect on it.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Captain
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Martial Advantage
traits.desc: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 10 (3d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hobgoblin makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: For 1 minute, the hobgoblin can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the hobgoblin. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the hobgoblin is incapacitated.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Devastator

traits.name: Army Arcana
traits.desc: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hobgoblin makes two Quarterstaff or Devastating Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) force damage.

actions.name: Devastating Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 21 (4d8 + 3) force damage, and the target is knocked prone.

spells: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.2/day each: fireball, fly, fog cloud, gust of wind, lightning bolt

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc:
The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an Unarmed Strike or a Dart attack. It can also use
Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Jaunt
actions.desc: The hobgoblin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it leaves and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

spells: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.1/day each: charm person, disguise self, silent image

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Warlord
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Martial Advantage
