traits.name: Otherworldly Perception
traits.desc: The kuo-toa can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

traits.name: Slippery
traits.desc: The kuo-toa has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kuo-toa makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The kuo-toa is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The kuo-toa has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, sanctuary, shield of faith

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Otherworldly Perception
traits.desc: The kuo-toa can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

traits.name: Slippery
traits.desc: The kuo-toa has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: The kuo-toa adds its Wisdom modifier to its armor class.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kuo-toa makes one bite attack and two unarmed strikes.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the kuo-toa's next turn.

monsters.name: Kuo-toa Whip
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Otherworldly Perception
traits.desc: The kuo-toa can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

traits.name: Slippery
traits.desc: The kuo-toa has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kuo-toa makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its pincer staff.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Pincer Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the kuo-toa can't use its pincer staff on another target.

spells: The kuo-toa is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kuo-toa has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Lady Illmarrow
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Illmarrow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Illmarrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: Illmarrow's body turns to dust when she drops to 0 hit points, and her equipment is left behind. She gains a new body after 1d10 days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within two hundred miles of the location at which she was destroyed.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Illmarrow's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against Illmarrow until the end of her next turn.

actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
Illmarrow exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't regain hit points. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.
A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises at the start of Illmarrow's next turn as a zombie. The zombie acts immediately after Illmarrow in the initiative count and is permanently under her command, following her verbal orders.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow casts a cantrip.

legendary_actions.name: Paralyzing Claw
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow uses her Paralyzing Claw.

legendary_actions.name: Frightening Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow targets up to three creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Illmarrow's Frightening Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Poison Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Illmarrow recharges her Poison Breath and uses it.

spells: Illmarrow is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). Illmarrow has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): magic missile, shield, sleep

spells.3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, fireball, fly, lightning bolt

spells.5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, cone of cold, hold monster, scrying

spells.6th level (2 slots): chain lightning, circle of death, create undead

spells.7th level (2 slots): finger of death, forcecage, prismatic spray

monsters.name: Lampad

traits.name: Corpse Stride
traits.desc: Once on its turn, the lampad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one creature's corpse within its reach and emerge from a second creature's corpse within 60 feet of the first corpse, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse. Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The lampad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lampad attacks twice with its necrotic touch or chill touch.

actions.name: Necrotic Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the lampad's next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lampad until the end of the lampad's next turn.

spells: The lampad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (+6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Lantern Archon
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Aura of Menace
traits.desc: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The archon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The archon can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The archon makes two Radiant Strike attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Teleport.

actions.name: Radiant Strike
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) radiant damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

bonus_actions.name: Shift Radiance
bonus_actions.desc: The archon reduces its Illumination to shed only dim light in a 5-foot radius, or it returns the light to full intensity.

spells: The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Large Mimic
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

monsters.name: Larva
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Lava Child
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from metal weapons

traits.name: Metal Immunity
traits.desc: The lava child can move through metal without hindrance, and it has advantage on attack rolls against any creature wearing metal armor or using a metal shield.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lava child makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Lawmage

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spells: The lawmage is an 8th-level Azorius spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The lawmage has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, friends, light, message

spells.1st level (4 slots): alarm, expeditious retreat, shield

spells.2nd level (3 slots): arcane lock, detect thoughts, hold person

monsters.name: Lazav

traits.name: Elusive
traits.desc: No attack roll has advantage against Lazav unless he is incapacitated.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Lazav fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Shapechanger Savant
traits.desc: Lazav can use a bonus action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid he has seen. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

traits.name: Psychic Defenses
traits.desc: Unless Lazav is incapacitated, he is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with Lazav only if he allows it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Lazav makes three shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before Lazav's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Lazav makes a weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Lazav casts one of his innate spells.

legendary_actions.name: Shifting Nightmare (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Lazav rapidly takes the form of several nightmarish creatures, lashing out at all nearby. Each creature within 10 feet of Lazav must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 18 (4d8) damage of a type chosen by Lazav: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or necrotic.

spells: Lazav's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 20). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect thoughts, encode thoughts psychic damage)

monsters.name: Leonin Iconoclast

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the leonin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the leonin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The leonin makes three weapon attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

spells: The leonin's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Lesser Death Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The dragon has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Cataclysmic Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a wave of ghostly purple flames in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the breath reduces it to 0 hit points. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by the breath's damage, as well as every corpse of such a creatures within the cone, becomes a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the dragon's control. The zombie acts on the dragon's initiative but immediately after the dragon's turn. Absent any other command, the zombie tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

monsters.name: Lesser Mummy Lord
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: The mummy wears a ring of fire resistance.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

actions.name: Dreadful Glare
actions.desc: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Aberrant Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When the emissary drops to 0 hit points, its body melts away. A greater star spawn emissary instantly appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of where the lesser emissary disappeared. The greater emissary uses the lesser emissary's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the emissary fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The emissary doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The emissary makes three attacks.

actions.name: Lashing Maw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage.

actions.name: Psychic Orb
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +13 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 18 (2d10 + 7) psychic damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The emissary polymorphs into a Small or Medium creature of its choice or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Orb
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary makes a Psychic Orb attack.

legendary_actions.name: Teleportation Maw (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and can make a Lashing Maw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Lash (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The emissary targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it and psychically lashes at that creature's mind. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 36 (8d8) psychic damage and be stunned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within 5 feet of the leucrotta must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The leucrotta makes one Bite attack and one Hooves attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Kicking Retreat
bonus_actions.desc: Immediately after the leucrotta makes a Hooves attack, it takes the {@action Disengage} action.

monsters.name: Leviathan
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Partial Freeze
traits.desc: If the leviathan takes 50 cold damage or more during a single turn, the leviathan partially freezes; until the end of its next turn, its speeds are reduced to 20 feet, and it makes attack rolls with disadvantage.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The leviathan deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.desc: The leviathan can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The leviathan makes one Slam attack and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) acid damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Tidal Wave (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The leviathan magically creates a wave of water that extends from a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. The wave is up to 250 feet long, up to 250 feet tall, and up to 50 feet wide. Each creature in the wave must make a 24 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (7d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 250 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The leviathan moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The leviathan makes one Slam attack.

monsters.name: Lichen Lich
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The lich makes four attacks.

actions.name: Poisonous Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Wither
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +9 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Fire Storm (7th-Level Spell; 1/Day)
actions.desc: The lich fills up to ten 10-foot cubes with fire. Every cube must be within 150 feet of the lich and occupy a space the lich can see, and each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If the lich chooses, plant life in the area is unaffected by the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The lich makes an attack.

legendary_actions.name: Poison Prick (Cost 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The lich targets one poisoned creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious until the poisoned condition ends on it.

legendary_actions.name: Sap Life (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. The lich regains a number of hit points equal to the amount of damage that the creature takes.

spells: The lich casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save 19):

spells.3/day each: detect magic, fog cloud, pass without trace

spells.1/day each: antilife shell, dispel magic, speak with plants, transport via plants

monsters.name: Lightning Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Berserk
traits.desc:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) lightning damage.

monsters.name: Lightning Hulk
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The lightning hulk sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

traits.name: Lightning Form
traits.desc: The lightning hulk can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the lightning hulk enters a creature's space on a turn, or if it begins its turn in a creature's space, that creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. The hulk can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. A creature that touches the lightning hulk or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Arc Lightning
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 18 (4d8) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and lightning jumps from the target to another creature of the lightning hulk's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target. The second creature must succeed on a 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 18 (4d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The liondrake makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blood-Chilling Roar (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The liondrake lets out a terrifying roar audible out to 300 feet. Any creature within 30 feet of the liondrake that can hear its roar must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the liondrake for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also paralyzed for the same duration. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this liondrake's Blood-Chilling Roar for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Living Bigby's Hand
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, unconscious

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Force Fist
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (4d8 + 8) force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the living spell can move it up to 5 feet and move with it, without provoking opportunity attacks.

actions.name: Grasping Hand
actions.desc: The living spell attempts to grab a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape 15). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The living spell can grapple only one creature at a time and can't use Force Fist until the grapple ends.

monsters.name: Living Blade of Disaster
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unfettered
traits.desc: The living spell can move through any barrier, even a wall of magical force.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Force Blade
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (4d12) force damage, unless the living spell rolled an 18 or higher on the d20 for the attack, in which case the attack is a critical hit that deals 78 (12d12) force damage instead.

reactions.name: Preemptive Strike
reactions.desc: The living spell makes a melee attack against a creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the living spell.

monsters.name: Living Burning Hands

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The living spell unleashes a thin sheet of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Living Cloudkill
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

actions.name: Magical Strike
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (5d6 + 5) poison damage.

actions.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The living spell creates a 40-foot-diameter sphere of fog within 60 feet of it (the fog spreads around corners). When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fog moves 10 feet away from the living spell at the start of each of its turns, rolling along the ground and through openings. The fog lasts for 10 minutes or until the living spell's {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

monsters.name: Living Demiplane
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Dimensional Form
traits.desc: The living spell can enter another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The living spell can't detach from a solid surface, such as a wall, ceiling, or floor. If it has no surface to attach to, the living spell is destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

traits.name: Extradimensional Chamber
traits.desc: When the living spell enters another creature's space (or vice versa) for the first time on a turn, the other creature must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or be pulled into the living spell's extradimensional space, an unfurnished stone chamber 30 feet in every dimension. A creature too big to fit in this space succeeds on the saving throw automatically. Creatures in the chamber never run out of breathable air. Magic that enables transit between planes, such as plane shift, can be used to escape the chamber, which has no exits otherwise. Creatures trapped inside the extradimensional chamber can't see, target, or deal damage to the living spell; however, they can damage the room around them. Each 5-foot-square section of ceiling, wall, and floor in the chamber has AC 17, 50 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that is nonmagical. If any section is reduced to 0 hit points, the living spell and its chamber are destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Planar Destruction
traits.desc: The living spell is destroyed when it or a 5-foot-square section of its extradimensional chamber is reduced to 0 hit points, or when the living spell has no surface to attach to. When the living spell is destroyed, the contents of its extradimensional chamber are expelled, appearing as close to the living spell's previous location as possible. Each expelled creature appears in a randomly determined unoccupied space, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the doll is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the doll move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the doll is animate.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The doll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the doll takes fire or psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doll's next turn. The doll is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The doll doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Grabby Hands
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. The target is grappled (escape 6) and takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until this grapple ends. The doll can grapple only one creature at a time.

bonus_actions.name: Cackle (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The doll cackles as it targets one or two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target that can hear the doll's cackling must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw, succeeding automatically if it has an Intelligence of 4 or lower. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 5 (2d4) psychic damage and is incapacitated for 1 minute as it is overcome by a fit of laughter. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this doll's Cackle for 24 hours.

monsters.name: Living Iron Statue
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The statue makes two attacks: one with its blade and one with its hammer.

actions.name: Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked prone.

actions.name: Whirl (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The statue can use its action to spin at the waist, targeting creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 (3d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Living Portent

traits.name: Brilliance (True Form Only)
traits.desc: The living portent sheds bright light for 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

actions.name: Radiant Strike
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 9 (1d12 + 3) radiant damage.

actions.name: Prophetic Blessing
actions.desc: The living portent magically infuses the power of its prophecy into another willing creature the living portent can see within 30 feet of itself. The target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 7 (1d8 + 3), and it gains a prophecy die, a d8. Once during each of the creature's turns, when it fails an ability check or saving throw or misses an attack roll, it can roll the prophecy die and add the number rolled to the total, potentially changing the outcome. The blessing ends after 1 hour or when the living portent ends the blessing (no action required) or uses this action again.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The living portent magically transforms into a Humanoid while retaining its game statistics (other than its size and Brilliance trait). The transformation ends if the living portent is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

reactions.name: Price of Defiance
reactions.desc: When the living portent is damaged by a creature that it can see within 120 feet of itself, radiant power sears the creature. The creature must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Hold Breath

If the lizardfolk is in crocodile form and the target is a Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizardfolk can't bite another target. If the lizardfolk reverts to its true form, the grapple ends.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.desc: The lizardfolk magically polymorphs into a crocodile, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

spells: The lizardfolk is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The lizardfolk has the following druid spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, thorn whip

spells.1st level (4 slots): entangle, fog cloud

A creature that fails this saving throw is also frightened until the end of its next turn.

traits.desc: The hunter can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

monsters.name: Lonely Sorrowsworn
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Psychic Leech
traits.desc: At the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Thrives on Company
traits.desc: The sorrowsworn has advantage on attack rolls while it is within 30 feet of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sorrowsworn makes one Harpoon Arm attack, and it uses Sorrowful Embrace.

actions.name: Harpoon Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The sorrowsworn has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.

actions.name: Sorrowful Embrace
actions.desc: Each creature grappled by the sorrowsworn must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the sorrowsworn pulls each of those creatures up to 30 feet straight toward it.

monsters.name: Lonelywood Banshee
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Detect Life
traits.desc: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

actions.name: Spectral Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage
actions.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Wail (1/Day)
actions.desc: The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.desc: The guard has advantage on saving throws against poison.

actions.name: Halberd
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

The creature must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has disadvantage on the saving throw.

reactions.desc: When another creature within 60 feet of the pledgemage misses a target with an attack roll, the pledgemage magically enables the attacker to reroll the attack roll. It must use the new roll.

monsters.name: Lorehold Professor of Chaos

traits.name: Voice from the Past (1/Day)
traits.desc: The professor can cast the contact other plane spell to contact a long-dead spirit, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Spectral Scroll attacks. It can also use Weight of History, if available.

actions.name: Spectral Scroll
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Weight of History (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The professor magically compresses time around up to six creatures of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of itself. Each target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute, but the restrained target's speed is halved instead of being reduced to 0. At the start of each of its turns, the restrained target takes 4 (1d8) force damage. A restrained target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Lorehold Professor of Order

traits.name: Voice from the Past (1/Day)
traits.desc: The professor can cast the contact other plane spell to contact a long-dead spirit, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Repelling Burst attacks. It can also use Force Barrier, if available.

actions.name: Repelling Burst
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet directly away from the professor and become restrained until the start of professor's next turn.

actions.name: Force Barrier (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The professor magically creates a wall of translucent, golden force within 90 feet of itself. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the professor uses this action again. The barrier can be a vertical or horizontal plane up to 30 feet on a side or a 10-foot-radius hemispherical dome with a floor. The wall provides total cover. It has AC 17, 30 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

reactions.name: Arcane Stasis (2/Day)
reactions.desc: When a creature the professor can see within 60 feet of it casts a spell, the professor can magically lock the casting in the moment before completion. The spellcaster must succeed on a 15 saving throw using the spell's spellcasting ability, or the spell fails and is wasted.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: dimension door, locate object, mage armor, stone shape

monsters.name: Lost Sorrowsworn
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sorrowsworn makes two Arm Spike attacks.

actions.name: Arm Spike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Embrace (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is frightened, and it takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The sorrowsworn can grapple only one creature at a time.

reactions.name: Tightening Embrace
reactions.desc: If the sorrowsworn takes damage, the creature grappled by Embrace takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Loup Garou
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (40 ft. in hybrid form, 50 ft. in dire wolf form)

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The loup garou has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: When the loup garou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The loup garou regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the loup garou takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the loup garou's next turn. The loup garou dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The loup garou makes two attacks: two with its Longsword (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

actions.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with loup garou lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Longsword (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The loup garou polymorphs into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire wolf, or back into its true form, which appears humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

legendary_actions.name: Swipe
legendary_actions.desc: The loup garou makes one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only).

legendary_actions.name: Mauling Pounce (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The loup garou moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and it can make one Claws attack (dire wolf or hybrid form only) or one Longsword attack (humanoid form only) against each creature it moves past.

legendary_actions.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The loup garou changes into hybrid or dire wolf form and then makes one Bite attack.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dragon doesn't require air.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a blast of frost in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 13 (3d8) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonus_actions.name: Phase (2/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon becomes partially incorporeal for as long as it maintains {@status concentration} on the effect (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While partially incorporeal, the dragon has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

monsters.name: Mad Golem
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Dwarvish, , Infernal, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The maelephant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The maelephant makes one Barbed Trunk attack and two Glaive attacks.

actions.name: Barbed Trunk
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. While it is grappling a creature, the maelephant can't use its barbed trunk to attack other creatures.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Mind Poison (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The maelephant expels poisonous gas from its trunk in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 39 (6d12) poison damage and has the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, the creature loses all weapon and skill proficiencies, it can't cast spells, it can't understand language, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only and is immune to this maelephant's Mind Poison for 24 hours.

monsters.name: Mage Hunter
monsters.speed: 40 ft., climb 40 ft. (hunter form only), fly 10 ft. (hover sentry form only)
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 19

traits.name: Magic Sense
traits.desc: The hunter knows the location of every spellcaster, active spell, and magic item within 120 feet of itself.

traits.name: Spider Climb (Hunter Form Only)
traits.desc: The hunter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack (Hunter Form Only)
actions.desc: The hunter makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw (Hunter Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the hunter can't make a Tail attack against another target.

actions.name: Mage Tracker (Sentry Form Only)
actions.desc:
The hunter emits a pulse of energy that helps it better locate its magical quarry. Each creature within 120 feet of the hunter that has the ability to cast spells must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be mystically marked by the hunter for 1 hour.
While marked, a creature can't become hidden from the hunter and gains no benefit from the invisible condition against the hunter. Additionally, while a marked creature is on the same plane of existence as the hunter, the hunter always knows the distance and direction to the creature.

bonus_actions.name: Shift Form
bonus_actions.desc: The hunter folds into its drone-like sentry form or unfolds into its hunter form. Its game statistics are the same in each form.

reactions.name: Consume and Destroy
reactions.desc: When the hunter takes damage from a spell, it takes only half the triggering damage (rounded down). If the creature that cast the spell is within 60 feet of the hunter, that creature must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take the other half of the damage.

monsters.name: Magewright
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

spells: The magewright's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12). To cast one of its rituals, the magewright must provide additional material components whose value in gold pieces is 20 times the spell's level. These components are consumed when the ritual is finished. The magewright knows the following spells:

monsters.name: Malaxxix
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Malaxxix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Malaxxix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Malaxxix makes two Forge Hammer or Whip attacks in any combination.

actions.name: Forge Hammer
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/180 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of Malaxxix's next turn. Hit or Miss: The hammer then magically returns to Malaxxix's hand.

actions.name: Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, and the target has the restrained condition for 1 minute. The restrained target can make a 20 Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Only one creature can be restrained by the whip at a time.

actions.name: Mezzoloth Vortex (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Malaxxix summons a vortex of whirling mezzoloths at a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The vortex is a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than Malaxxix in that area must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) force damage and has the restrained condition while within the cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of Malaxxix's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Fiendish Stride
legendary_actions.desc: Malaxxix moves up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. When Malaxxix moves within 5 feet of a creature during this movement, that creature takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

legendary_actions.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Malaxxix makes one Forge Hammer or Whip attack.

traits.name: Extraordinary Leap
traits.desc: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump 3 feet.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Sticky Leg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape 12). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

monsters.name: Malformed Kraken
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: understands Common but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The kraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks. One of them can be replaced with a bite attack, and any of them can be replaced with Fling.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Fling
actions.desc: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken's tentacles is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a 16 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Lightning Storm
actions.desc: The kraken creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 150 feet of it. A target must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Manes
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (2d4) slashing damage.

traits.name: Attractive Pollen (1/Day)
traits.desc: When the mantrap detects any creatures nearby, it can use its reaction to release pollen out to a radius of 30 feet. Any beast or humanoid within the area must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be forced to use all its movement on its turns to get as close to the the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the mantrap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary tropical plant.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. The target is trapped inside the mantrap's leafy jaws. While trapped in this way, the target is blinded and restrained, has total cover from an attacks and other effects outside the mantrap, and takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the target's turns. If the mantrap dies, the creature inside it is no longer restrained by it. A mantrap can engulf only one creature at a time.

monsters.name: Marid
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The marid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Elemental Demise
traits.desc: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into a burst of water and foam, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The marid makes two trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage, or 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Water Jet
actions.desc: The marid magically shoots water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked prone.

spells: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: create or destroy water, detect evil and good, detect magic, fog cloud, purify food and drink

spells.1/day each: conjure elemental (water elemental only), control water, gaseous form, invisibility, plane shift

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The adept makes three Unarmed Strike attacks or five Dart attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. Once per turn, the adept can cause one of the following additional effects (choose one or roll a d4):

actions.name: 12: Knock Down.
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: 34: Push.
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet directly away from the adept.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Deflect Missile
reactions.desc: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 3. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

monsters.name: Marut
monsters.damage_resistances: thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The marut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the marut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The marut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The marut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The marut makes two Unerring Slam attacks.

actions.name: Unerring Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 60 force damage, and the target is pushed up to 5 feet away from the marut if it is Huge or smaller.

actions.name: Blazing Edict (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Arcane energy emanates from the marut's chest in a 60-foot cube. Every creature in that area takes 45 radiant damage. Each creature that takes any of this damage must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the marut's next turn.

spells: The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a 20 Charisma saving throw or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

monsters.name: Master of Cruelties
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Aura of Blood Lust
traits.desc: When any other creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the master, that creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw, or it must immediately take the Attack action, making one melee attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary.

traits.name: Feed on the Crowd
traits.desc: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of the master dies, the master gains 15 temporary hit points and has advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The master has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The master makes two melee attacks with its spear.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Captivating Presence (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 120 feet of the master must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the master for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, a creature's speed is 0. If the charmed creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Captivating Presence of all masters of cruelties for the next 24 hours.

spells: The master's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The master can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: charm person (as a 3rd-level spell), crown of madness

monsters.name: Master of Souls

traits.name: Grave Magic
traits.desc: When the master of souls cast a spell that deals damage, it can change the spell's damage type to necrotic.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The master of souls attacks twice with its flail.

actions.name: Silvered Skull Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of the master of souls' next turn.

actions.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 13 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the master of souls' next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the master of souls for the same duration.

actions.name: Ray of Sickness (1st-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of the master of souls' next turn. If the master of souls casts this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

actions.name: Scorching Ray (2nd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target per ray (3 rays if a 2nd-level spell slot is used, 4 rays if a 3rd-level spell slot is used). 7 (2d6) fire damage per ray.

spells: The master of souls is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), mage hand, message, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): burning hands, detect magic, ray of sickness (see "Actions" below), shield

spells.2nd level (3 slots): darkness, misty step, scorching ray (see "Actions" below)

monsters.name: Master Sage

actions.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. 13 (3d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Fireball (3rd-Level Spell; 3/Day)
actions.desc: The sage creates a fiery explosion centered on a point it can see within 150 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

reactions.name: Shield (1st-Level Spell; 3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the sage is hit by an attack or targeted by a magic missile spell, it calls forth an invisible barrier of magical force that protects it. Until the start of its next turn, the sage has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

spells: The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

spells.3/day each: comprehend languages, detect magic, dispel magic, identify, levitate, locate object, Tenser's Floating Disk, unseen servant

spells.1/day each: banishment, contact other plane, Drawmij's instant summons, legend lore, locate creature, planar binding, polymorph, protection from evil and good, scrying, sending, true seeing

monsters.name: Master Thief
monsters.languages: any one language (usually Common) plus thieves' cant

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided the thief isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thief makes three Shortsword or Shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Cunning Action
bonus_actions.desc: The thief takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The thief halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The thief must be able to see the attacker.

monsters.name: Maurezhi
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Assume Form
traits.desc: The maurezhi can assume the appearance of any Medium Humanoid it eats. It remains in this form for 1d6 days, during which time the form gradually decays until, when the effect ends, the form sloughs from the demon's body.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The maurezhi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The maurezhi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0. It rises 24 hours later as a ghoul  unless it has been revived or its corpse has been destroyed.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.
