actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the necrichor's next turn.

actions.name: Blood Puppeteering (Recharge 6)
actions.desc:
The necrichor targets a creature it can see within 5 feet of it that is missing any of its hit points. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or the necrichor enters the target's space and attaches itself to the target for 1 minute. While attached, the necrichor takes only half damage dealt to it (round down), and the target takes the remaining damage. The necrichor can attach to only one creature at a time.
The attached necrichor can telepathically control the target's move, action, or both. When controlled this way, the target can take only the Attack action (necrichor chooses the target) or the Dash action. The attached target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, detaching from the necrichor and forcing it to move into the nearest unoccupied space on a success.

monsters.name: Necromancer Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The necromancer magically summons five skeleton. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reactions.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
reactions.desc: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

spells: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web

actions.name: Skull Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Claws of the Grave
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Necrotic Centipede
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Necrotic Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the centipede or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the centipede can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The centipede makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the centipede, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the centipede's turns.
If the centipede takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the centipede must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the centipede. If the centipede dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Needle Blight
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 9

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Needles
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Neh-thalggu
monsters.languages: Deep Speech; see also Brain Dump

traits.name: Brain Dump
traits.desc: Whenever the neh-thalggu consumes a brain, it gains the magical ability to speak and understand languages known by the brain's previous owner.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The neh-thalggu doesn't require air.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neh-thalggu makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Extract Brain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated Humanoid. 35 (10d6) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the neh-thalggu kills the target by extracting and consuming its brain.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The neh-thalggu magically emits psychic energy at one Humanoid it can see within 10 feet of itself. The target must make a 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

spells: The neh-thalggu casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:

spells.1/day each: arms of Hadar (1 brain), detect magic (2 brains), magic missile (3 brains), Tenser's floating disk (4 brains), darkness (5 brains), hold person (6 brains), invisibility (7 brains), spider climb (8 brains), fear (9 brains), hypnotic pattern (10 brains), major image (11 brains), stinking cloud (12 brains)

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Neogi Hatchling Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny neogi hatchling. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Swarm of Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 22 (6d6 + 1) poison damage, or 11 (3d6 + 1) poison damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Neogi Master
monsters.languages: Common, Deep Speech, Undercommon, telepathy 30 ft.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, or it makes two Tentacle of Hadar attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle of Hadar
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the neogi's next turn, as a spectral tentacle clings to the target.

bonus_actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

spells.1/day each: dimension door, hold person, hunger of Hadar

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Neogi Void Hunter
monsters.languages: Common, Deep Speech, telepathy 30 ft., Undercommon

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes two Eldritch Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eldritch Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

bonus_actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Neothelid
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 13

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The neothelid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the neothelid. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neothelid, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the neothelid's turns.
If the neothelid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the neothelid must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the neothelid. If the neothelid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The neothelid exhales acid in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The nereid can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Aquatic Invisibility
traits.desc: If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

traits.name: Mantle Dependent
traits.desc: The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and hit points equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

traits.name: Shape Water
traits.desc: The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of 30 feet and can affect a cube of water no larger than 30 feet on a side.

traits.name: Speak With Animals
traits.desc: The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

actions.name: Blinding Acid
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. 16 (2d12 + 3) acid damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the nereid's next turn.

actions.name: Drowning Kiss (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The nereid touches one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (3d12 + 3) acid damage. On a failure, it also runs out of breath and can't speak for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Water Lash
actions.desc: The nereid causes a 5-foot cube of water within 60 feet of it to take a shape of its choice and strike one target it can see within 5 feet of that water. The target must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and if it is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line or is knocked prone (nereid's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

traits.name: Aura of Murder
traits.desc: As long as the night blade is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within 5 feet of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The scavver doesn't require air.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature that is missing any hit points), reach 10 ft., one target. 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Nightmare Shepherd

traits.name: Aura of Nightmares
traits.desc: Undead creatures within 30 feet of the shepherd gain a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When any other creature that isn't undead or a construct starts its turn within 30 feet of the shepherd, that creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The shepherd has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shepherd makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its staff.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 26 (4d12) psychic damage.

actions.name: Herd the Underworld (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The shepherd pulls twisted souls from the Underworld; 1d6 shadow (without Sunlight Weakness) arise in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the shepherd. The shadows act right after the shepherd on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the shepherd dies.

spells: The shepherd's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.1/day each: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: Nightsea chil-liren can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Nightveil Specter
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Mount
traits.desc: If the specter isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto its gloamwing mount, provided the specter and the gloamwing are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the specter appears astride the gloamwing along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the specter can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, and both it and its mount gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The specter makes two scythe attacks.

actions.name: Scythe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Mind Twist (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The specter magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (5d8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Reap Memory (3/Day)
actions.desc: The specter touches one incapacitated creature and chooses 1 hour from among the past 24. Unless the creature succeeds on a 15 Intelligence saving throw, the creature loses all memory of that hour. The creature regains the memory only if the specter dies within the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Nightwalker
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Annihilating Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

traits.name: Life Eater
traits.desc: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

actions.name: Enervating Focus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Nilbog

traits.name: Nilbogism
traits.desc:
Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.
The nilbog can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through its Reversal of Fortune reaction.

actions.name: Fool's Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Mocking Word
actions.desc: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Nimble Escape
bonus_actions.desc: The nilbog takes the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action.

reactions.name: Reversal of Fortune
reactions.desc: In response to another creature dealing damage to the nilbog, the nilbog reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.

spells: The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Nimblewright
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: understands one language known to its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The nimblewright has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The nimblewright's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Repairable
traits.desc: As long as it has at least 1 hit point remaining, the nimblewright regains 1 hit point when a mending spell is cast on it.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The nimblewright has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nimblewright makes three attacks: two with its rapier and one with its dagger.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The nimblewright adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the nimblewright must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monsters.name: Niv-Mizzet
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 21

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Niv-Mizzet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Locus of the Firemind
traits.desc: Niv-Mizzet can maintain {@status concentration} on two different spells at the same time. In addition, he has advantage on saving throws to maintain {@status concentration} on spells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Niv-Mizzet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master Chemister
traits.desc: When Niv-Mizzet casts a spell that deals damage, he can change the spell's damage to cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d4 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 16 (2d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet casts one of his cantrips.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet beats his wings. Each creature within 15 feet of him must succeed on a 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (2d4 + 9) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. Niv-Mizzet can then fly up to half his flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Dracogenius (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Niv-Mizzet regains a spell slot of 3rd level or lower.

spells: Niv-Mizzet is a 20th-level Izzet spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 26, +18 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, unseen servant

spells.2nd level (3 slots): blur, enlarge/reduce, flaming sphere, hold person, scorching ray

spells.5th level (2 slots): conjure elemental, polymorph, wall of fire, wall of force

spells.8th level (1 slots): control weather, maze, power word stun

monsters.name: Nivix Cyclops
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The cyclops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cyclops makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Spell Vitalization
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature casts a spell of 1st level or higher within 120 feet of the cyclops, the cyclops can move up to twice its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. It can then make one slam attack against a target of its choice.

monsters.name: Nonaton Modron

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The nonaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.desc: The nonaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the nonaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nonaton makes three Arm attacks and uses Pillar of Truth or Spellcasting.

actions.name: Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the nonaton can't use this arm against other targets. The nonaton has nine arms, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Pillar of Truth
actions.desc: The nonaton chooses a point on the ground that it can see within 60 feet of itself. A 60-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius cylinder of magical force rises from that point. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) force damage, and the creature reverts to its original form (if it's in a different form) and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

spells: The nonaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)

spells.1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

monsters.name: Nosferatu
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The nosferatu regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight. If the nosferatu takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of the nosferatu's next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The nosferatu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The nosferatu takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The nosferatu doesn't require air.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nosferatu makes two Claw attacks followed by one Bite attack. If both Claw attacks hit the same creature, the Bite attack is made with advantage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.
The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the nosferatu regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises as a nosferatu after 1d10 days.

actions.name: Blood Disgorge (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The nosferatu vomits blood in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

monsters.name: Nothic
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nothic makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rotting Gaze
actions.desc: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Weird Insight
actions.desc: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

monsters.name: Nupperibo
monsters.senses: blindsight 20 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 11

traits.name: Cloud of Vermin
traits.desc: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 20 feet of one or more nupperibos must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) acid damage. A creature within the areas of two or more nupperibos makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

traits.name: Driven Tracker
traits.desc: In the Nine Hells, the nupperibo can flawlessly track any creature that has taken damage from any nupperibo's Cloud of Vermin within the previous 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Nycaloth
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The nycaloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The nycaloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nycaloth makes two melee attacks, or it makes one melee attack and teleports before or after the attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns due to a fiendish wound. Each time the nycaloth hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (2d4). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful 13 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (2d12 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The nycaloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The nycaloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. The nycaloth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), mirror image

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the ram moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The ram has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

monsters.name: Oblex Spawn
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Obzedat Ghost
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Council of Five
traits.desc: The ghost has a trait based on who it is, as shown below:

traits.name: Enezesku: Enfeebling Ray
traits.desc: Enezesku's Innate Spellcasting trait includes ray of enfeeblement, which he can cast at will.

traits.name: Fautomni: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces Fautomni to 0 hit points, he must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, Fautomni drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Karlov: Unnatural Vigor
traits.desc: When Karlov regains hit points, he has advantage on attack rolls he makes on his next turn.

traits.name: Vuliev: Teleportation
traits.desc: Vuliev's Innate Spellcasting trait includes misty step, which he can cast at will.

traits.name: Xil Xaxosz: Lingering Spite
traits.desc: When Xil Xaxosz is reduced to 0 hit points, his incorporeal form explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within 5 feet of him must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the ghost fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the ghost regains hit points equal to half the amount of damage the target takes. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Convene the Ghost Council
actions.desc: The ghost summons the other four members of the Obzedat. At the start of the ghost's next turn, the other members appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the summoner. The ghosts each roll initiative when they appear.

legendary_actions.name: Forced Obedience
legendary_actions.desc: A target that all of the Obzedat ghosts can see must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or bow until the end of its next turn. Until this bow ends, the target can't take actions or reactions, and its speed is 0 and can't be increased.

legendary_actions.name: Indentured Spirits (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Obzedat ghosts conjure 1d6 indentured spirit (described in this chapter) within 60 feet of one of them.

spells: The ghost's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.At will: chill touch (at 5th level, and the ghost regains hit points equal to half the amount of damage the target takes)

monsters.name: Octon Modron

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The octon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Combat Ready
traits.desc: The octon has advantage on initiative checks.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the octon dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The octon makes three Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind of Tentacles (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The octon rapidly extends and spins its ring of tentacles. Each creature within 20 feet of the octon must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward the octon. Then, the octon makes two Tentacle attacks against each creature within 10 feet of itself.

spells: The octon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)

spells.1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The oculorb has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Watchful Eyes
traits.desc: The oculorb has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oculorb makes two Dreadful Contact attacks or four Eye Beam attacks.

actions.name: Dreadful Contact
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, or 25 (6d6 + 4) psychic damage if the target has the frightened condition.

actions.name: Eye Beam
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Antipathic Flood (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The oculorb releases a wave of negative emotions, choosing one of the following options:

actions.name: Weeping Eyes
actions.desc: The oculorb weeps, releasing a wave of crushing despair. Each creature within 30 feet of the oculorb must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature's speed is reduced to 0 feet until the end of the oculorb's next turn, and if the creature was {@status concentration||concentrating}, its {@status concentration} is broken.

actions.name: Withering Glare
actions.desc: The oculorb's eyes unleash furious scarlet energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) necrotic damage and has the frightened condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

reactions.name: Obsessive Rebuke
reactions.desc: When the oculorb is damaged by a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself, it forces the creature to make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. The creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Oddlewin

traits.name: Fortune Teller
traits.desc: Oddlewin can cast the Augury spell as a ritual, using cards as the material component.

traits.name: Nilbogism
traits.desc:
Any creature that attempts to damage Oddlewin must first succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or have the charmed condition until the end of the creature's next turn. The creature must use its action praising Oddlewin.
Oddlewin can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through his Reversal of Fortune reaction.

actions.name: Fool's Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Cloud of Cards
actions.desc: Oddlewin conjures magical cards that slash at the air in a 5-foot cube within 60 feet of Oddlewin until the start of Oddlewin's next turn. A creature that starts its turn in the cube or that enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 10 (4d4) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Nimble Escape
bonus_actions.desc: Oddlewin takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reactions.name: Reversal of Fortune
reactions.desc: In response to another creature dealing damage to Oddlewin, Oddlewin reduces the damage to 0 and regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

spells: Oddlewin casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ogre makes two Bash attacks.

actions.name: Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the ogre can push the target 5 feet away if the target is Huge or smaller.

reactions.name: Block the Path
reactions.desc: When a creature enters a space within 5 feet of the ogre, the ogre makes a Bash attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bolt Launcher
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. 17 (3d10 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chain Smash (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Chain Sweep
actions.desc: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Goblin Projectile
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft. (can't hit targets within 30 feet of the hucker), one target. Hit: 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage, or 10 (4d4) piercing damage if the projectile is wearing a spiked helmet. {@i Hit or Miss:} The goblin projectile takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet it travels through the air (maximum 20d6).

traits.name: Howdah
traits.desc: The ogre carries a compact fort on its back. Up to four Small creatures can ride in the fort without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the ogre, they must use spears or weapons with reach. Creatures in the fort have three-quarters cover against attacks and effects from outside it. If the ogre dies, creatures in the fort are placed in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the ogre.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Ogre Skeleton
monsters.languages: Common, Giant, understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Oinoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The oinoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oinoloth makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Corrupted Healing (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The oinoloth touches one willing creature within 5 feet of it. The target regains all its hit points. In addition, the oinoloth can end one disease on the target or remove one of the following conditions from it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The target then gains 1 level of exhaustion, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6). This reduction can be removed only by a wish spell or by casting greater restoration on the target three times within the same hour. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The oinoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

bonus_actions.name: Bringer of Plagues (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc:
The oinoloth blights the area in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. The blight lasts for 24 hours. While the area is blighted, all normal plants there wither and die.
Furthermore, when a creature moves into the blighted area or starts its turn there, that creature must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the oinoloth's Bringer of Plagues for the next 24 hours.
The poisoned creature can't regain hit points. After every 24 hours that elapse, the poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). This reduction lasts until the poison ends, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. The poison ends after the creature successfully saves against it three times.

spells: The oinoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only)

monsters.name: Old Troglodyte
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Chameleon Skin
traits.desc: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troglodyte makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: One-Eyed Shiver

traits.name: Chilling Mist
traits.desc: While it is alive, the one-eyed shiver projects an aura of cold mist within 10 feet of itself. If the one-eyed shiver deals damage to a creature in this area, the creature also takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye of Frost
actions.desc: The one-eyed shiver casts ray of frost from its missing eye. If it hits, the target is also restrained. A target restrained in this way can end the condition by using an action, succeeding on a 13 Strength check.

spells: The one-eyed shiver is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand

spells.1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, mage armor, thunderwave

monsters.name: Ooze Master
monsters.damage_resistances: lightning, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, prone

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.desc:
A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to 5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.
The Ooze Master can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

traits.name: Instinctive Attack
traits.desc: When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm
reactions.desc: If a creature the Ooze Master can see makes an attack roll against it while within 30 feet of it, the Ooze Master can use a reaction to divert the attack if another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature that is closest to it, not including itself or the Ooze Master. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, the attacker is immune to this Instinctive Charm for 24 hours. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

spells: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness

spells.2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion

monsters.name: Oracle

traits.name: Blessings of the Gods
traits.desc: While the oracle is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier. In addition, a creature that hits the oracle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Eldritch Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

reactions.name: Divine Insight (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the oracle or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the oracle can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

spells: The oracle's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.3/day each: bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person

monsters.name: Oracle of Strixhaven

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the Oracle fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Oracle makes two Magic Flare attacks. She can also use Paradoxy, if available.

actions.name: Magic Flare
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 24 (3d12 + 5) force damage.

actions.name: Paradoxy (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Momentary warps in reality appear at three different points the Oracle can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on each point must make a 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) force damage and is pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line toward the center of the sphere. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. A creature caught in the area of multiple warps is affected by only one, which the Oracle chooses.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The Oracle teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space she can see within 60 feet of herself.

legendary_actions.name: Vector Shift
legendary_actions.desc: The Oracle teleports one creature she can see within 60 feet of herself, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of herself. An unwilling target must succeed on a 18 Charisma saving throw to avoid the effect.

legendary_actions.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Oracle uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Vortex Jaunt (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Oracle uses Teleport, and immediately after she disappears, each creature within 30 feet of the space she left must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or take 16 (3d10) force damage.

spells: The Oracle casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.2/day each: dispel magic, mage armor, remove curse, sending

spells.1/day each: power word stun, scrying (as an action), wall of force

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Foe Smiter of Ilneval
traits.desc: The orc deals an extra die of damage when it hits with a longsword attack (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The orc makes two melee attacks with its longsword or two ranged attacks with its javelins. If Ilneval's Command is available to use, the orc can use it after these attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage when used with two hands.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Ilneval's Command (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Up to three allied orcs within 120 feet of this orc that can hear it can use their reactions to each make one weapon attack.

monsters.name: Orc Claw of Luthic

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The orc makes two claw attacks, or four claw attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

spells: The orc is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bane, cure wounds, guiding bolt

spells.3rd level (2 slots): bestow curse, create food and water

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc commoner can move up to your speed toward a hostile creature that they can see.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Orc Eye of Gruumsh
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Gruumsh's Fury
traits.desc: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (1d6 + 3 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

spells: The orc is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, command

monsters.name: Orc Hand of Yurtrus
monsters.languages: understands Common and Orc but can't speak

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Touch of the White Hand
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

spells: The orc is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no verbal components to cast its spells. The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bane, detect magic, inflict wounds, protection from evil and good

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Corrupted Carrier
traits.desc: When the orc is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes, and any creature within 10 feet of it must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and becomes poisoned. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A creature poisoned by this effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. While poisoned by this effect, a creature can't regain hit points.

traits.name: Nurtured One of Yurtrus
traits.desc: The orc has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Corrupted Vengeance
actions.desc: The orc reduces itself to 0 hit points, triggering its Corrupted Carrier trait.

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the orc can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Hand of Shargaas
traits.desc: The orc deals 2 extra dice of damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack (included in its attacks).

traits.name: Shargaas's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the orc's darkvision.

traits.name: Slayer
traits.desc: In the first round of a combat, the orc has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. If the orc hits a creature that round who was {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The orc makes two scimitar or dart attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 10 (3d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Veil of Shargaas (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The orc casts darkness without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

monsters.name: Orc War Chief
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

traits.name: Gruumsh's Fury
traits.desc: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The orc makes two attacks with its greataxe or its spear.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (1d12 + 4 plus 1d8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 12 (1d6 + 4 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
actions.desc: Each creature of the war chief's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the war chief's next turn. The war chief can then make one attack as a bonus action.

monsters.name: Orcus
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Undeath
traits.desc: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Wand of Orcus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Conjure Undead (1/Day)
actions.desc: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures {@filter Undead creatures|bestiary|type=undead} whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Orcus makes one Tail or Necrotic Bolt attack.

legendary_actions.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcus's next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

spells: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:

spells.At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead

spells.1 charges: circle of death, finger of death

monsters.name: Oread

traits.name: Invisible in Fire
traits.desc: The oread is invisible while fully immersed in fire.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The oread has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oread attacks twice with its fiery touch or fire bolt.

actions.name: Fiery Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) fire damage.

reactions.name: Hellish Rebuke (2nd-Level Spell; 1/Day)
reactions.desc: When the oread is damaged by a creature within 60 feet of the oread that it can see, the creature that damaged the oread must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Blood Aegis
traits.desc: The AC of the blood mage includes its Constitution modifier while it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

traits.name: Oriq Mask
traits.desc: The blood mage wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, the blood mage can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and it adds double its proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

traits.name: Sanguine Sense
traits.desc: While the blood mage isn't blinded, it can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blood mage makes two Blood Lash attacks.

actions.name: Blood Lash
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the blood mage's next turn.

actions.name: Blood Boil (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The blood mage chooses a point within 150 feet of itself, and a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of the blood mage's choice that it can see in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Oriq Recruiter

traits.name: Misdirecting Defense
traits.desc: The AC of the recruiter includes its Charisma modifier while it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

traits.name: Oriq Mask
traits.desc: The recruiter wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, the recruiter can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and it adds double its proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The recruiter makes two Psychic Knife attacks. It can use Spellcasting in place of one of the attacks.

actions.name: Psychic Knife
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one creature. 21 (5d6 + 4) psychic damage.

spells: The recruiter casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Orog
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the orog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The orog makes two greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Orthon
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Infernal Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d4 + 6) force damage, and the target must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Brass Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

actions.name: Acid
actions.desc: The target must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an additional 17 (5d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Blindness
actions.desc: The target takes 5 (1d10) radiant damage. In addition, the target and all other creatures within 20 feet of it must each make a successful 17 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the orthon's next turn.

actions.name: Concussion
actions.desc: The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 (2d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Entanglement
actions.desc: The target must make a successful 17 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 hour by strands of sticky webbing. The target can escape by taking an action to make a 17 Strength or Dexterity check and succeeding.

actions.name: Paralysis
actions.desc: The target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage and must make a successful 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tracking
actions.desc: For the next 24 hours, the orthon knows the direction and distance to the target, as long as it's on the same plane of existence. If the target is on a different plane, the orthon knows which one, but not the exact location there.

bonus_actions.name: Invisibility Field (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The orthon becomes invisible. Any equipment it wears or carries is also invisible as long as the equipment is on its person. This invisibility ends immediately after it makes an attack roll or is hit by an attack roll.

reactions.name: Explosive Retribution
reactions.desc: In response to dropping to 15 hit points or fewer, the orthon explodes. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must each make a 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orthon, its infernal dagger, and its brass crossbow are destroyed.

traits.name: Focus
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the giant can target a creature it can see within 30 feet of it and make that creature its focus. The target remains the giant's focus for 1 minute, or until either the target or the giant drops to 0 hit points. When the giant makes an attack roll against its focus, it adds a d4 to its attack roll. If the giant attacks a different target while it has a focus, it subtracts a d4 from its attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage. If the Orzhov giant scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.desc: Magic and other features can't determine the corrupter's creature type. If a creature tries to read the corrupter's thoughts, that creature must succeed on a 20 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the corrupter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The corrupter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corrupter makes three Whispering Blade attacks and can use Debilitating Touch.

actions.name: Whispering Blade
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to speak until the start of the corrupter's next turn.

actions.name: Debilitating Touch
actions.desc: The corrupter's squirming tentacle lashes out at a creature the corrupter can see within 30 feet of itself.
