The target must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Debilitating Touch for 24 hours.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The corrupter magically transforms into any creature that is Small or Medium, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the corrupter is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: When an attacker the corrupter can see hits the corrupter with an attack, the corrupter halves the attack's damage against it.

legendary_actions.name: Cunning
legendary_actions.desc: The corrupter escapes nonmagical restraints and ends the grappled and restrained conditions on itself, then moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Stab (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The corrupter makes one Whispering Blade attack.

legendary_actions.name: Amorphous Escape (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The corrupter dissolves into a shifting mass of flesh, tentacles, eyes, claws, and mouths. Up to two creatures the corrupter can see within 20 feet of itself must make a 20 Intelligence saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This transformation lasts until the end of the corrupter's next turn. While transformed, the corrupter has advantage on attack rolls, attack rolls made against it have disadvantage, and it can move through spaces at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Virulent Breath
traits.desc: Noxious gas from the mutate's digestion of previous meals spews from its mouth. At the start of the mutate's turn, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mutate makes two Bite or Tentacle attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Chitin Slam.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. On a successful save, the target is no longer poisoned. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until it no longer has the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape 15) and the restrained condition until this grapple ends. The mutate has two tentacles that can grapple one target each.

actions.name: Chitin Slam
actions.desc: The mutate targets one creature it is grappling, slamming the creature against its chitinous plating. The creature must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage and have the stunned condition until the end of the mutate's next turn.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The ox is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the ox moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Panopticus Wizard

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
traits.desc: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison and resistance to poison damage.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

spells: The Dwarf is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The paper bird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Sharp Edges
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 slashing damage.

monsters.name: Paper Whirlwind
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Beaks
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
Any creature swallowed by a parasite-infested behir must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the behir's turns or be feasted upon by blood parasites, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. This damage is in addition to the damage caused by the behir's digestive acids.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Pari
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The pari has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The pari doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pari makes three Mace attacks.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

actions.name: Disorienting Futures
actions.desc: The pari attempts to flood the mind of one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself with visions of the future. The target must succeed on a 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the pari's next turn.

spells: The pari casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 19):

spells.2/day each: cure wounds (as a 6th-level spell), lesser restoration

spells.1/day each: commune (as an action), dispel evil and good

monsters.name: Pazrodine

traits.name: Guardian of the Market
traits.desc: Pazrodine can sense when an item is stolen from Seelie Market. She knows the distance and direction to stolen items, as if by the Locate Object spell.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Pazrodine fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Pazrodine makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Pazrodine uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Dream Breath
actions.desc: Pazrodine exhales mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or have the unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

actions.name: Moonlight Breath
actions.desc: Pazrodine exhales a beam of moonlight in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: Pazrodine makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Pazrodine uses Spellcasting.

spells: Pazrodine casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

traits.name: Keen Sight and Smell
traits.desc: The peacock has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The peacock has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacock's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Pech
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 120 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The pech has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the pech has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pech makes two Fortified Pickaxe attacks. If it hits a Large or smaller creature with both attacks, the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Fortified Pickaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) force damage. If the target is a Construct or an object, the attack is automatically a critical hit.

spells: The pech works with three or more pechs to cast spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save 12). If at least three other pechs are within 30 feet of it, the pech can cast Wall of Stone. If at least seven other pechs are within 30 feet of it, it can cast Greater Restoration. Each other pech involved in casting the spell can't have the incapacitated condition and must have at least one use of Communal Spellcasting remaining, which it must immediately expend to participate (no action required).
The pech casts Stone Shape, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The pentadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the pentadrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pentadrone makes five arm attacks.

actions.name: Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Paralysis Gas (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The pentadrone exhales a 30-foot cone of gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Peryton
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

traits.name: Dive Attack
traits.desc: If the peryton is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage to the target.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The peryton doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Keen Sight and Smell
traits.desc: The peryton has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The peryton makes one gore attack and one talon attack.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The pest regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If it takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the pest's next turn.

traits.name: Spiny Hide
traits.desc: At the start of each of its turns, the pest deals 2 (1d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it or that it is grappling.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Phantom Warrior
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Spectral Armor and Shield
traits.desc: The phantom warrior's AC accounts for its spectral armor and shield.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phantom warrior makes two attacks with its spectral longsword.

actions.name: Spectral Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.desc: The phantom warrior enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

monsters.name: Phantom Warrior (Archer)
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The phantom warrior can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Spectral Armor and Shield
traits.desc: The phantom warrior's AC accounts for its spectral armor and shield.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phantom warrior makes two attacks with its spectral longsword or spectral longbow.

actions.name: Spectral Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.desc: The phantom warrior enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Spectral Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) force damage.

monsters.name: Phoenix
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
traits.desc:
If the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature in 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the phoenix must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
The explosion destroys the phoenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals 21 (6d6) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

traits.name: Fire Form
traits.desc:
The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.
With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The phoenix doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The phoenix deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phoenix makes two attacks: one Beak attack and one Fiery Talons attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage.

actions.name: Fiery Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Peck
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix makes one beak attack.

legendary_actions.name: Swoop (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed and makes one Fiery Talons attack.

monsters.name: Phylaskia
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned

traits.name: Gatekeeper's Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the phylaskia must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the phylaskia to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the phylaskia drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Vigilant
traits.desc: The phylaskia can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phylaskia makes two longsword attacks and uses its Strength Drain once.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, its Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

monsters.name: Piercer
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 8

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the piercer remains motionless on the ceiling, it is indistinguishable from a normal stalactite.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Drop
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, one creature directly underneath the piercer. 3 (1d6) piercing damage per 10 feet fallen, up to 21 (6d6). Miss: The piercer takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen.

traits.name: Cargo Hauler
traits.desc: The bosun has advantage on Strength checks.

traits.name: Sea Legs
traits.desc: The bosun has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

actions.name: Light Hammer
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hook
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 13).

traits.name: Flourish
traits.desc: The captain adds its Charisma modifier to the damage roll for its longsword attacks (included in the attack).

traits.name: Sea Legs
traits.desc: The captain has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The captain makes two attacks: one with its hand crossbow and one with its longsword.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands.

reactions.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
reactions.desc: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

monsters.name: Pirate Deck Wizard

traits.name: Sea Legs
traits.desc: The deck wizard has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The deck wizard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): friends, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): disguise self, fog cloud, mage armor, witch bolt

spells.2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, Melf's acid arrow, misty step

traits.name: Sea Legs
traits.desc: The first mate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The first mate makes two attacks with its longsword.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, the first mate can choose to deal no damage with the attack to disarm the target. The target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding on the ground.

monsters.name: Pixie
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Superior Invisibility
actions.desc: The pixie magically turns invisible until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the pixie wears or carries is invisible with it.

spells: The pixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only its pixie dust as a component:

spells.1/day each: confusion, dancing lights, detect evil and good, detect thoughts, dispel magic, entangle, fly, phantasmal force, polymorph, sleep

monsters.name: Planar Incarnate
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the incarnate fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The incarnate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Planar Form
traits.desc: An incarnate on the Upper Planes is a Celestial. An incarnate on the Lower Planes is a Fiend.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The incarnate deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The incarnate makes two Slam or Energy Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 27 (3d12 + 8) force damage.

actions.name: Energy Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 32 (5d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial.

actions.name: Planar Exhalation (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The incarnate exhales concentrated energy native to its plane in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) necrotic damage if the incarnate is a Fiend or radiant damage if the incarnate is a Celestial, and the creature has the blinded condition until the end of the incarnate's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

reactions.name: Searing Gaze
reactions.desc: In response to being hit by an attack roll, the incarnate turns its magical gaze toward one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself and commands it to combust. The target must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or take 16 (3d10) fire damage.

reactions.name: Teleport
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature the incarnate sees ends its turn, the incarnate teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The plasmoid can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided it is wearing and carrying nothing. It has advantage on ability checks it makes to initiate or escape a grapple.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The plasmoid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plasmoid makes three Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit (with advantage if the plasmoid has one or more allies within 10 feet of itself), reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The plasmoid halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The plasmoid must be able to see the attacker.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The plasmoid can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided it is wearing and carrying nothing. It has advantage on ability checks it makes to initiate or escape a grapple.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The plasmoid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plasmoid makes two Pseudopod attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a Javelin attack.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The plasmoid can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide, provided it is wearing and carrying nothing. It has advantage on ability checks it makes to initiate or escape a grapple.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The plasmoid can hold its breath for 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plasmoid makes three Pseudopod attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a Spear or Pistol attack.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Pistol
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Podling
monsters.languages: Deep Speech, the languages the creature knew in life

traits.name: Semblance of Life
traits.desc: The podling is a physical copy of a creature digested by a bodytaker plant. The podling has the digested creature's memories and behaves like that creature, but with occasional lapses. An observer familiar with the digested creature can recognize the discrepancies with a successful 20 Wisdom (Insight) check, or automatically if the podling does something in direct contradiction to the digested creature's established beliefs or behavior. The podling melts into a slurry when it dies, when the bodytaker plant that created it dies, or when the bodytaker plant dismisses it (no action required).

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The podling doesn't require sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Poison Weird
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious

traits.name: Invisible in Water
traits.desc: The weird is invisible while fully immersed in toxic brew.

traits.name: Brew Bound
traits.desc: The weird dies if forced to leave the basin of toxic brew it inhabits, or if a purify food and drink spell is cast on the brew.

traits.name: Poisonous Body
traits.desc: A creature takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns while grappled by a poison weird.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13) and pulled 5 feet toward the poison weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the poison weird tries to drown it, and the poison weird can't constrict another target.

monsters.name: Poltergeist
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The poltergeist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the poltergeist has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Invisibility
traits.desc: The poltergeist is invisible.

actions.name: Forceful Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) force damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Thrust
actions.desc:
The poltergeist targets a creature or unattended object within 30 feet of it. A creature must be Medium or smaller to be affected by this magic, and an object can weigh up to 150 pounds.
If the target is a creature, the poltergeist makes a Charisma check contested by the target's Strength check. If the poltergeist wins the contest, the poltergeist hurls the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target then comes into contact with a hard surface or heavy object, the target takes 1d6 damage per 10 feet moved.
If the target is an object that isn't being worn or carried, the poltergeist hurls it up to 30 feet in any direction. The poltergeist can use the object as a ranged weapon, attacking one creature along the object's path (+4 to hit) and dealing 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage on a hit.

traits.name: Acidic Blood
traits.desc: When Polukranos takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of Polukranos takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: Polukranos can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Polukranos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.desc: Polukranos has five heads. While it has more than one head, Polukranos has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever Polukranos takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, Polukranos dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken 40 or more fire damage since its last turn. Polukranos regains 20 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.desc: For each head Polukranos has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only to make opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: Polukranos deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: While Polukranos sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Polukranos makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 16 (2d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Polukranos.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: Polukranos makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Swipe
legendary_actions.desc: Polukranos makes a tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Trampling Charge (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Polukranos moves up to 50 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature Huge or smaller. The first time it enters each creature's space during this move, it can make a stomp attack against that creature.

monsters.name: Precognitive Mage

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Glimpse the Temporal Flood (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The mage targets one creature within 120 feet of it that it can see. The target takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage, and it must succeed on a 14 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Precognitive Insight (3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the mage or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the mage can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

spells: The mage's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14). It can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

traits.name: Tattoo of Osybus
traits.desc:
If the priest drops to 0 hit points, roll on the Boons of Undeath table for the boon the priest receives. The priest dies if it receives a boon it already has. If it receives a new boon, it revives at the start of its next turn with half its hit points restored, and its creature type is now Undead.
To prevent this revival, the Tattoo of Osybus on the priest's body must be destroyed. The tattoo is invulnerable while the priest has at least 1 hit point. The tattoo is otherwise an object with AC 15, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage. It has 15 hit points, but it regains all its hit points at the end of every combatant's turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The priest attacks twice.

actions.name: Soul Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it is paralyzed until the start of the priest's next turn. If this damage reduces a Medium or smaller creature to 0 hit points, the creature dies, and its soul is trapped in the priest's body, manifesting as a shadowy Soul Tattoo on the priest. The soul is freed if the priest dies.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 17 (3d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the priest's next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Soul Tattoo (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc:
The priest touches one of the Soul Tattoos on its body. The tattoo vanishes as the trapped soul manifests as a shadowy creature that appears in an unoccupied space the priest can see within 30 feet of it. The creature has the size and silhouette of its original body, but it otherwise uses the stat block of a shadow.
The shadow obeys the priest's mental commands (no action required) and takes its turn immediately after the priest. If the creature is within 5 feet of the priest, it can turn back into a tattoo as an action, reappearing on the priest's flesh and regaining all its hit points.

monsters.name: Prismari Apprentice

actions.name: Elemental Strike
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) fire or cold damage (the apprentice's choice).

bonus_actions.name: Surge of Artistry (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The apprentice moves up to its speed, surrounding itself with elemental magic as it moves. Until the end of its turn, the apprentice can move through the space of other creatures. The first time the apprentice enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. If the apprentice ends its turn in another creature's space, the apprentice takes 5 (1d10) force damage and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

spells: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.1/day each: gust of wind, mage armor, silent image

monsters.name: Prismari Pledgemage

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the pledgemage is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the pledgemage instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The pledgemage makes two Elemental Strike attacks.

actions.name: Elemental Strike
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) fire or cold damage (the pledgemage's choice).

actions.name: Showstopper (1/Day)
actions.desc: The pledgemage shines with elemental magic, targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must make a 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 28 (8d6) fire or cold damage (the pledgemage's choice) and is stunned until the start of the pledgemage's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

bonus_actions.name: Surge of Artistry (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The pledgemage moves up to its speed, surrounding itself with elemental magic as it moves. Until the end of its turn, the pledgemage can move through the space of other creatures. The first time the pledgemage enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. If the pledgemage ends its turn in another creature's space, the pledgemage takes 5 (1d10) force damage and is pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

spells: The pledgemage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monsters.name: Prismari Professor of Expression

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes three Cinder Strike attacks.

actions.name: Cinder Strike
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) fire damage.

actions.name: Lightning Flourish (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The professor unleashes arcs of magical lightning at up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each target must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Flaming Leap
bonus_actions.desc: The professor is wreathed in flames and jumps up to 30 feet in any direction. When the professor lands, the flames erupt in a 10-foot radius around the professor and then vanish. Each creature of the professor's choice in that area must succeed on a 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) fire damage.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: fog cloud, gust of wind, mage armor

monsters.name: Prismari Professor of Perfection

traits.name: Water Walking
traits.desc: The professor can walk across water and other liquids as if they were solid ground.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes three Tidal Strike attacks.

actions.name: Tidal Strike
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) cold damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rushing Wave
bonus_actions.desc: The professor is momentarily surrounded by a swirling wave of water and moves up to 30 feet. When the professor moves within 5 feet of any other creature during this bonus action, that creature must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw, or the creature is knocked prone and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. A creature can suffer this effect only once during a turn.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: control water, create or destroy water, mage armor, stone shape

monsters.name: Prophetess Dran

traits.name: Divine Eminence
traits.desc: As a bonus action, Prophetess can expend a spell slot to cause her melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Prophetess expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: Prophetess has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

spells: Prophetess is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Prophetess has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary

monsters.name: Psionic Ashenwight
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
monsters.languages: telepathy 120 ft., understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ashenwight makes two Necrotic Shard attacks. It also uses Psionic Crown if available.

actions.name: Necrotic Shard
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Psionic Crown (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The ashenwight wreathes the head of a creature it can see within 60 feet of itself with a crown of jagged, spectral crystals. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target's thoughts are sluggish; it can't take reactions, its speed is halved, and it takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The ashenwight casts one of the following spells, requiring no spellcasting components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Psionic Shambling Mound
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

spells: The shambling mound casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 8):

monsters.name: Psurlon
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Aberrant Mind

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Psychic Crush
actions.desc: The psurlon targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a 13 Wisdom saving throw, taking 14 (2d10 + 3) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.desc: The psurlon targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 (3d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Purple Wormling
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 30 ft., passive Perception 8

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wormling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Small or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wormling, and it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of the wormling's turns.
If the wormling takes 10 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wormling must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the wormling. If the wormling dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Quadrone
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The quadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the quadrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quadrone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The drone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the drone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The drone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Detention Orb
actions.desc: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to 30 feet in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (15) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

bonus_actions.name: Vortex Calculus (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The pledgemage teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of itself. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 20 feet of the space it left must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 (2d6) force damage and is moved 10 feet in a random horizontal direction. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't moved.

spells: The pledgemage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.1/day each: dimension door, enlarge/reduce, mage armor, plant growth

monsters.name: Quandrix Professor of Substance

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Spatial Blade attacks.

actions.name: Spatial Blade
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit (the target can't benefit from cover less than total cover), reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) force damage, or 22 (4d8 + 4) force damage if the professor is Large or larger, and the professor can push the target horizontally up to 10 feet away.

bonus_actions.name: Dilation (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The professor magically alters its physical form until it uses this bonus action again, until it is incapacitated or dies, or until it dismisses the effect (no action required). Choose one of the following options:

bonus_actions.name: Expand
bonus_actions.desc: The professor becomes Large if there is sufficient room for it to grow. It has advantage on attack rolls and on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Strength.

bonus_actions.name: Contract
bonus_actions.desc: The professor becomes Small. Its walking speed increases to 60 feet, attack rolls against it have disadvantage, and it has advantage on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Dexterity.

reactions.name: Avoidant Translation (2/Day)
reactions.desc: When the professor is hit by an attack roll, it can increase its AC by 3 against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. The professor can then teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: guidance, mage hand, mending (as an action)

spells.1/day each: creation (as an action), dimension door, mage armor, plant growth, polymorph

monsters.name: Quandrix Professor of Theory

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Heuristic Lance attacks. It can also use Overriding Theorem, if available.

actions.name: Heuristic Lance
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. 13 (2d8 + 4) psychic damage, and the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Overriding Theorem (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The professor magically influences the mind of up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each target must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or become charmed by the professor until the start of the professor's next turn. The charmed creature must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move up its speed toward another creature of the professor's choice and make one melee attack against that other creature.

reactions.name: Divide by Zero (2/Day)
reactions.desc: When the professor sees another creature within 60 feet of itself casting a spell, the professor can try to nullify the spell's formation. The creature must succeed on a 15 saving throw using the spell's spellcasting ability, or the spell fails and is wasted.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.1/day each: mage armor, major image, mirage arcane (as an action), Rary's telepathic bond

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The quetzalcoatlus doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the quetzalcoatlus flew least 30 feet toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Blurred Movement
traits.desc: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless it is incapacitated or its speed is 0.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quickling makes three Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Radiant Idol
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_resistances: radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Aura of False Divinity
traits.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the radiant idol must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw, provided the radiant idol isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the radiant idol. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, a creature is immune to this radiant idol's Aura of False Divinity for 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The radiant idol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: The radiant idol chooses a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet of it. A 30-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder of bright light appears there until the start of the radiant idol's next turn. Each creature in the cylinder when it appears or that ends its turn there must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The radiant idol's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The radiant idol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: charm person, cure wounds, disguise self, thaumaturgy

spells.1/day each: commune, dominate person, insect plague, mass suggestion, raise dead

monsters.name: Rak Tulkhesh
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Deadly Critical
traits.desc: Rak Tulkhesh scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 and rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Rak Tulkhesh fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Rak Tulkhesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Whirlwind of Weapons
traits.desc: A magical aura of weapons surrounds Rak Tulkhesh in a 10 foot radius. At the start of each of his turns, any other creature in the aura takes 14 (4d6) force damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh makes four weapon attacks.

actions.name: Spawned Melee Weapon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage.

actions.name: Spawned Ranged Weapon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +12 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 17 (3d8 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc:
Rak Tulkhesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than his own, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (his choice).
In a new form, Rak Tulkhesh retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh makes one weapon attack.

legendary_actions.name: End Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Rak Tulkhesh casts dispel magic.

legendary_actions.name: Provoke Rage (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of Rak Tulkhesh must succeed on a 24 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged weapon attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary. This attack is made with advantage and gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.

spells: Rak Tulkhesh's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 24). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect thoughts, dispel magic, spirit guardians

spells.1/day each: banishing smite, blinding smite, staggering smite

monsters.name: Rakdos
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Captivating Presence
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Rakdos must make a 25 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by Rakdos for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from him. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to Rakdos's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Cruel Entertainment
traits.desc: When a creature Rakdos can see within 60 feet of him is reduced to 0 hit points, Rakdos gains 25 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Rakdos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Rakdos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: Rakdos's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Rakdos makes two attacks with his Curtain-Call Scythe or his claws.

actions.name: Curtain-Call Scythe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage.

legendary_actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of Rakdos that is his ally or is charmed by him must use its reaction to move up to half its speed toward the creature closest to it that it can see, provided it isn't already within 5 feet of that creature. It then must make one melee attack against that creature if it is able to do so.

legendary_actions.name: Scythe (Costs 2 Actions)

While poisoned in this way, the creature can't maintain {@status concentration} on a spell or any other effect that requires {@status concentration}. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: Rakdos's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 25). He can innately cast hellish rebuke (at 5th level) at will, requiring no material components.
