traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the blight move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight is animate.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The blight can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blight makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit (with advantage if the target is missing any of its hit points), reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Life-Draining Vines (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Snaking vines erupt from the blight. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) slashing damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If at least one of the creatures that failed this save isn't a Construct or an Undead, the blight regains 9 hit points.

monsters.name: Reaper of Bhaal

traits.name: Aura of Murder
traits.desc: As long as the reaper is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within 5 feet of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The reaper makes two dagger attacks and uses Shroud Self.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shroud Self
actions.desc: The reaper magically turns invisible until the start of its next turn. This invisibility ends if the reaper makes an attack roll, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spells: The reaper's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Reaper Spirit
monsters.ac: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet shunted.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spirit makes a number of Reaping Scythe attacks equal to half the level of the spell (rounded down).

actions.name: Reaping Scythe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack your spell attack modifier to hit (with advantage), reach 5 ft., the creature haunted by Haunt Creature. 1d8 + 3 + summonSpellLevel necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Haunt Creature
bonus_actions.desc: The spirit targets a creature it can see within 10 feet of itself and begins haunting it. While the target is haunted, you and the spirit sense the direction and distance to the target if it is on the same plane of existence as you. Additionally, if the target starts its turn within 10 feet of the spirit, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or have the frightened condition until the start of the target's next turn. The target remains haunted until it dies, the spirit disappears, or the spirit uses this action again.

monsters.name: Reckoner

traits.name: First Strike
traits.desc: The reckoner has advantage on initiative rolls.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

reactions.name: Lightning Backlash (Recharge 5-6)
reactions.desc: When a creature hits the reckoner with an attack, the attacker takes lightning damage equal to half the damage dealt by the attack.

spells: The reckoner is a 5th-level Boros spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The reckoner has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, message, shocking grasp

spells.1st level (4 slots): guiding bolt, shield, thunderwave, witch bolt

monsters.name: Red Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it can use Frightful Presence or Incite Fanaticism.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 38 (7d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the abishai's choice that is within 120 feet and aware of the abishai must succeed on a 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abishai's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Incite Fanaticism
actions.desc: The abishai chooses up to four other creatures within 60 feet of it that can see it. Until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with advantage and can't be frightened.

actions.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
actions.desc: The abishai targets one Dragon it can see within 120 feet of it. The Dragon must make a 18 Charisma saving throw. A chromatic dragon makes this save with disadvantage. On a successful save, the target is immune to the abishai's Power of the Dragon Queen for 1 hour. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. This effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

monsters.name: Red Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Chromatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (5d8) fire damage.

monsters.name: Red Slaad
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a diseasea minuscule slaad egg.
A humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg to term at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the unborn slaad is disintegrated.

monsters.name: Red Wizard

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

spells: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation

spells.1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.desc: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.desc: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The redcap makes three Wicked Sickle attacks.

actions.name: Wicked Sickle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ironbound Pursuit
actions.desc: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Mucous Cloud
traits.desc: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.desc: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Enslave (3/Day)
actions.desc:
The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.
Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.desc: The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Swipe
legendary_actions.desc: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by the aboleth takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.desc:
If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a 10 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn't {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1. Charm Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.

actions.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3. Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 4. Slowing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5. Enervation Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is incapacitated.
If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

actions.name: 7. Sleep Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

actions.name: 8. Petrification Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.
If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

actions.name: 10. Death Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary_actions.name: Eye Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

monsters.name: Reduced-Threat Black Pudding
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.desc: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to 5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.desc: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The carrion crawler makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Reduced-Threat Clay Golem
monsters.damage_immunities: acid, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Acid Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.desc: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.

actions.name: Haste (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

actions.name: Crush
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.
While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful 11 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
actions.desc: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Displacement
traits.desc: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The displacer beast makes two attacks with its tentacles.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Reduced Threat
traits.desc: A reduced-threat monster takes a 2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

traits.name: Amphibious

traits.name: Reduced Threat

actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can make a 9 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to bludgeoning, poison and psychic damage.

traits.name: Berserk
traits.desc:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a 13 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Aversion of Fire
traits.desc: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

traits.name: Reduced Threat

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.
If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

The target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The reflection can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new reflection rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.desc: The refraction can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

actions.desc: Creatures of the refraction's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a 19 Intelligence saving throw or take 33 (5d10 + 6) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The chieftain adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the chieftain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Brute

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash

reactions.desc: The great warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the great warrior must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

spells: The shaman is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh

spells.1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave

monsters.name: Reghed Warrior
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The regisaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The regisaur makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack. The regisaur can't target the same creature with both attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 47 (6d12 + 8) piercing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape 18). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the regisaur can't Bite another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 26 (4d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Swallow
bonus_actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Huge or smaller creature grappled by the regisaur. The regisaur swallows the target, and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature has the blinded and restrained conditions, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the regisaur, and it takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The regisaur can have up to two creatures swallowed at a time.
If the regisaur takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a swallowed creature, the regisaur must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 5 feet of the regisaur and has the prone condition; the creature no longer has the blinded and restrained conditions.

monsters.name: Reigar

traits.name: Glory
traits.desc: The reigar's Armor Class includes its Charisma modifier.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The reigar can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: The reigar wears a talarith.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The reigar makes two Trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) force damage if the reigar is wearing its talarith.

actions.name: Chromatic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +10 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. 22 (5d8) damage of a type chosen by the reigar from the following list: cold, fire, lightning, or radiant.

actions.name: Summon Duplicate (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Using its talarith, the reigar summons a duplicate of itself. The duplicate obeys the reigar's commands and uses the reigar's statistics, except it is an unaligned Construct that doesn't have a talarith of its own. The duplicate takes its turn immediately after the reigar. It vanishes after 1 hour or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

spells: The reigar casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

monsters.name: Reindeer
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the reindeer moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Relentless Juggernaut
monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the juggernaut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The juggernaut regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the juggernaut takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The juggernaut dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The juggernaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The juggernaut makes two attacks. It can replace one attack with Deadly Shaping if it is ready.

actions.name: Executioner's Pick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the juggernaut's next turn.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Deadly Shaping (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The juggernaut magically shapes a feature of its surroundings into a deadly implement. A creature the juggernaut can see within 60 feet of it must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the targeted creature is struck by one of the following (juggernaut's choice):

actions.name: Flying Stone
actions.desc: The target takes 22 (5d8) bludgeoning damage and is incapacitated until the start of the juggernaut's next turn, and the implement vanishes.

actions.name: Scything Shrapnel
actions.desc: The target takes 14 (4d6) slashing damage, and the implement vanishes. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage from the wound left by the shrapnel. The wound ends if the target regains any hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check.

legendary_actions.name: Implacable Advance
legendary_actions.desc: The juggernaut moves up to its speed, ignoring difficult terrain. Any object in its path takes 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage if it isn't being worn or carried.

legendary_actions.name: Rapid Shaping (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The juggernaut recharges Deadly Shaping and uses it.

monsters.name: Relentless Slasher
monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
traits.desc: If the slasher fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Shrouded Presence
traits.desc: The slasher is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, and it can't be detected by abilities that sense Fiends.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it suffers a lingering wound that causes it to take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. Each time the slasher hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 3 (1d6). The wound ends if the target regains hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check.

legendary_actions.name: Slice
legendary_actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Vanishing Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The slasher makes one Slasher's Knife attack. After the attack hits or misses, the slasher can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Claws

reactions.name: Slow but Sturdy

monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15
monsters.languages: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.desc: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses Force Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

actions.name: Foreleg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Force Beam
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

spells: The retriever casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.3/day each: plane shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature, which is considered willing for the spell), web

traits.name: Unreadable Face
traits.desc: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Revenant
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.desc: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.desc: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the revenant for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

traits.name: Card Sense
traits.desc: The riffler can smell the presence of magical cards, including Decks of Many Things and other magical decks, within 1 mile of itself. It knows the direction to any such cards in that range. Effects that protect a target from divination magic block this sense.

traits.name: Riffling Step
traits.desc: The riffler can burrow through any nonmagical material that isn't iron, shuffling the substance through which the riffler moves aside like cards to form a tunnel that closes behind the riffler.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The riffler makes two Spectral Card attacks.

actions.name: Spectral Card
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage plus 5 (1d10) damage that is radiant if the d10 roll is an even number and necrotic if it's odd.

actions.name: Card Spray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The riffler magically unleashes a spray of spectral cards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (5d10) force damage and has the restrained condition for 1 minute as cards bind it. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Plane Shift
actions.desc: The riffler casts the Plane Shift spell targeting only itself, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

reactions.name: Shuffle Destiny
reactions.desc: When a creature the riffler can see within 30 feet of itself makes an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, the riffler can magically force that creature to roll a d6 and either add the number rolled to the total or subtract it from the total (riffler's choice), potentially changing the outcome.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the rime hulk dies, it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of frigid air and frost centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rime hulk makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Trail of Frost (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The rime hulk moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. Each time the rime hulk enters another creature's space for the first time during this move, that creature must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the rime hulk's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

monsters.name: Rip Tide Priest

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

spells.Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield

monsters.name: Riverine

traits.name: Amphibious

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the riverine fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Flood Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

bonus_actions.name: Whirlpool Step
bonus_actions.desc: The riverine magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. Both the space it leaves and its destination must be in or on the surface of water.

legendary_actions.name: Whirlpool Rush
legendary_actions.desc: The riverine uses its Whirlpool Step. Immediately after it teleports, each creature within 5 feet of the riverine's destination space takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

legendary_actions.name: Raging Deluge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The riverine unleashes a torrent of river water in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

spells: The riverine casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

monsters.name: Rock Gnome Recluse

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
traits.desc: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

actions.name: Magic Missile (Expends a 1st-Level Spell Slot)
actions.desc: The gnome creates three magical darts. Each dart hits a creature the gnome chooses within 120 feet of it and deals 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage.

actions.name: Ray of Frost
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the gnome's next turn.

spells: The gnome is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)

spells.1st level (3 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile (see "Actions" below), shield

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The rooster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 slashing damage.

traits.name: Rancid Degeneration
traits.desc: At the end of each of the troll's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, unless the troll has taken acid or fire damage since the end of its last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the roth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Rowboat Mimic
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

traits.name: Ambusher
traits.desc: In the first round of a combat, the stalker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: The stalker can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Ruin Dweller
traits.desc: The stalker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in ruins, and its speed is not reduced in difficult terrain composed of rubble.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The stalker deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The stalker makes three attacks with its shortsword.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: {@atk m} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Ruin Grinder
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the ruin grinder is subjected to fire damage, it regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The ruin grinder deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The ruin grinder can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ruin grinder makes two Excavator attacks.

actions.name: Excavator
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) force damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

traits.name: Ruinous Acid
traits.desc: Any nonmagical weapon that hits the spider corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the spider is destroyed after dealing damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spider makes two Ruinous Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Web.

actions.name: Ruinous Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) acid damage. In addition, if the target is a creature wearing nonmagical armor, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an Armor Class of 10 is destroyed.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. The target has the restrained condition. As an action, a restrained target can make a 13 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a successful check. The webbing can also be destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to acid, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

monsters.name: Runed Behir
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_actions.name: Lesser Magic
legendary_actions.desc: The behir casts color spray or sleep, requiring no components.

legendary_actions.name: Greater Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The behir casts invisibility or misty step, requiring no components.

monsters.name: Runic Colossus
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The colossus makes two Slam attacks and then uses Stomp.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 22 Dexterity saving throw or have the prone condition. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature has the restrained condition. The restrained creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can use its action to make a 22 Strength check. On a successful check, the affected creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained.

actions.name: Arcane Beam (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The colossus fires a beam of magical force from its chest, hands, or head in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 58 (9d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Spell Reflection (2/Day)
reactions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +14 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature casting a spell of 5th level or lower. 26 (4d12) force damage, and the target must succeed on a 15 Intelligence saving throw or the spell fails and has no effect.

traits.name: Immobilizing Fear
traits.desc: When a creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more rutterkins, that creature must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. The creature has disadvantage on the save if it's within 30 feet of six or more rutterkins. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the rutterkins for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is restrained. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rutterkins for 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned. At the end of each long rest, the poisoned target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while poisoned in this way, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes. The transformation can be undone only by a wish spell.

monsters.name: Sacred Statue
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: the languages the {@creature eidolon|MPMM} knew in life

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the statue is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the statue move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the statue isn't an object.

traits.name: Ghostly Inhabitant
traits.desc: The eidolon that enters the statue remains inside it until the statue drops to 0 hit points, the eidolon uses a bonus action to move out of the statue, or the eidolon is turned or forced out by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the eidolon leaves the statue, it appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the statue.

traits.name: Inert
traits.desc: Without an eidolon inside, the statue is an object.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The statue doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The statue makes two Slam or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 43 (6d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 60 ft./240 ft., one target. 37 (6d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

traits.name: Unarmored Movement
traits.desc: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 10 feet (included in its speed).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The monk makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The monk adds 2 to its AC against one melee or ranged weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the monk must see the attacker.

monsters.name: Sage

actions.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +6 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

reactions.name: Shield (1st-Level Spell; 3/Day)
reactions.desc: When the sage is hit by an attack or targeted by a magic missile spell, it calls forth an invisible barrier of magical force that protects it. Until the start of its next turn, the sage has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

spells: The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

spells.1/day each: dispel magic, levitate, locate object, see invisibility, sending, tongues, unseen servant

monsters.name: Sahuagin Baron
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.desc: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.desc: The blademaster has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The blademaster can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The blademaster can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The blademaster makes three attacks with its wavecutter blade, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Wavecutter Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The champion has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The champion can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The champion can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes three attacks with its spear, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The coral smasher has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The coral smasher can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The coral smasher can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The coral smasher deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The coral smasher makes two attacks with its warhammer, or one attack with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The deep diver has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Brine Lurker
traits.desc: The deep diver has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while submerged in water.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The deep diver can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Lure
traits.desc: The deep diver can cause its lure to light up or darken at will. While the lure is lit, the deep diver sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius centered on itself and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The deep diver can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deep diver makes two attacks with its glaive, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Light of Sekolah
actions.desc: The deep diver pulses magical light from its lure. Any creature within 30 feet of the deep diver that can see the light must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn. A creature charmed in this way is incapacitated as it stares at the light.

monsters.name: Sahuagin Hatchling Swarm
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Seething
traits.desc: Once it enters combat, the swarm deals 10 slashing damage to itself at the end of its turn if it did not make an attack on that turn. This damage ignores resistance, and it cannot reduce the swarm to 0 hit points.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Sahuagin High Priestess

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The high priestess has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The high priestess can breathe air and water, but she needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The high priestess can magically command any shark within 120 feet of her, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The high priestess makes two attacks with her toothsome staff, or one attack with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Toothsome Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

spells: The high priestess is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt

spells.3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, fear, mass healing word, tongues

traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

spells: The sahuagin is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt

monsters.name: Sahuagin Wave Shaper

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The wave shaper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The wave shaper can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.
