traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The scavver doesn't require air.

actions.name: Swallowing Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 45 (6d12 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 16 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the scavver. The scavver can have one creature swallowed at a time.
A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the scavver, and takes 11 (2d10) acid damage at the start of each of the scavver's turns from the digestive juices in the scavver's gullet.
If the scavver takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the scavver must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the scavver. If the scavver dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

bonus_actions.name: Ray of Fear (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The scavver's eye emits an invisible, magical ray that targets one creature the scavver can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the scavver until the start of the scavver's next turn.

traits.name: Violent Death
traits.desc: When a corpse is reduced to 0 hit points, it splits open, disgorging a swarm of poisonous snakes. The snakes are hungry and fight until slain.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Walking Statue of Waterdeep
monsters.damage_immunities: cold, fire, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Crumbling Colossus
traits.desc: When the statue drops to 0 hit points, it crumbles and is destroyed. Any creature on the ground within 30 feet of the crumbling statue must make a 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The statue deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The statue makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hurled Stone
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +16 to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. 43 (6d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Walrus
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The walrus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

actions.name: Tusks
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: War Priest

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The war priest makes two Maul attacks, and it uses Holy Fire.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage  plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage.

actions.name: Holy Fire
actions.desc: The war priest targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and it is blinded until the start of the war priest's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

bonus_actions.name: Healing Light (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The war priest or one creature of its choice within 60 feet of it regains 12 (2d8 + 3) hit points.

spells: The war priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.1/day each: banishment, command, dispel magic, flame strike, guardian of faith, hold person, lesser restoration, revivify

monsters.name: Warden Archon
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Aura of Menace
traits.desc: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

traits.name: Eternal Vigil
traits.desc: The archon can't be surprised. Moreover, it knows when any creature uses a portal it is assigned to guard.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The archon makes two Claw attacks and one Tracker's Bite attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the grappled condition (escape 18). The archon can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tracker's Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, for the next 24 hours, the archon knows the distance and direction to the target while they are both on the same plane of existence.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

spells: The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.1/day each: aid, continual flame, protection from evil and good, scrying (as an action)

monsters.name: Warforged Colossus
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Towering Terror
traits.desc: Any enemy outside the colossus that starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the enemy's next turn. If the enemy's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this colossus's Towering Terror for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The colossus makes three attacksone with its slam and two with its eldritch turretsand then uses Stomp.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the colossus can push the target up to 20 feet away from it.

actions.name: Eldritch Turret
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +18 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. 18 (4d8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc:
The colossus stomps one of its feet at a point on the ground within 20 feet of it. Any creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature is restrained. While restrained in this way, the creature (or another creature within 5 feet of it) can use its action to make a 26 Strength check. On a success, the creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained.
Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

actions.name: Incinerating Beam (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The colossus fires a beam of light in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this beam is disintegrated, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

monsters.name: Warforged Soldier
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

traits.name: Warforged Resilience
traits.desc: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

actions.name: Armblade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Protection
reactions.desc: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monsters.name: Warforged Titan
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Platforms
traits.desc: The warforged titan has two platforms built into its chassis. One Medium or smaller creature can ride on each platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the warforged, they must use spears or weapons with reach and the target must be Large or larger.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The warforged titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warforged titan makes one axehand attack and one hammerfist attack.

actions.name: Axehand
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage, plus 11 (2d10) slashing damage if the target is prone.

actions.name: Hammerfist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Sweeping Axe (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The warforged titan makes a sweep with its axehand, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Warlock of the Archfey

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes two Rapier attacks, or it uses Bewildering Word twice.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bewildering Word
actions.desc: The warlock utters a magical bewilderment, targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 9 (2d8) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the warlock's next turn.

reactions.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, the warlock turns invisible and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spells: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: dancing lights, disguise self, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with animals

spells.1/day each: charm person, dimension door, hold monster

monsters.name: Warlock of the Fiend
monsters.languages: any two languages (usually Abyssal or Infernal)

traits.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: When the warlock makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes three Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Hellfire
actions.desc: Green flame explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of the warlock. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage and 11 (2d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Fiendish Rebuke (3/Day)
reactions.desc: In response to being damaged by a visible creature within 60 feet of it, the warlock forces that creature to make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: alter self, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

monsters: Warlock of the Great Old One

monsters.name: Warlock of the Great Old One

traits.name: Whispering Aura
traits.desc: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlock makes two Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Howling Void
actions.desc: The warlock opens a momentary extraplanar rift within 60 feet of it. The rift is a scream-filled, 20-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is frightened of the warlock until the start of the warlock's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.

spells: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: detect magic, guidance, levitate, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

spells.1/day each: arcane gate, detect thoughts, true seeing

traits.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
traits.desc: The warlord can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

traits.name: Survivor
traits.desc: The warlord regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has fewer than half its hit points but at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The warlord makes two Greatsword or Short bow attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

legendary_actions.name: Command Ally
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. if the target can see and hear the warlord, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary_actions.name: Weapon Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord makes one Greatsword or Shortbow attack.

legendary_actions.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The warlord targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear it, the target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of warlord's next turn.

monsters.name: Wasteland Dragonnel
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The dragonnel doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragonnel makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 20 (5d6 + 3) acid damage.

monsters.name: Wastrilith
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The wastrilith can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Corrupt Water
traits.desc:
At the start of each of the wastrilith's turns, exposed water within 30 feet of it is befouled. Underwater, this effect lightly obscures the area until a current clears it away. Water in containers remains corrupted until it evaporates.
A creature that consumes this foul water or swims in it must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the foul water for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of this time, the poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned until it finishes a long rest.
If another demon drinks the foul water as an action, it gains 11 (2d10) temporary hit points.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The wastrilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wastrilith makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it uses Grasping Spout.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Grasping Spout
actions.desc: The wastrilith magically launches a spout of water at one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 17 Strength saving throw, and it has disadvantage if it's underwater. On a failed save, it takes 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage and is pulled up to 60 feet toward the wastrilith. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

bonus_actions.name: Undertow
bonus_actions.desc: If the wastrilith is underwater, it causes all water within 60 feet of it to be difficult terrain for other creatures until the start of its next turn.

monsters.name: Water Elemental Myrmidon
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Aquan, one language of its creator's choice

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes three Trident attacks.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) force damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Freezing Strikes (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 (1d10) cold damage. A target that is hit by one or more of these attacks has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

monsters.name: Water Weird
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious

traits.name: Invisible in Water
traits.desc: The water weird is invisible while fully immersed in water.

traits.name: Water Bound
traits.desc: The water weird dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13) and pulled 5 feet toward the water weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the water weird tries to drown it, and the water weird can't constrict another target.

monsters.name: Werebat
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (climb 30 ft. fly 60 ft. in bat or hybrid form)
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The werebat can use its action to polymorph into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or into a Large giant bat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Echolocation (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The werebat has blindsight out to a range of 60 feet as long as it's not deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The werebat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Nimble Escape (Humanoid Form Only)
traits.desc: The werebat can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the werebat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: In humanoid form, the werebat makes two scimitar attacks or two shortbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can make one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

actions.name: Bite (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the werebat gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.

actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Werejaguar
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The werejaguar can use its action to polymorph into a jaguar-humanoid hybrid or into a jaguar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The werejaguar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pounce (Jaguar or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: If the werejaguar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the werejaguar can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: In humanoid form, the werejaguar makes two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks. In hybrid form, it can attack like a humanoid or make two claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite (Jaguar or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werejaguar lycanthropy.

actions.name: Claw (Jaguar or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Wereraven
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (fly 50 ft. in raven and hybrid forms)

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The wereraven regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wereraven takes damage from a silvered weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wereraven's next turn. The wereraven dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

actions.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Werevulture
monsters.speed: 30 ft., 10 ft. in vulture form, 30 ft. in hybrid form, fly 0 ft., fly 60 ft. in vulture or hybrid form

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The werevulture regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the werevulture takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the werevulture's next turn. The werevulture dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The werevulture makes two Talon attacks, or it makes a Beak attack and a Talon attack.

actions.name: Beak (Vulture or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed until targeted by the Remove Curse spell or a similar effect. If the cursed target drops to 0 hit points, it becomes a werevulture under the DM's control and regains 10 hit points.

actions.name: Talon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (4d4 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The werevulture polymorphs into a vulture-humanoid hybrid, into a vulture, or back into its humanoid form. Its game statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its humanoid form if it dies.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.desc: The whirlwyrm can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The whirlwyrm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the whirlwyrm can't bite another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the whirlwyrm. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Blurred Form
traits.desc: Attack rolls against the whistler are made with disadvantage unless the whistler is incapacitated.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The whistler doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The whistler makes three Psychic Swipe attacks.

actions.name: Psychic Swipe
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Otherworldly Melody (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The whistler telepathically whistles an otherworldly melody into the minds of up to two creatures it can see within range of its telepathy. Each target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or take 33 (6d10) psychic damage and become frightened of the whistler for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Surreal Step
bonus_actions.desc: The whistler teleports up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: White Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.desc: At the start of its turn, the abishai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Longsword attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage if used with two hands.

reactions.name: Vicious Reprisal
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, the abishai makes one Bite attack against a random creature within 5 feet of it. If no creature is within reach, the abishai moves up to half its speed toward an enemy it can see, without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

monsters.name: White Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) cold damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Chromatic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Chromatic Flare (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm flares with elemental energy. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (5d8) cold damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The dog has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dog's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Flame Seed
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 60 ft., one target you can see. 1d6 + PB fire damage.

actions.name: Fiery Teleportation
actions.desc: The spirit and each willing creature of your choice within 5 feet of it teleport up to 15 feet to unoccupied spaces you can see. Then each creature within 5 feet of the space that the spirit left must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take 1d6 + PB fire damage.

monsters.name: Will-o'-Wells
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Consume Life
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wells can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wells regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.desc: The will-o'-wells can't wear or carry anything.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The will-o'-wells can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.desc: The will-o'-wells sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wells can alter the radius as a bonus action.

actions.name: Shock
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The will-o'-wells and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

actions.name: Magic Boon (Recharges after a Long Rest)
actions.desc: The will-o'-wells grants a boon to one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that isn't an Undead. The boon's recipient gains a d4 and can, at any time within the next 24 hours, roll this die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw made by it. No creature can have more than one of these magic boons at a time.

monsters.name: Wine Weird
monsters.damage_resistances: fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious

traits.name: Invisible in Water
traits.desc: The wine weird is invisible while fully immersed in water.

traits.name: Water Bound
traits.desc: The wine weird dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13) and pulled 5 feet toward the wine weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the wine weird tries to drown it, and the wine weird can't constrict another target.

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the bull moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 19 (3d12) piercing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Dropped Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, one target directly below the kobold. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Self-Sacrifice
reactions.desc: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrull is hit by an attack, the thrull swaps places with that creature and is hit instead.

monsters.name: Winter Eladrin

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sorrowful Presence
traits.desc:
Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.
Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

bonus_actions.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Frigid Rebuke
reactions.desc: When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can force that creature to make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 11 (2d10) cold damage.

spells: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: fog cloud, gust of wind, sleet storm

monsters.name: Witchlight Hand (Medium)

traits.name: Secret Expertise
traits.desc: The hand has one of these additional skills: Acrobatics {@skillCheck acrobatics 6}, Animal Handling {@skillCheck animal_handling 5}, Arcana {@skillCheck arcana 5}, Athletics {@skillCheck athletics 4}, Medicine {@skillCheck medicine 5}, or Performance {@skillCheck performance 5}.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Pixie Dust (1/Day)
actions.desc: The hand sprinkles a pinch of pixie dust on itself or another creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. If the creature is airborne when this effect ends, it falls safely to the ground, taking no damage and landing on its feet.

spells: The hand casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Witchlight Hand (Small)

traits.name: Secret Expertise
traits.desc: The hand has one of these additional skills: Acrobatics {@skillCheck acrobatics 6}, Animal Handling {@skillCheck animal_handling 5}, Arcana {@skillCheck arcana 5}, Athletics {@skillCheck athletics 4}, Medicine {@skillCheck medicine 5}, or Performance {@skillCheck performance 5}.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Pixie Dust (1/Day)
actions.desc: The hand sprinkles a pinch of pixie dust on itself or another creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. If the creature is airborne when this effect ends, it falls safely to the ground, taking no damage and landing on its feet.

spells: The hand casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Witherbloom Apprentice

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The apprentice regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Verdant Talisman
traits.desc: At the end of a 10-minute ritual, the apprentice can touch one willing creature (including itself) and bestow upon it a small talisman imbued with magic. Upon receiving the talisman, the creature gains 10 temporary hit points, and it can add 1d6 to its initiative rolls while it wears the talisman. These benefits last for 1 hour or until the apprentice conducts another ritual to bestow another talisman. When the benefits expire, the talisman crumbles to dust.

actions.name: Briar Vine
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the apprentice can pull it up to 10 feet closer to itself.

reactions.name: Wither Burst
reactions.desc: When the apprentice sees a creature within 30 feet of itself drop to 0 hit points, the apprentice channels the expended life essence and targets another creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target takes 3 (1d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Witherbloom Pledgemage

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: As long as the pledgemage has at least 1 hit point remaining, the pledgemage regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn.

traits.name: Verdant Talisman
traits.desc: At the end of a 10-minute ritual, the pledgemage can touch one willing creature (including itself) and bestow upon it a small talisman imbued with magic. Upon receiving the talisman, the creature gains 10 temporary hit points, and it can add 1d6 to its initiative rolls while it wears the talisman. These benefits last for 1 hour or until the pledgemage conducts another ritual to bestow another talisman. When the benefits expire, the talisman crumbles to dust.

actions.name: Briar Vine
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the apprentice can pull it up to 10 feet closer to itself.

bonus_actions.name: Vociferous Form (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The pledgemage transforms into an avatar of plants and shadow. While in this form, the pledgemage adds its Wisdom modifier to its AC if it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield, and it has advantage on attack rolls against any creature missing hit points. This form lasts for 1 minute or until the pledgemage is reduced to 0 hit points.

reactions.name: Wither Burst
reactions.desc: When the pledgemage sees a creature within 30 feet of itself drop to 0 hit points, the pledgemage channels the expended life essence and targets another creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target takes 3 (1d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

spells.1/day each: death ward, pass without trace, speak with plants

monsters.name: Witherbloom Professor of Decay

traits.name: Essence Transfer (1/Day)
traits.desc: The professor can cast the animate dead spell, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Mortality Spear attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Mortality Spear
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 17 (3d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the professor's next turn.

actions.name: Essence Pulse (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The professor creates a life-draining vortex in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature of the professor's choice that it can see within that area must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 23 (5d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The professor then regains 10 hit points. An affected creature's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.1/day each: antilife shell, bane, feign death, speak with dead

monsters.name: Witherbloom Professor of Growth

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The professor makes two Verdant Lash attacks.

actions.name: Verdant Lash
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet closer to the professor.

actions.name: Summon Nature's Avatar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The professor magically summons a Groff. The groff appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the professor, acts as the professor's ally, and takes its turns immediately after the professor's. The professor can communicate telepathically with this groff while it remains. The groff remains for 10 minutes, until it or the professor dies, or until the professor dismisses it as an action.

spells: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

spells.1/day each: greater restoration, lesser restoration, mass cure wounds, pass without trace, plant growth, revivify

traits.name: Antimagic Cone
traits.desc: The woe strider's open mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 60-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the woe strider decides which way the cone faces and whether its mouth is open or closed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The woe strider makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. If both claws hit the same creature, the target is grappled (escape 14).

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage. In addition, each magic item the creature is carrying that isn't an artifact has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The wood elf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.desc: The wood elf can attempt to {@action hide} even when they are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wood elf makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Wood Elf Wizard

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
actions.desc: The wood elf magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a {@chance 50|50 percent|50% summoning chance} chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The wood elf's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
The wood elf is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The wood elf has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield, witch bolt

traits.name: Plant Camouflage
traits.desc: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.desc: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wood woad makes two Club attacks.

actions.name: Club
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (4d4 + 4) force damage.

monsters.name: Wooden Donkey
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The donkey is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The donkey has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Wretched Sorrowsworn
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Wretched Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The sorrowsworn has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sorrowsworn's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. The sorrowsworn otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage, and the sorrowsworn attaches to the target. While attached, the sorrowsworn can't attack, and at the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, the target takes 6 (1d10 + 1) necrotic damage.
The attached sorrowsworn moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the sorrowsworn's movement. The sorrowsworn can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the sorrowsworn.

monsters.name: Wurm
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 11

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The wurm deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Earth Tremors
traits.desc: The wurm creates earth tremors as it moves overland or underground. Any creature that comes within 30 feet of the moving wurm for the first time on a turn must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Any structure or object anchored to the ground that comes within 30 feet of the moving wurm for the first time on a turn takes 10 (3d6) force damage.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The wurm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 24 (5d6 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the wurm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wurm, and takes 17 (5d6) acid damage at the start of each of the wurm's turns. If the wurm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wurm must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the wurm. If the wurm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d4 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Cloak of the Mountain (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The wynling magically turns invisible, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, for 1 minute or until it makes an attack roll.

reactions.name: Trickster's Flight
reactions.desc: Immediately after a creature the wynling can see misses the wynling with an attack roll, the wynling can move up to 30 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bat.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target, the xvart can push the target 5 feet if the target is a Medium or smaller creature.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Low Cunning
bonus_actions.desc: The xvart takes the {@action Disengage} action.

monsters.name: Xvart Speaker
monsters.languages: Abyssal and one additional language (usually Common or Goblin)

traits.name: Low Cunning
traits.desc: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Overbearing Pack
traits.desc: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Xvart Warlock of Raxivort

traits.name: Raxivort's Blessing
traits.desc: When the xvart reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the xvart gains 4 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Raxivort's Tongue
traits.desc: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bat.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The xvart makes two Scimitar or Raxivort's Bite attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Raxivort's Bite
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +3 to hit, range 30 ft., one creature. 7 (1d10 + 2) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Low Cunning
bonus_actions.desc: The xvart takes the {@action Disengage} action.

spells: The xvart casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

spells.At will: detect magic, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

traits.name: Blood Aegis
traits.desc: The AC of Y'demi includes her Constitution modifier while she isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

traits.name: Oriq Mask
traits.desc: Y'demi wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, Y'demi can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and she adds double her proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

traits.name: Sanguine Sense
traits.desc: While Y'demi isn't blinded, she can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within 60 feet of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Y'demi makes two Blood Lash attacks.

actions.name: Blood Lash
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the Y'demi's next turn.

actions.name: Blood Boil (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Y'demi chooses a point within 150 feet of itself, and a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of Y'demi's choice that she can see in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Sanguine Tentacles (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The blood in the copper basin disappears as tentacles of congealed blood fill a 10-foot cube centered at a point on the ground that Y'demi can see within 15 feet of her. The effect lasts for 1 minute, during which time that area is difficult terrain. Any creature entering that area for the first time on a turn or starting its turn there must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained by the tentacles. A creature that starts its turn restrained by the tentacles takes 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. A creature restrained by the tentacles can use its action to make either a 13 Strength (Athletics) check or a 13 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, ending the restrained condition on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Yagnoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yagnoloth makes one Electrified Touch attack and one Massive Arm attack, or it makes one Massive Arm attack and uses Battlefield Cunning, if available, or Teleport.

actions.name: Electrified Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

actions.name: Massive Arm
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 23 (3d12 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

actions.name: Battlefield Cunning (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Up to two allied yugoloths within 60 feet of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.desc: The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within 15 feet of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The yagnoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The yagnoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), suggestion

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Yakfolk Priest

traits.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc:
The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.
The possession lasts until either the body drops to 0 hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yakfolk makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Summon Earth Elemental (1/Day)
actions.desc: The yakfolk summons an earth elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner and acts as an ally of the summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

spells: The yakfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bane, command, cure wounds, sanctuary

spells.3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, protection from energy, sending

traits.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc:
The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.
The possession lasts until either the body drops to 0 hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yakfolk makes two attacks, either with its greatsword or its longbow.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Yeenoghu
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes three Flail attacks.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 22 (2d12 + 9) force damage. If it's his turn, Yeenoghu can cause the target to suffer one of the following additional effects, each of which he can apply only once per turn

actions.name: Confusion
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the confusion spell until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

actions.name: Force
actions.desc: The target takes an extra 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Paralysis
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) acid damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rampage
bonus_actions.desc: When Yeenoghu reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, he moves up to half his speed and makes one Bite attack.

legendary_actions.name: Charge
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu moves up to his speed.

legendary_actions.name: Swat Away
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes one Flail attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a 24 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line away from Yeenoghu. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Yeenoghu makes a separate Bite attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

spells: Yeenoghu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the creeper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary flowering vine.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The creeper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the creeper takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The creeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Touch
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 13 (3d8) psychic damage. If the target is a humanoid that drops to 0 hit points as a result of this damage, it dies and is implanted with a yellow musk creeper bulb. Unless the bulb is destroyed, the corpse animates as a yellow musk zombie after being dead for 24 hours. The bulb is destroyed if the creature is raised from the dead before it can transform into a yellow musk zombie, or if the corpse is targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic before it animates.

actions.name: Yellow Musk (3/Day)
actions.desc: The creeper's flowers release a strong musk that targets all humanoids within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the creeper for 1 minute. A creature charmed in this way does nothing on its turn except move as close as it can to the creeper. A creature charmed by the creeper can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 +the damage taken, unless the damage is fire or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Yeth Hound
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons
monsters.languages: understands Common, Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak

traits.name: Sunlight Banishment
traits.desc: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

actions.name: Baleful Baying
actions.desc: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within 300 feet of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Yeti
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.desc: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.desc: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fear of Fire
traits.desc: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Snow Camouflage
traits.desc: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Frost Brand Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

actions.name: Chilling Gaze
actions.desc: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.
