monsters.name: Yochlol
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yochlol can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a female drow or giant spider, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yochlol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The yochlol can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The yochlol ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yochlol makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Slam (Bite in Spider Form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. (10 feet in demon form), one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning (piercing in spider form) damage plus 21 (6d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Mist Form
actions.desc:
The yochlol transforms into toxic mist or reverts to its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is also transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
While in mist form, the yochlol is incapacitated and can't speak. It has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can pass through any space that isn't airtight. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to nonmagical damage.
While in mist form, the yochlol can enter a creature's space and stop there. Each time that creature starts its turn with the yochlol in its space, the creature must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated.

spells: The yochlol's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The yochlol can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

actions.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

spells.1/day each: blink, dispel magic, protection from evil and good, sending

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.desc:
If a creature starts its turn within 15 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a 12 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the  greater restoration spell or other magic.
A creature that isn't {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.
If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

traits.desc: The wereraven regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wereraven takes damage from a silvered weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wereraven's next turn. The wereraven dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

actions.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Abomination
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Large snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or three melee attacks, but can use its bite and constrict attacks only once each.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Scimitar (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Abomination Form Only)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

spells: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Anathema
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 21

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
traits.desc: Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathama's aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Six Heads
traits.desc: The anathema has advantage on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack (Anathema Form Only)
actions.desc: The anathema makes two Claw attacks and one Flurry of Bites attack.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Flurry of Bites (Anathema Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Constrict (Snake Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and it takes 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The anathema can constrict only one creature at a time.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The anathema transforms into a Huge constrictor snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

actions.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature.
The target must make a 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The rakshasa's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Martial Prowess (1/Turn)
traits.desc: When the rakshasa hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage of the weapon's type, and the creature must make a 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to 10 feet away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa's choice.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rakshasa makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Zaratan
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Bite attack and one Stomp attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 26 (3d10 + 10) thunder damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +17 to hit, range 120 ft./240 ft., one target. 31 (6d8 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Spew Debris (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
bonus_actions.desc: After moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan sends a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is {@status concentration||concentrating} must succeed on a 25 Constitution saving throw or the creature's {@status concentration} is broken. The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is restrained, requiring a successful 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become trapped.

legendary_actions.name: Stomp
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Stomp attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Spit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Spit Rock attack.

legendary_actions.name: Retract (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan emerges from its shell and makes one Spit Rock attack. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede Zariel's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Zariel regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Zariel makes three Flail or Longsword attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Horrid Touch, if available.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) radiant damage, or 19 (2d10 + 8) radiant damage when used with two hands, plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Horrid Touch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 44 (8d10) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is blinded and deafened. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Zariel uses Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to burn. The target must succeed on a 26 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

spells: Zariel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 26):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), major image, wall of fire

spells.3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Zegana

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: Zegana can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Zegana fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Zegana has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Prime Speaker's Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the trident emits a thunderous boom. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from the prongs of the trident must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from Zegana. If the creature is underwater, the damage is increased to 13 (3d8). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

actions.name: Deluge (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: Zegana conjures a wave of water that crashes down on an area within 120 feet of her. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground, extinguishing unprotected flames it comes in contact with, and then vanishes.

legendary_actions.name: Adaptive Skin
legendary_actions.desc: Zegana gains resistance to one damage type of her choice-acid, fire, lightning, or thunder-until the start of her next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Trident
legendary_actions.desc: Zegana makes one melee attack with the Prime Speaker's Trident.

legendary_actions.name: Enlarge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Zegana casts enlarge/reduce on herself, using the enlarge option, without expending a spell slot.

legendary_actions.name: Deluge (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Zegana uses Deluge, if available.

spells: Zegana is a 15th-level Simic spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): acid splash, druidcraft, ray of frost, shape water

spells.1st level (4 slots): color spray, expeditious retreat, fog cloud, shield

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
traits.desc: The adept can move through the space of a medium of larger creature.

traits.name: Brave
traits.desc: The adept has advantage on any saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:

actions.name: The target must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).
The target must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.
The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the adept's next turn.
Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Deflect Missile
reactions.desc: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the adept deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 3. If the damage is reduced to 0, the adept catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the adept has a hand free.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thug makes two melee attacks

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Zodar
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Disembodied Voice
traits.desc: Up to three times in its life, the zodar can cause a message of up to twenty-five words to issue from the air around it. It speaks only when it has something profoundly important to say, and the message can be understood by any creature that has an Intelligence score of 2 or higher.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the zodar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Transport Inhibitor
traits.desc: The zodar can't be teleported or sent to any plane of existence against its will.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The zodar doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zodar makes two Crushing Fist attacks. Before or after these attacks, the zodar uses Forced Teleport.

actions.name: Crushing Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Forced Teleport
actions.desc: The zodar magically warps space around one creature it can see within 60 feet of itself. The target must make a 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) force damage, and the zodar teleports it, along with any equipment it's wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that the zodar can see and that can support the target. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

actions.name: Wish
actions.desc: The zodar casts the wish spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17). After casting this spell, the zodar turns to dust and is destroyed.

monsters.name: Zombie Clot
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Deathly Stench
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) poison damage and be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zombie makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Flesh Entomb (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The zombie flings a detached clump of corpses at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or take 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it becomes entombed in dead flesh.
A creature entombed in the dead flesh is restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the dead flesh, and takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can be freed if the dead flesh is destroyed. The dead flesh is a Large object with AC 10, 25 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

monsters.name: Zombie Plague Spreader
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Viral Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the plague spreader must make a 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned and can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this plague spreader's Viral Aura for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The plague spreader makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Virulent Miasma (1/Day)
actions.desc: The plague spreader releases toxic gas in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises as a zombie (see its stat block in the Monster Manual) 1 minute later. The zombie acts immediately after the plague spreader in the initiative count.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The zorbo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.desc: The zorbo magically absorbs the natural strength of its surroundings, adjusting its Armor Class based on the material it is standing or climbing on: AC 15 for wood or bone, AC 17 for earth or stone, or AC 19 for metal. If the zorbo isn't in contact with any of these substances, its AC is 10.

actions.name: Destructive Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature wearing armor, carrying a shield, or in possession of a magic item that improves its AC, it must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, one such item worn or carried by the creature (the target's choice) magically deteriorates, taking a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers, and the zorbo gains a +1 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield or magic item that drops to a 0 AC increase is destroyed.

monsters.name: Zuggtmoy
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Zuggtmoy makes three Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy, which lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a quaggoth spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be.

bonus_actions.name: Mind Control Spores (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Humanoids and Beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, a creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of Zuggtmoy for 24 hours. While infected in this way, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.

reactions.name: Protective Thrall
reactions.desc: When Zuggtmoy is hit by an attack roll, one creature within 10 feet of her that is charmed by her is hit by the attack instead.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy makes one Pseudopod attack.

legendary_actions.name: Exert Will
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by Zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction, if a available, to move up to its speed as she directs or to make one weapon attack against a target that she designates.

spells: Zuggtmoy casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 22):

spells.At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants

monsters.name: Adult Crystal Dragon
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 15 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Starlight Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases a searing beam of starlight at a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 31 (9d6) radiant damage.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.1/day each: command, divination, hypnotic pattern, lesser restoration

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: The amphisbaena has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The amphisbaena makes two bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Ancient Crystal Dragon
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 25

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 49 (11d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 25 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Starlight Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases a searing beam of starlight at a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 38 (11d6) radiant damage.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 19):

spells.1/day each: command, divination, greater restoration, hypnotic pattern, invisibility

monsters.name: Animated Broom
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 7

traits.name: False Object
traits.desc: If the broom is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the broom move or act, that creature must succeed on a 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the broom is animate.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The broom doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The broom makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Broomstick
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Ankylosaurus
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Annis Hag

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The annis makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Crushing Hug
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 15) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 36 (9d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hag's turns. The hag can't make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

spells: The hag casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.3/day each: disguise self (including the form of a Medium Humanoid), Fog cloud

monsters.name: Apprentice

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Burning Hands (1st-Level Spell; 2/Day)
actions.desc: You shoot forth a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

actions.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

spells: You cast one of the following wizard spells (spell save 11), using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the assassin vine remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. The target takes 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and it is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and it takes 21 (6d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The vine can constrict only one target at a time.

actions.name: Entangling Vines
actions.desc: The assassin vine can animate normal vines and roots on the ground in a 15-foot square within 30 feet of it. These plants turn the ground in that area into difficult terrain. A creature in that area when the effect begins must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be restrained by entangling vines and roots. A creature restrained by the plants can use its action to make a 13 Strength (Athletics) check, freeing itself on a successful check. The effect ends after 1 minute or when the assassin vine dies or uses Entangling Vines again.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The aurumvorax can burrow through solid rock and metal at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aurumvorax makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature wearing armor of any type, the aurumvorax regains 4 (1d6 + 1) hit points.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 12). Until this grapple ends, the aurumvorax can't use its Claw attack on another target, and when it moves, it can drag the grappled creature with it, without the aurumvorax's speed being halved.

monsters.name: Babau
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The babau makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting or Weakening Gaze.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

actions.name: Weakening Gaze
actions.desc: The babau targets one creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The babau casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 11):

spells.At will: darkness, dispel magic, fear, heat metal, levitate

monsters.name: Banshee
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Detect Life
traits.desc: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

actions.name: Corrupting Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage
actions.desc: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Wail (1/Day)
actions.desc: The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Barghest
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15
monsters.languages: Abyssal, Common, Goblin, Infernal, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Fire Banishment
traits.desc: When the barghest starts its turn engulfed in flames that are at least 10 feet high or wide, it must succeed on a 15 Charisma saving throw or be instantly banished to Gehenna

traits.name: Soul Feeding
traits.desc: The barghest can feed on the corpse of a Fey or Humanoid it killed within the past 10 minutes. This feeding takes at least 1 minute, and it destroys the corpse. The victim's soul is trapped in the barghest for 24 hours, after which time it is digested and the person is incapable of being revived. If the barghest dies before the soul is digested, the soul is released. While a soul is trapped in the barghest, any magic that tries to restore the soul to life has a {@chance 50} chance of failing and being wasted.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The barghest makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The barghest transforms into a Small goblin or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The barghest reverts to its true form if it dies.

spells: The barghest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.At will: levitate, minor illusion, pass without trace

monsters.name: Bodak
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Death Gaze
traits.desc:
When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save.
Unless {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The bodak doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Withering Gaze
actions.desc: One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Aura of Annihilation
bonus_actions.desc: The bodak activates or deactivates this deathly aura. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and Fiends ignore this effect.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

actions.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

monsters.name: Cave Bear
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.desc: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Retract Filament
actions.desc: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

bonus_actions.name: Adhesive Filament
bonus_actions.desc: The cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. The filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

traits.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

traits.name: Boneless
traits.desc: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The choker makes two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monsters.name: Clockwork Dragon
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the clockwork dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a metal statue.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The clockwork dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Poor Depth Perception
traits.desc: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cyclops makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Demilich
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from magic weapons
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, stunned

traits.name: Avoidance
traits.desc: If the demilich is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The demilich is immune to effects that turn undead.

actions.name: Howl (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The demilich emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the demilich that can hear the howl must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: The demilich targets up to three creatures that it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, and the demilich regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

legendary_actions.name: Flight
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary_actions.name: Cloud of Dust
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich magically swirls its dusty remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the demilich, including around a corner, must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the demilich's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the demilich's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature with in 30 feet of the demilich must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 (3d6). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the  greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary_actions.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The demilich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Imprison Soul
actions.desc: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Dullahan
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the dullahan is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 hit points. In addition, it summons three death's head, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the dullahan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The dullahan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dullahan makes two attacks.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the dullahan scores a critical hit against a creature, the target must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or the dullahan cuts off the target's head. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature that doesn't have or need a head, or has legendary actions, instead takes an extra 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fiery Skull
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The dullahan makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Frightful Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dullahan until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Head Hunt (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dullahan moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one Battleaxe attack with advantage. If the attack hits, but is not a critical hit, the attack deals an extra 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

mythic_actions.desc: If the dullahan's Headless Summoning trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Coordinated Assault
mythic_actions.desc: The dullahan makes a Battleaxe attack, and then one death's head the dullahan can see within 30 feet of it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

mythic_actions.name: Headless Wail (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: An echoing shriek issues from the dullahan's headless stump. Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 10 feet of it must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If one or more creatures fail the saving throw, the dullahan gains 10 temporary hit points.

monsters.name: Dybbuk
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The dybbuk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dybbuk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is also reduced by 3 (1d6). This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Possess Corpse (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dybbuk disappears into an intact corpse within 5 feet of it that belonged to a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid. The dybbuk gains 20 temporary hit points. While possessing the corpse, the dybbuk adopts the corpse's size and can't use Incorporeal Movement. Its game statistics otherwise remain the same. The possession lasts until the temporary hit points are lost or the dybbuk ends it as a bonus action. When the possession ends, the dybbuk appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse.

bonus_actions.name: Control Corpse
bonus_actions.desc: While Possess Corpse is active, the dybbuk makes the corpse do something unnatural, such as vomit blood, twist its head all the way around, or cause a quadruped to move as a biped. Any Beast or Humanoid that sees this behavior must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dybbuk for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this ability is immune to Control Corpse for 24 hours.

spells: The dybbuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Flumph
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.languages: understands Undercommon but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Advanced Telepathy
traits.desc: The flumph can perceive the content of any telepathic communication used within 60 feet of it, and it can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} by creatures with any form of telepathy.

traits.name: Prone Deficiency
traits.desc: If the flumph is knocked prone, roll a die. On an odd result, the flumph lands upside-down and is incapacitated. At the end of each of its turns, the flumph can make a 10 Dexterity saving throw, righting itself and ending the incapacitated condition if it succeeds.

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The flumph is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.

actions.name: Tendrils
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 2 (1d4) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

actions.name: Stench Spray (1/Day)
actions.desc: Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from the flumph must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or be coated in a foul-smelling liquid. A coated creature exudes a horrible stench for 1d4 hours. The coated creature is poisoned as long as the stench lasts, and other creatures are poisoned while with in 5 feet of the coated creature. A creature can remove the stench on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shock Susceptibility
traits.desc: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The froghemoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks, and it can use Tongue.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.
The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth.

traits.name: Drone
traits.desc: When it beats its wings, the dragonfly emits a loud droning sound that can be heard out to a range of 120 feet.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The dragonfly halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The turtle can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Stable
traits.desc: Whenever an effect knocks the turtle prone, it can make a 10 Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked prone. A prone turtle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a 10 Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Proboscis
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the tick attaches to the target. While attached, the tick can't make Proboscis attacks. The tick can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. As an action, a creature within reach of the tick can try to detach the tick, doing so with a successful 13 Strength check.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: The tick deals 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage to one creature it is physically attached to, provided that creature isn't a Construct or an Undead, or 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage if the creature is a Giant. The tick regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gnoll makes two Bite, Spear, or Longbow attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Rampage
bonus_actions.desc: After the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll moves up to half its speed and makes a Bite attack.

monsters.name: Hound Archon

traits.name: Aura of Menace
traits.desc: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the archon must make a 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The archon makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a Shining Blade attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

actions.name: Shining Blade (True Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The archon magically transforms into any Medium or Large dog or wolf while retaining its game statistics (other than its size and losing its Shining Blade attack). The archon reverts to its true form if reduced to 0 hit points or if it uses a bonus action to do so.

spells: The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:

monsters.name: Intellect Devourer
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12
monsters.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Detect Sentience
traits.desc: The intellect devourer can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The intellect devourer makes one attack with its claws and uses Devour Intellect.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Devour Intellect
actions.desc: The intellect devourer targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it that has a brain. The target must succeed on a 12 Intelligence saving throw against this magic or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage. Also on a failure, roll 3d6: If the total equals or exceeds the target's Intelligence score, that score is reduced to 0. The target is stunned until it regains at least one point of Intelligence.

actions.name: Body Thief
actions.desc:
The intellect devourer initiates an Intelligence contest with an incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it that isn't protected by protection from evil and good. If it wins the contest, the intellect devourer magically consumes the target's brain, teleports into the target's skull, and takes control of the target's body. While inside a creature, the intellect devourer has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The intellect devourer retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as its understanding of Deep Speech, its telepathy, and its traits. It otherwise adopts the target's statistics. It knows everything the creature knew, including spells and languages.
If the host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the body drives the intellect devourer out. The intellect devourer is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a wish. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the intellect devourer can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies, unless its brain is restored within 1 round.

monsters.name: Jabberwock
monsters.speed: 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 30 ft., swim 30 ft.

traits.name: Confusing Burble
traits.desc: The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:
The creature does nothing.
The creature does nothing except use all its movement to move in a random direction.
The creature either makes one melee attack against a random creature it can see or does nothing if no visible creature is within its reach.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The jabberwock regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Uncanny Tracker
traits.desc: The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The jabberwock makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Fiery Gaze (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Unless it is blinded, the jabberwock emits a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of fire from its eyes. Each creature in that line must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The jabberwock makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Rend Attack (2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The jabberwock makes one Rend attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The kelpie can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Seaweed Shape
traits.desc: The kelpie can use its action to reshape its body into the form of a humanoid or beast that is Small, Medium, or Large. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged. The disguise is convincing, unless the kelpie is in bright light or the viewer is within 30 feet of it, in which case the seams between the seaweed strands are visible. The kelpie returns to its true form if takes a bonus action to do so or if it dies.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the kelpie remains motionless in its true form, it is indistinguishable from normal seaweed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kelpie makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 12).

actions.name: Drowning Hypnosis
actions.desc:
The kelpie chooses one humanoid it can see within 150 feet of it. If the target can see the kelpie, the target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed while the kelpie maintains {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The charmed target is incapacitated, and instead of holding its breath underwater, it tries to breathe normally and immediately runs out of breath, unless it can breathe water. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the kelpie, the target must move on its turn toward the kelpie by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks.
Before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the kelpie or drowning, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this kelpie's hypnosis for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Kolyarut
monsters.damage_resistances: thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The kolyarut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the kolyarut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The kolyarut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kolyarut makes four Unerring Blade attacks.

actions.name: Unerring Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 24 force damage plus one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 1-2: Disarm
actions.desc: The target drops one item it is holding of the kolyarut's choice.

actions.name: 3-4: Imbalance
actions.desc: The target can't take reactions until the start of the kolyarut's next turn.

actions.name: 5-6: Push
actions.desc: If the target is Large or smaller, the target is pushed up to 15 feet away from the kolyarut.

actions.name: Edict of Blades (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The kolyarut moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can make one Unerring Blade attack against each creature it moves past.
